loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame B. is married and has three children. She has been through senior high school. Her husband is a driver.

Maame sells slippers by moving from one area to another at Takoradi and uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. She will use the loan to purchase additional slippers to sell.

With the new profits from her expanded business, Maame plans to save to invest in the cooking of rice for sale which is going to serve as an additional trade.

loans.use: To purchase more slippers to sell

loans.name: Ney Laurentino

texts.es:
Ney de 36 años, vive en una zona urbana “Las Orquídeas” llamado así porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas, tiene un puesto de venta de encebollado (plato típico del ecuador). 

Desde pequeño el comenzó a preparar encebollado para tener su propio negocio. Con esfuerzo obtuvo un puesto de comida en una principal comercial. Poco a poco a mantenido a su familia, trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 00h00pm. El encebollado contiene pescado, cebollas, yucas, llevar, es común en el desayuno.    

Para poder hacer mas encebollado el quiere comprar con el préstamo pescado y un congelador. En el futuro quiere tener un local y ser reconocido en el mercado de comidas típicas.
texts.en:
Ney is 36 years old and lives in an urban area called “Las Orquídeas,” (The Orchids) named so because there were many orchids in the area when it was first discovered. He has a food stall where he sells “encebollado” (a typical Ecuadorean dish). He’s been cooking encebollado since he was very young, so that he could have his own business. With great effort, he obtained his food stall in a main commercialized zone. Little by little he’s been able to support his family. He works from 8:00 AM to midnight. Encebollado is made with fish, onions, and yucca and is a common breakfast food. He wants to use the money from this loan to buy more fish and a freezer. In the future he wants to have a small eatery and become known in the food market.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fish and refrigerator

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Miriam, tiene 24 años, es madre soltera y a pesar de los inconvenientes que pasa está feliz de tener a su hijo Smith de 4 añitos, él es su razón de vivir; ambos viven en una casa alquilada ubicada en la selva peruana (localidad de Cahuide). Desde muy niña se dedicó a la siembra de café; sus padres le enseñaron cultivarla y cuidarla; con el pasar del tiempo ella aprendió ahorrar para poder tener su propio terreno de cultivo; donde comenzó sembrando plátano; los cuales vende a un comerciante de la misma zona, ahora ella viaja al mercado central de su ciudad, para ofrecer café. Miriam no cuenta con la ayuda de nadie pero eso no le atemoriza, sino al contrario le da fuerzas para salir adelante, pues está segura que con esfuerzo y optimismo; logrará sacar adelante a su hijo. En adelante, piensa abrir una tienda de productos de primera necesidad y así poder ayudar habitantes de su localidad, ya que no existe una tienda similar y la lejanía con la ciudad, impide la compra de los productos de consumo diario. Es el tercer crédito con MFP y señala que desde que empezó a trabajar con su banco comunal, siente su progreso, por eso piensa integrarse más con ellos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de 40 sacos de abono, para el café que esta sembrando lo cual asciende a la suma de dos mil nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Miriam is a 24 years old, single mother.  In spite of the inconveniences of being a single mother, she is happy to have her son Smith, who is 4 years old.  He is her reason for living.  They both live in a rented house located in the Peruvian jungle (in the town of Cahuide).  Since she was a young girl she has grown coffee.  Her parents taught her how to cultivate it and care for it.  With time, she learned to save in order to purchase a piece of land to farm.  She started growing bananas and sold them to a merchant in her same region and now, she travels to the central market in the city to sell her coffee.  Miriam has no one to help her, but this doesn't discourage her.  On the contrary, it gives her strength to strive to get ahead since she is sure that with hard work and optimism she will be able to provide for her son.  

Her plans are to open a store that sells basic necessities to be able to help the residents of her town since there isn't one there and they are far from the city.  This prevents them from being able to purchase goods daily.  This is her third loan with MFP and she notes that since she has started working with her communal bank she has been able mark her progress.  For this reason she plans to integrate more with them.  She will use the 2000 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency) that she is requesting to buy 40 bags of fertilizer for the coffee that she is planting

loans.use: To purchase 40 bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Limber

texts.es: El Sr. Limber Vive en localidad de el Torno distante a 39 km de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, es nacido en la provincia florida, de los valles cruceños, se dedica a la construcción de casas en la ciudad, es albañil hace unos dos año, el destino del crédito es para comprar una motocicleta y realizar el servicio de transporte urbano, ya que su actividad en algunas épocas es baja, por lo que alternara con esta nueva actividad, vive en la casa de su madre, su esposa se dedica a la agricultura, en la localidad de Guarayos, del departamento de Santa Cruz, no tienen hijo , pero su esposa tiene una pequeña de su antiguo esposo, ya que quedo viuda y recién están haciendo una vida juntos, el Sr. Limber es una persona muy Trabajadora, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Limber lives in the region of Torno, located at a distance of 39 kilometers from the city of Santa Cruz. He was born in the province of Florida, in the Valles Crucenos region. He is a construction worker who builds houses in the city. He has been in the business for about two years. The loan will be used to purchase a motorcycle to provide public transport in the city, this business to supplement his income for those times he finds himself between construction contracts. He lives together with his mother. His wife is an agriculturist in the city of Guarayos, in the region of Santa Cruz. He doesn't have any children but his wife has a little girl from her first husband. She was widowed but they are building a life together. Limber is a very hard working person and he is very grateful with the organization for their support.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Chiquillas De San Gabriel Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Chiquillas D. San Gabriel, porque se ubica en la comunidad D. San Gabriel las P., Morelos México. Esta comunidad se distingue por su exuberante naturaleza, una ex hacienda y un balneario que lo hacen ser un atractivo turístico, este grupo esta conformado por 10 integrantes.La Sra. Gabriela B., es la tesorera del grupo tiene 39 años, estudio hasta el 2º D. año D. primaria, es comerciante, tiene un total D. 5 hijos: 4 mujeres y un varón, ella se dedica a la venta D. perfumes y cobertores, negocio que inicio hace 10 años, solicita el préstamo para comprar cobertores y venderlos  porque  se aproxima la temporada D. invierno, al momento D. solicitar el préstamo se siente muy contenta porque será su primer crédito,  las ganancias que obtenga  las invertirá en  una  mejor  educación para sus hijos , ya que tres D. ellos aún van a la escuela.
texts.en:
This group is called “Chiquillas D. San Gabriel” (Youngsters from San Gabriel) because the members are from the community of San Gabriel Las P. in the State of Morelos, Mexico. This community is distinguished by its exuberant nature, an old hacienda, and a resort that make it a tourist attraction.

The group consists of ten members. Sra. Gabriela B. is the group treasurer. She is 39 years old and has a second graD. education. Gabriela is a businesswoman who has five children, four daughters and a son. She sells perfumes and blankets. Gabriela has been in business for ten years and is requesting a loan to buy blankets to sell for the upcoming winter season. Upon submitting her request, she felt very happy because this will be her first loan. The earnings she generates will be invested in a better education for her children since three of them are still in school.

loans.use: Purchase blankets to sell for the winter season

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La señora Lidia es socia del banco comunal El Arenal, del distrito de Callería, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 64 años de edad,  está casada y tiene 6 hijos mayores.
La señora Lidia hace 14 años comenzó con el negocio de la madera, junto con su esposo que ha estado a su lado todos estos años de trabajo.  Gracias a los ingresos de este negocio han podido construir su casa y cubierto los gastos de educación de sus 6 hijos que ahora ya son profesionales.
Estos últimos años se ha dedicado al servicio de alquiler de bicicletas, pero también se compró 2 moto car para poner trabajar  en transporte, del cual recibe una feria (pago) de S/. 20.00 soles diarios.  Además vende aceite y cera.
Con éste préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 soles,  la señora Lidia va a comprar repuestos y un motor nuevo para su moto car.
La señora Lidia se siente muy feliz porque gracias a los préstamos de Manuela Ramos ha logrado que sus hijos sean profesionales y que ella, a su edad, este tranquila porque no depende de nadie y todavía quiere seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lidia is a member of the community bank El Arenal, in the district of Calleria, Department of Ucayali. She is 64 years old, married and has 4 adult children.
Mrs. Lidia started in the wood business 14 years ago, along with her husband who has been working with her shoulder to shoulder all these years. Thanks to the income from this business, she has been able to build her house and support the education expenses for her children who are all professionals now.
In the last few years she has been focusing on the service of bicycle rentals, but she also bought 2 moto-taxis for the business of public transportation from which she receives a daily revenue of S/. 20 Soles. She also sells oil and wax.
With this loan of S/. 1,500 Soles, Mrs. Lidia will buy repair parts and a new motor for her moto-taxi.
Mrs. Lidia feels very happy because thanks to the loans from Manuela Ramos she helped her children to become professionals, and at her age she is worry-free because she is self-sufficient and wants to continue working.

loans.use: Bur motor and repair parts

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LLANKACHINAPAC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Rosa; ella tiene 38 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes la cual se encuentra ubicado en el terminal terrestre de Urubamba, siendo esta la única actividad que realiza por el momento y de esta manera la socia saca a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar su negocio con mas variedad de productos para su tienda como flores dulces,galletas,tortas,chocolates entre otros.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa is a member of the LLANKACHINAPEC communal bank.  The bank is located in the Urubamba district in Urubamba province, Cusco department.  She is 38 years old, in a common law marriage with 2 children.  She splits her time between her daily activities and her grocery store, located in the Urubamba bus terminal.  This is the only work she does for the moment, and it is thus that she supports her family.

Mrs. Rosa is asking for the loan to stock her store with a greater variety of products such as flores dulces, cookies, cakes, and chocolates among other things.

She thanks those who are a part of this dream and she promises to make her payments at the rate set out.

loans.use: Stock her store with a greater variety of products, including flores dulces, cookies, cakes, and chocolates among others.

loans.name: Auntie Monica

texts.en: Auntie Monica M. is married and has five dependents. Monica sells rice, canned tomatoes, cooking oil and other items at Abura, which she has been doing for some time now. Her husband is a security man at the University of Cape Coast. She uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. She will use the loan to purchase more rice, cooking oil and other items to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Monica plans to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: purchase more rice, cooking oil and other items

loans.name: Dorjgotov

texts.en: Dorjgotov B. is 47 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Bayanhongor province in Mongolia. His family lives in a ger (a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent). His oldest daughter is a university student and the younger two children both attend a local school. His wife operates a bakery in town. She produces a variety of pastries and breads from home to supplement the family's income. She started her business in 1992 making only one kind of bread and after years of operation she has expanded her business by increasing her product line. For the future, Dorjgotov's wife plans to open her own workplace in a rented space in the centre of town. Dorjgotov operates an iron crafts and welding service. He has been engaged in this business since 1990 and has gained a lot of experience as a craftsman over the years. Dorjgotov is a hardworking man and says, "Our dream is to establish a big factory that can provide a variety of bakeries to our local market." He is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrik loan in order to purchase flour for his wife's bakery business (60% of the loan) and steels/irons for his iron craft business (40% of the loan).

loans.use: To purchase flour for his wife's bakery business and steels/irons

loans.name: Muqqadas' Group

texts.en:
Muqqadas belongs to Depalpur which is a small city located in Punjab Pakistan and famous for its dairy industry. She lives there with her family in the area named Chorasta for past 8 years. 
She is a housewife and stays at home and does her household responsibilities. 
She is only 20 years old and married in very early age. Her husband’s name is M. K. and he operates an electric shop in the market. Through the shop, he not only sells electric supplies like bulbs, tube-lights, wires but also offers electricity repairing services to his customers. He is operating this business for past 5 years. 
Muqqadas is very supportive lady in nature. She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner, Asasah for her husband who will utilize the loan to buy electric supplies for his electric shop.  
Muqqadas is hopeful that an investment will take her husband’s business to more profitable position and she will be able to send her elder son to school that is 4 years old and is in school going age. Her younger son is  just one year old. 
She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application.

loans.use: To buy electric supplies for electic shop

loans.name: Him

texts.en: Him P., 51, is married and lives with four of her children in Takeo province. She and her husband are farmers who typically make about US$2 each day and are supported by three children working in the garment factory with an income of US$3 each. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year, and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Him P. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US$600 to raise cows. She is confident that this loan will allow her to increase her daily income and to better support her family.

loans.use: Raise cows.

loans.name: Umujima

texts.en: H. is currently in the business of selling clothes. She is 42 years old, a widow with no children. H. borrowed a loan to stock more clothes to sell. With extra profits from her business, H. hopes to construct a house in the future.

loans.use: stock more clothes to sell

loans.name: Moeurng

texts.en:
Moeurng V. has been in the farming business for many years in Kompong Tom province. She learned this skill from her grandparents when she was young. She can make an average profit of $2.5 a day to help support her whole family. Moeurng Voeurngwas previously married, but has been divorced from her husband for many years. She has two single children, and two married children. Three of her children are employed in different occupations, and they always share their earnings with her.

In addition to farming, Moeurng V. also sells fish-paste for additional income. To improve her selling business, Moeurng V. would like to request a loan to buy more fish-paste to sell.

loans.use: To buy fish-paste to sell

loans.name: Edik

texts.en:
Edik G. was born in 1966. He lives in Ijevan city. Edik is married and has three children. His elder daughter is married and lives separately.  His younger daughter and his son go to school. Edik’s wife is at home. 
Since 1990, Edik has engaged in auto servicing. Now he is renting a workshop where he repairs cars, but he also has his own dilapidated workshop.  He is asking for a 600.000 AMD loan to reconstruct this workshop. This will allow him to run his business at his own workshop and thus cut down his business expenses.
This is Edik’s third loan from Nor Horizon.

loans.use: To reconstruct his dilapidated workshop

loans.name: Elyn

texts.en:
Elyn M. is from the village of Villa Verde, Iligan City. She is 31 years old. Elyn is married and has five school-aged children. Elyn owns and operates an ice cream shop. The main source of income for the business comes from making & selling a variety of ice creams in several flavors in the local community. Elyn has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2010, Elyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Elyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to expand the business. Elyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional ingredients for ice cream & as working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Elyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for ice cream

location.town: Villaverde, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Mhammad

texts.en:
Mhammad is 33 years old and married. He is the father of three children. Mhammad lives with his family in Nabatieh. 

He works in repairing washing machines and electronic appliances with 23 years of experience. He was very small when he started working, and it was all for the sake of helping his family with their income and expenses.

Mhammad is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the forth time, in order to buy tools useful for fixing the machines he repairs. His previous loans had a great effect on his social and economic life. 

He hopes to give his children the best education they deserve, in addition to a happy childhood.
He hopes to expand his business and start selling new washing machines and other home appliances.

loans.use: to buy tools for fixing the machines he repairs.

loans.name: Roger

texts.en:
Roger A. is a 43-year-old, married man from the village of Dolores Clarin Misamis Occidental. He and his wife have two school-age children. To earn a living, Roger owns and operates a business venture in the transportation services sector. Specifically, his primary source of income is derived from operating a motor-transport service. Roger has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2007, Roger joined GDMPC to gain much-needed access to financial services. In turn, he was better able to engage in business activities and to thereby improve his family's standard of living. Recently, Roger successfully repaid a previous loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. Roger is now requesting a new loan, again in the amount of 15,000 PHP ($350), which will be used to repair his existing vehicle to provide better service for his customers. Notably, this loan would be the second loan taken out by Roger from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as a result of the loan to improve his family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches, which cover the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is comprised of mostly farmers, fishermen/women, and entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To provide better service by repairing his vehicle

loans.name: Nidia Liz

texts.es:
Nidia Liz nació en la ciudad de Cusco departamento del Cusco, ella tiene 36 años. 

Nidia Liz se dedica a la venta de artesanía y tiene varios locales donde vende sus productos, ella mayormente vende chompas, tejidos y platería. Sus productos son requeridos por turistas nacionales e internacionales.  

Ha solicitado Nidia Liz a la Asociación Arariwa un crédito de 2,000 nuevos soles para adquirir mercadería como por ejemplo chompas, chalinas, otras cosas más. Con los ingresos de la venta de sus productos cubriría las cuotas del crédito brindado.

Nidia Liz es una persona muy conocida por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable y una buena madre al querer brindarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Nidia Liz, age 36, was born in the city of Cusco, Department of Cusco.

She sells handicrafts and has several locations where she offers her products. Nidia Luz sells mostly sweaters, woven cloth, and silverware. Her products sell well among domestic and international tourists.

She is requesting a loan from Asociación Arariwa in the amount of 2000 PEN so that she can acquire merchandise such as sweaters, scarves, and other items. With the income she generates from the sale of her products, she is able to cover her loan payments.

Nidia Liz is a person who is well-known for being a hardworking and responsible woman, as well as a good mother who wants to provide a better future for her children. She also wants to improve the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase sweaters, scarves, and other handcrafted products.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
As a common-law partner and parent of two children, Susan works hard to support her family.

She has a buying & selling of fish & dried fish business in the Philippines and earns additional income from buying & selling pigs.  Susan is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock of fish to sell and to make dried fish for her buying & selling of fish & dried fish business.

Susan has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy fish to dry and sell

loans.name: Jamshedjon

texts.en:
Jamshedjon is 29 years old. He is married and has four children. Her wife is a housekeeper and Jamshedjon's business is the main source of income for his large family. Jamshedjon has provided transportation services for the last 10 years. Each day, he transports different goods for his clients in his truck. Jamshedjon dreams that all of his children be well-educated so he is working hard. As a result, the business generates a significant income allowing him to support his large family. In order to provide better service for his clients and earn more, Jamshedjon needs to make major repairs to his truck. He believes that this will make his business more profitable. For this purpose he requests 10000 TJS. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his truck

loans.name: Vantha

texts.en: Vantha, 28 years old, is a hair cutter with $6 per day as income. His wife is staying home taking care of their child. They have one child and he is 5 years old. Every month, Vantha has to spend $55 on food, $12 on electricity, and $15 more on other expenses. He would like to request a loan of $1200 to buy farmland and hair cutting equipment. He wants to have a small grocery shop for his wife in the market, so that they both can make good income doing other things in the future.

loans.use: To buy farmland and hair cutting equipment.

loans.name: Golibchon

texts.ru: Голибчон проживает в районе Хамадони. Холост. У него среднее техническое образование. Голибчон уже два года как ремонтирует автомобили. Он кредит берет для приобретения нового оборудования для ремонта машин.
texts.en: Golibchon lives in the Hamadoni district.  He is single.  He has a secondary technical education.  Golibchon has been repairing cars for two years.  He is requesting this loan to purchase new equipment for auto repairs.

loans.use: to purchase new auto repair equipment

loans.name: El Jardin De Buenavista Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "EL JARDIN DE BUENVISTA" porque a las señoras le agrada mucho las plantas, además de que frente a el lugar de reunion hay un jardin de niños; esta ubicado en el estado de México, es un lugar donde hay gente con muchas ganas de salir adelante que trabaja dia a dia muy duro para salir adelante y ofrecerle una mejor vida a sus hijos. El grupo esta conformado por 11 integrante y es la segunda vez que solicitan un prestamo. La señora Maria es integrante del grupo tiene 47 años, estudio solo la primaria y es casada, se dedica a la cria y venta de borregos que inicio hace ya 10 años. Solicita el prestamo para comprar borregos, alimento y vitaminas para crecimiento de los mismos, ella ofrece pricipalmente su producto a los vecinos de la comunidad y a las personas que se dedican a hacer barbacoa. Sus clientes comentan que les agrada comprar con ella por que la alimentacion que les da hace que la carne sea de calidad. Con los ganancias que obtenga lo va a invertir para continuar haciendo crecer su negocio y ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y estudios para su futuro.
texts.en:
This group is called “El Jardín de Buenavista” (Buenavista Garden) because the ladies all love plants.  Besides, across from where they meet there’s a kindergarten (jardín de niños).  It is located in the State of Morelos which is a place whose inhabitants very much want to get ahead and who work very hard every day to get ahead and provide better lives for their children.

The group has 11 members and this is the second loan request.  María, 47, is one of the members. She only went to elementary school.  She’s married and has been raising sheep for the last 10 years.  She’s asking for the loan to buy sheep, feed and vitamins for their growth.  She mostly sells her products to local neighbors and to people who make barbeque.  Her customers comment that they like to buy from her because the feed she gives them guarantees good quality meat.  Profits she earns will be used to reinvest so that her business will grow and she can offer her children a better quality of life and schooling for their future.

loans.use: to buy sheep, feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy children's clothing

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a 40-year-old married woman with three children. She lives in the town of Banga, South Cotabato, with her family.

Vilma is a farmer. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. With her income, she is able to provide for their daily needs and send her children to school.

Vilma has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to have a stable income that would help sustain her family, especially her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 16 years.  He is 40 years old and married to Esther.  They have 3 children who all attend school.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his third loan.  He repaid all his previous loans well and on time.  He plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Bernard hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Kaay Bakh 4 Group

texts.fr: Kaay Bakh 4 est un groupe de 5 femmes qui évoluent  dans la vente de petit déjeuner  et le commerce de tissus, de produits agro-alimentaires, de portables Elles habitent toutes au Sénégal dans la même localité. Elles sont représentées par madame Fatou qui pratique la vente de petit déjeuner depuis plusieurs années. Elle est mariée  et souhaite élargir son activité de commerce. Le groupe sollicite un crédit de 500 000 prévus pour l’achat de tissus, de portables, de produits alimentaires, et agro-alimentaires destinés a la vente. Leur objectif est d’accroitre leurs bénéfices afin d’améliorer les conditions de vie sociale des différents  membres du groupe.
texts.en:
Kaay Bakh 4 is a group of five women whose activities consist in the sale of breakfast, fabrics, agri-food, and mobile phones. They all live in the same district in Senegal. Their representative is Mrs. Fatou, who has been selling breakfast for several years. She is a married woman who is looking to expand her business. 

The group is seeking a loan of 500,000 francs to purchase food items, fabrics, mobile phones, and agri-food for resale. Their goal is to increase their profits in order to improve the social conditions of the group members.

loans.use: to buy food items, fabrics, mobile phones, and agri-food for resale

loans.name: Pasmaya

texts.en:
Pasmaya is 32 years old. She is married and has two children aged nine and four. In 2007, she established her poultry business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family. 

She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from Patan BPW and used it to buy small chickens for her business. In the future, Pasmaya plans to improve the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Extra training is needed to help borrowers improve their living standards. In the Kathmandu Valley, raising poultry for eggs and meat is a very profitable business. Kiva loans are used to purchase chicks, food, and necessary medicine to keep the chickens healthy. Once matured, the chickens are sold at small butcher shops or in the many open-air markets throughout the valley.

loans.use: to buy small chickens

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 45 years old, married and has four children. To make a living, Edna owns and operates a food stall. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from tending a canteen in the market. Edna has been engaged in her business for more than one year and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Edna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now, she is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase meat and vegetables to cook and sell. Edna plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase meat and vegetables to cook and sell.

loans.name: Natalya

texts.ru:
Наталья решила воспользоваться кредитом КИВА, потому что ее очень устраивает возможность взять кредит на короткий срок, ей это удобно. Предыдущий кредит КИВА Наталья вложила в закупку керамической посуды и горшков, в летний период открыла выносную торговлю. 
Наталья совсем недавно смогла позволить себе нанять няню для младшего ребенка, что раньше было ей не по карману. 
Кредит в 20 000 гривен Наталья хотела бы вложить в оптовую закупку привозного китайского товара (иголки, нитки, швейные принадлежности). 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en: Natalya decided use a Kiva loan because she really likes the ability to obtain a loan for short period of time, which is convenient for her.  Natalya used her previous Kiva loan to purchase ceramic dishware and pots and opened remote sales during the summer period.  Recently, Natalya was able to hire a nanny for her youngest child, which is something she could not afford to do before.  Natalya is requesting a loan in the sum of 20 000 hryvnia to invest into a wholesale purchase of imported Chinese merchandise (needles, threads and sewing accessories).

loans.use: to purchase new imported Chinese merchandise (needles, threads, sewing accessories)

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia, 24, is married to Edward, a pharmacist by profession. They have one child who is still too young for school. They all live together in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is electricity bills. 

Teresia has operated a beauty salon and a cosmetics shop for the past 14 months. Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her customers' demands in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase cosmetics, handbags, and shoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics, handbags, and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Jorge De Jesus

texts.es:
Don Jorge tiene 45 años de edad, vive en unión libre y se dedica a la caficultura, tiene amplio conocimiento en el cultivo y manejo del café, manifestó que desde niño le enseñaron, trabajaba con su padre hasta que se independizo, él café es la fuente principal de ingresos que percibe, con estos cubre los gastos del hogar.
Don Jorge utilizara el credito para comprar una planta de energia solar, solo se han iluminado con candiles, velas y rajas de ocote, donde él vive no cuentan con el servicio de energía eléctrica y su mayor deseo es tener luz propia y no dañina para la salud.
texts.en:
Don Jorge, 45, lives with his common-law wife and is a coffee grower.  He has much expertise in growing and handling coffee since he learned as a child, working alongside his father until he became independent.  Coffee is his main source of income and allows him to cover household expenses.

Jorge plans to use the loan to buy a solar energy panel since there is no electric energy service where he lives.  Up until now they have used candles or fire starter wood, but they long to have their own source of safe electricity.

loans.use: To buy a solar energy panel.

loans.name: Karina Maria

texts.es:
Karina Maria tiene 38 años de edad vive en unión libre  tiene dos hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos de 20 y 15 años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas provincia de los ríos.

La VRC ALAS DE CRISTO  se encuentra ubicada en el Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Comerciales en General.

Karina se dedica a vender zapatos de damas,caballeros, niñas, niños hace 1 año, las compras y las ventas lo realiza en Guayaquil.

Solicita el crédito para comprar más mercadería de calzado.

Con la ayuda del crédito tendría un beneficio económico.

El sueño es poder tener una casa, no se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema. En el tiempo libre le gusta realizar quehaceres domésticos.
texts.en:
Karina Maria, age 38, is in a common-law marriage and has two children.  She lives with her husband and her childen; ages 20 and 15.  She lives in the Ventanas Canton, Los Rios province.

The “Alas de Cristo” (Wings of Christ) communal bank is located in the Ventanas Canton.  The members generally devote themselves to commercial work.

Karina has been selling shoes for women, men, and children.  She has been doing this for one year.  She makes her purchases and her sales in Guayaquil.

She is requesting the loan to buy more shoes.  The help of the loan will be economically beneficial.

Her dream is to be able to have a house.  She has not faced any kind of problem.

She likes to do her household chores in her free time.

loans.use: to buy more shoes.

loans.name: Ter

texts.en:
Mrs. Ter’s priority in life is to uplift her family’s living conditions. She is a single parent and has two single children who live together with her in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. 

She has to be involved in many businesses in order to maintain better living conditions and to pay for her daily expenses. There are three businesses she has been doing, such as cultivating rice crops, selling a kind of Khmer cake and trading rice from place to place. She is able to generate in the neighborhood of $4.00 from her farming business as well as the other two businesses. Moreover, her daughter helps to create income for the family by selling fruit from a rented booth in a local market of the province. 

Mrs. Ter would like to borrow this loan amount to buy stock of fruits and to purchase a used motorcycle for her daughter’s business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of fruits and to purchase a used motorcycle for her daughter’s business.

loans.name: Saida

texts.ru: Саида замужняя женщина средних лет, имеет троих детей, работает в комбинате благоустройства - уличным дворником. Имеет большой стаж работы, но семейные условия среднее. После информирования со стороны родственников, которые кредитуются в нашей организации, очень обрадовалась о нашем существовании, так как на покупку чего-то у них нет наличных денег. Сыновья Саиды уже взрослые и сами уже зарабатывают, и обязуются помочь в погашении кредита. На кредит собирается купить холодильник и обставить кухню.
texts.en: Saida is a married, middle-age woman, who has three children and works as a street janitor for the improvements plant.  She has an extensive work experience, but her family conditions are average.  After being informed by her relatives, who obtain financing from our organization, Saida was happy to find out about our existence because she does not have available cash for any purchases.  Saida's sons are already grown and earn their own money, and promise to help with repaying this loan.  Saida plans to use this loan to purchase a refrigerator and furnish her kitchen.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Yesica

texts.es:
Yesica tiene 26 años edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, ella nació en la ciudad de Quillabamba en la selva del Perú pero actualmente vive en el poblado de Cotowincho de la provincia de Urubamba, ella se dedica a la elaboración de artesanía, ella tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio donde elabora tejido de tipo plano ósea pisos, alfombras, frezadas, individuales y otros cosas más. Ya son siete años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Yesica requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como lana sintética e hilos de algodón. Su sueño de Yesica es abrir una cabina de internet.  

Yesica es integrante del banco comunal “Nueva Visión de Rumichaca”. Este  grupo está conformado con 19 socios que viven  en la provincia de Urubamba. La provincia de Urubamba está ubicada al norte de la ciudad del Cusco, a orillas del río Vilcanota, en una zona que se conoce como el “Valle Sagrado” debido a su clima templado, tierra  fértil y abundantes riachuelos, que hacen de este valle uno de los más bellos del planeta.
texts.en:
26-year-old Yesica lives with her partner with whom she has two children. She was born in the town of Quillabamba, in the Peruvian jungle, but now lives in the town of Cotowincho in the province of Urubamba. Yesica is a craftswoman and has a small workshop at home where she produces items such as woven fabrics, carpets, blankets and placemats among other things. She has had her business for seven years and is doing very well. Yesica requires this loan to buy materials such as synthetic wool and cotton thread. Her dream is to open a cybercafe.

Yesica is a member of the communal bank "Nueva Visión de Rumichaca", made up of 19 members living in Urubamba. Urubamba is located north of the city of Cusco, along the Vilcanota River in an area known as the "Sacred Valley" due to its mild climate, fertile soil, and abundant streams which make this one of the most beautiful valleys in the world.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as synthetic wool and cotton thread.

loans.name: Jorge Miguel

texts.es: El Joven Jorge tiene 23 años de edad, es soltero y tiene un hijo de 2 años el cual vive con su mama junto a su papa, en la zona Oroncota.  El Joven Jorge se dedica al comercio de tarjetas de crédito para celular al por menor el  vende en el mercado central de Cochabamba y de la localidad de Sacaba, e forma  ambulante, actividad donde le va muy bien, no tiene puesto fijo, per le gustaría a la larga tener un puesto y surtir no solo de tarjetas sino también de repuestos de celulares. El joven Jorge vende todos los días y también estudia en un instituto, y esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse y pagar sus estudios, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de tarjetas al por mayor, el joven Jorge se siente feliz y agradecido por la oportunidad que le brindan para crecer en su negocio y la de mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Jorge, 23, is single and has a two-year-old son who lives with his mother and father in the Oroncota zone.  Jorge sells mobile phone cards in Cochabamba’s central market and in Sacaba and as a street vendor.  He does very well in this activity.  Since he does not have a fixed stand, in the long run he’d like to have one and stock not only phone cards but spare parts for mobile phones.  Jorge sells every day and is also attending an institute and this is the only activity that allows him to support himself and pay for his schooling.  He will use the loan money to buy cards at wholesale.  Jorge feels very happy and grateful for the opportunity he’s being given to grow in business and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone cards.

loans.name: Korsi

texts.en: After graduating from senior high school and learning how to work on motorbikes, Korsi decided to set up his own auto mechanic shop business in Ve-Wudome (near Hohoe). With over 12 years of experience, he is currently looking to expand his enterprise further. Unfortunately, he is limited due to a lack of funding. As a result, this loan will be used to help him to purchase more motor parts, working tools and a water-pumping machine for washing motorcycles and cars. He aims at using the profits from his business to help support his wife (who is a petty trader) with the upkeep of their house while ensuring that their two children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more motor parts, tools and a water-pumping machine

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Personal Data: Joyce is a young, energetic 27 year old woman and married with 3 kids. She is a Christian and a member of the Christian movement in her local church. She has a tailoring business at the market centre where she specializes in making ladies clothes. The business has been stable but due to change of fashions, she has been lacking money to purchase different types of garments for her customers.

After she acquires the loan, she will be able to meet the demand of her customers which will only help to increase the number of clients. Besides tailoring, she practices sustinence farming which supplements food in the family, reducing the cost of buying. She gets low sales from the farm but in the future she will still focus on farming. She accumulates a net income of USD120 monthly. She believes after the loan, she will make a total cross over in her business.

loans.use: Joyce wants to purchase different varieties of textiles materials

loans.name: Mubariz

texts.en: Mubariz D. owns a small outdoors sporting shop in the small town of Devechi, just south of Khachmaz, located in the North Eastern part of Azerbaijan. D. is looking for funding so that he can increase the quantity and variety of items that he stocks for his customers. He believes that a larger and varied inventory will attract more customers.

loans.use: To increase and diversify inventory to attract more customers.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy has been running her business for 16 years. She began selling kitchen utensils like dishes, frying pans, and pots. Little by little she has begun to sell other products that her clientele has been asking for. She sells in different poorer areas from 2pm to 6pm. Mercy is asking for a loan so that she can increase sells and satisfy her clients. Her clients are asking for perfumes and cosmetics which are a new line of products to her business. Marcy, 47, is married with 3 grown-up children of which she takes care of one who is 27. This son helps her in the business selling and collecting money. Mercy says that with more money to invest, she will be able to increase her income and continue to provide for the well-being of her family with a good home, as well as stability for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Mercy tiene su negocio desde hace 16 años. Se inicio vendiendo utensilios de cocina como vajillas, sartenes, juegos de ollas y poco a poco ha ido incrementado otras mercadería que su clientela le ha ido solicitando. Sus puntos de ventas son diferentes sectores área marginal y su atención es de 14PM a 18PM

Mercy solicita el préstamo para incrementar mas sus ventas y también cumplir a sus clientes. Le han pedido productos de perfumería y cosméticos que es nuevo en su línea de negocios.

Mercy es casada tiene 47 años y 3 hijos mayores de edad y a su cargo solo uno de 27 años. Su hijo la apoya en su negocio acompañándola en sus gestiones de ventas y cobros. Mercy indica que con su nueva inversión obtendrá otros ingresos que le permitirían seguir adecuando su vivienda dándole mayor bienestar y estabilidad a su familia y negocio.

loans.use: To invest in cosmetics and perfumes

loans.name: Fazal Ahamad

texts.en: Fazal Ahamad lives in district 7 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He lives with all members of his family. He was in London for about 7 years he came home 9 months ago and opened a burger shop. He took his 5th cycle group loan and bought all the materials for his shop to make a good business. Now he wants to take anther loan to enlarge his shop and expand his business to support his family. He is happy that he can support all the members of his family.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Kak

texts.en: Mrs. Kak T., 27, is married with 3 children - all of whom are students. Her husband, 47, earns $6 a day as a construction foreman. Kak T. has applied for this $300 loan so that she can purchase a motorcycle for her husband to use for transportation to and from work. She feels that this will reduce the transportation costs for the household as her husband will not have to ride motortaxis to and from work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her husband to go to work

loans.name: Govser

texts.en: Govser N. lives in Beylagan, a small city in the south-west Azerbaijan. He is 50 years old, married and has four children. He owns a food market. He has 15 years experience in this business. His son helps him at his business. Govser needs $800 to expand his food market business.

loans.use: To expand his food market business.

loans.name: Thaong

texts.en: Mrs. Thaong P., age 45, works in her rice paddy growing crops, earning around $2 each day.  Her husband is a taxi- driver, making about $6 per day of profit.  They have three children who are married and live separately.  She would like to request a loan of $1000 in order to purchase pigs to raise for additional profit.  She plans to use any remaining funds to help fix her husband’s taxi so it is more reliable.

loans.use: To purchase pigs to raise and resell, and to repair a taxi.

loans.name: Sadiq

texts.ru:
Sadiq X., who is 26, was born and grew up in Ahsuniyski region. He has been in the business of animal breeding for the past 2 years. He is a bachelor, but he wants to get married. For this reason, he wants to expand his business so he could increase his earnings. He came to Normicro to obtain funding to purchase more animals.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Халилов Садиг.1981 года рождения. Родился и вырос в Ахсуинском районе. 2 года подряд занимается скотоводством.Холост . Этот молодой человек хочет женится.Но до этого он хочет расширить свой бизнес чтобы имеет хорошую прибыль. Для этого ему нужны деньги.Поэтому он обратился в Нормикро Ахсуинский филиал.

loans.use: To increase the guantity animals

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Mrs. Lourdes lives in her in-laws' home in the street C #22 of the Llojeta el Vergel zone in the city of La Paz. She is 27 years old and lives with her husband who is a mechanic.

She works selling dairy products in the Llojeta market in a kiosk, which she owns. With this activity she helps support her son and cover the family needs.

The loan she requests is to expand her business, increasing her working capital. She is a new client in our institutions and is eligible for a loan according to our analysis.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer

La señora Lourdes vive en casa de sus suegros en la calle C Nº 22 de la zona de Llojeta el Vergel de la ciudad de La Paz, tiene 27 años y vive con su esposo el cual es mecánico.

La actividad que realiza es la venta de productos lácteos en el mercado de Llojeta en un kiosco del cual es propietaria, con esta actividad ayuda a mantener a su hijo y cubrir sus necesidades familiares.

El crédito que solicita es para ampliar su negocio incrementando su capital de trabajo, es un cliente nuevo en nuestra institución y puede acceder a un crédito de acuerdo al análisis efectuado.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Salom

texts.en:
F. Salom is 46 years old. He and his wife have raised two sons. Both are already married.

Salom provides taxi services with his car. Being in this business for 5 years, Salom has become very popular in his neighborhood as a polite taxi-driver. Now Salom plans to fix his car and to sell it. The received funds shall be used for purchasing a new vehicle. However, he needs additional funding for the repairs.  Salom requests $950.00 US dollars for the term of 12 months. Having proved himself as an honest reliable client Salom  promises to repay the current loan in time.

loans.use: To fix his car for resale

loans.name: Chahbar

texts.en:
C. Chahbar is 35 years old. Though educated as a teacher, Chahbar is running his private farm. Mainly he is growing crops such as potatoes, onions, and rice. At the same time he is fattening cows and calves for sales. Chahbar manages his farm successfully. He generates sufficient income to support the family. Now, at the beginning of the season of planting, Chahbar is planning to plant potato and onion.

At the same time, he needs additional funds for purchasing cattle for fattening. With this purpose Chahbar requests $1000.00 for the term of 12 months. Chahbar has already had a loan by the International Micro-Loan Fund IMON, and proved himself an honest client. He promises to repay the current loan promptly and thanks all supporting him.

loans.use: To purchase cattle and also fertilizer.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
For Isabel, it all started when she was very Young. She was selling candies in the Central Market in Lima for a while until she decided to become independent. She decided to open up a candy store alone, becoming an unofficial distributor of many candy companies. When she had enough money saved up, she opened up a small store in her home, 18 years ago. Bit by bit, thanks to her and her husband’s efforts, she has been able to sign an agreement with a big candy company so that she is an exclusive distributor of their brand of candy and snacks. Now she has been working for them for 15 years and the business keeps growing.

Isabel and her husbad have 2 kids who are 19 and 12 years old. They both work hard to keep progressing and find new markets in which to sell their products. The shop that they have is a sign of the great effort that they have put in since they decided to start this business.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Para Isabel todo empezó cuando aun era muy joven. Estuvo vendiendo dulces al por mayor en el mercado central de Lima durante una temporada hasta que decidió independizarse. Sola se animo a ofrecer de bodega en bodega golosinas, cumpliendo el papel de distribuidora no oficial de las empresas de golosinas. Una vez que tuvo ahorrado un dinero abrió una tienda de dulces en su casa hace dieciocho. Poco a poco y gracias a su esfuerzo y al de su esposo, ha podido conseguir un acuerdo con una empresa de golosinas para ser los distribuidores exclusivos de una marca de dulces y snacks. Hoy ya tienen quince años trabajando como distribuidores y continúan creciendo. Isabel y su esposo son padres de dos hijos que tienen diecinueve y doce años de edad. Ambos trabajan arduamente para seguir progresando y para cada vez encontrar mas mercados donde distribuir sus productos. La tienda que tienen es una muestra de su gran esfuerzo desde que decidieron ingresar a este negocio.

loans.use: To enlarge her sweetshop/Ampliar su tienda de golosinas

loans.name: Bilson

texts.en:
Bilson D. is 47 years old. He is married with four children. He has been an auto electrician for the past 15 years.

He learned his knowledge and skills in an apprenticeship, and he is now a master of auto electricity. He services all kinds cars and vehicles with electrical and battery problems. At the moment, he is training three young men and imparting his knowledge and skills to them to give them future job opportunities.

Bilson wants the loan to buy more tools and raw materials like scrap batteries, wires and car parts. He wants to provide his clients with better services for increased income to expand his workshop and for his family.

He belongs to the community group called Grace to Grace Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee one another as social collateral to access loans and peer pressure to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy more tools and raw materials like scrap batteries, wires and car parts.

loans.name: Laura Emperatriz's Group

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Laura J. soy comerciante, vendo zapatos para dama y carteras, tengo 4 años de estar en esta actividad, mi producto lo vendo en diferentes lugares ya que tengo un ayudante que reparte mis zapatos y carteras a mis clientes, este negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi hogar y mi familia, pero tengo la necesidad de hacer un prestamo para poder comprar mas zapatos y carteras ya que las necesidades de mis clientes son bastantes, porque a la mayoria que les vendo mis zapatos son a clientes de oficinas.

loans.use: compra de zapatos para dama y carteras

loans.name: Musayam

texts.ru:
Musayam Tolivov lives in the city of Yavan. Since he was 16 years old he has been engaged in business to help his mother feed his large family, which consists of 5 other sisters and brothers. In the current moment he is married, and is waiting for the birth of his child. To be able to provide for his family he has engaged in trade. He owns a shop, where he trades spare parts for cars. He wants to receive a loan so that he can increase his assortment of spare parts. He plans to obtain building materials. He plans to repay the loan within 8 months. This will help him receive additional income and also provide his town with needed materials.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Толибов Мусаям житель города Яван. С 16 лет занялся бизнесом для того , чтобы помогать матери прокормить большую семью . Ведь у него кроме него имеется пятеро сестер и братьев. В данный момент он женился и ждет своего ребенка . Для того , чтобы обеспечивать семью занимается торговлей. Имеет магазин , где торгует запасными частями для легковых автомобилей. Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы увеличить ассортимент товара. Планирует завести стройматериалы. Погасить кредит сможет в течении 8 месяцев. Это поможет получить дополнительную прибыль и кроме того обеспечить население необходимыми товарами.

loans.use: Increase Commodity Circulation

loans.name: Serigne Diop

texts.fr: Serigne Diop K. est un coordonnier  qui a une expérience de 20ans (depuis son enfance. Marié et  père de 2 enfants  il veut ce prêt pour renforcer son commerce et augmenter ses fabrications de chaussures et de ceintures qui sont très sollicitées par sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Serigne Diop K. is a shoemaker with 20 years’ experience (going back to his childhood). Married and the father of two children, he wants this loan to strengthen his business and step up his manufacture of shoes and belts, which are highly demanded by his customers.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products for the manufacture of shoes and belts

loans.name: Mr. Men Kchey Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of five people living in Khsom Village in Kandal Province who plan to use the loan for various purposes. Mr. Men K., a house constructor, is the group leader while his wife, Mrs. Phon Nhorn, owns a small grocery store in the local village. They have five children, one a garment factory worker, three construction workers, and the youngest a student.

Although Mr. Men K. and his wife have different businesses, they still live in an old house in poor conditions. In order to improve the family’s standard of living, Men is requesting a loan to add to his savings to build a new house.

loans.use: To add to his savings to build a new house.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad A. S. is a member of the community bank Emprendedoras, which means "entrepreneurs" in Spanish. She is a widow with five children; all of her children are currently in school. Trinidad sells plants from her home. She also sets up a small stand daily from 11am-2 pm where she sells grains, wheat, and puca picante (a common dish in Ayacucho made with potatoes, rice, and chicken or sausage) for immediate consumption.

With her loan of 800 soles (~$275 USD), Trinidad will invest in her businesses by purchasing plants, chicken, potatoes, and more grains. The savings she has accumulated since becoming a FINCA member will be used to help her children with their education. Purchasing land and building a home is another of Trinidad's dreams.

loans.use: To purchase plants, chicken, potatoes and more grains to support her food- and plant-sales.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of tablecloth, decorative window curtains and other goods for a small business.

loans.name: Oliver F.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 35 years old Oliver M. from Kyela. She is married with two children, ages of 15 and 17. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependants because their parents died of HIV. Oliver has been running a shoe business since 2005. 

She works at her business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by her husband. Oliver  currently earns about $30 USD a month from her business. 

She is requesting a loan of $425 USD to purchase more shoes to sell. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and range of here stock. Oliver thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future

loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell

loans.name: Kokoè

texts.fr: Mme Kokoè H. est mariée et mère de six (06) enfants. Depuis plus de quinze (15) ans, elle fait le commerce de stockage et de vente de céréales notamment le mais, le mil et le haricot. C’est une activité très florissante qui lui procure suffisamment de revenus et de bénéfices. Toutefois elle ne dispose pas d’un magasin propice et convenable pour stocker ses céréales. Pour cela, elle sollicite un financement pour louer un magasin et constituer un stock suffisant de céréales afin de répondre aux sollicitations de ses clients.
texts.en:
Mrs. Kokoè H. is married and mother of six children. For more than 15 years she has stockpiled and sold cereals, notably corn, millet, and haricots. This is a very profitable job which provides her with sufficient revenue. However, she does not have a suitable storehouse in which to store these cereals. This is why she is requesting a loan to rent a storehouse and build up a sufficient supply of cereals so she can meet customer demand.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stockpiling and selling of cereals

loans.name: Mrs. Chhunheng Sok Village Bank Group

texts.en: Eighteen people living in the Preaek Chan Village in the Kampong Cham Province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. ChhunH. S., the 53-year-old village bank president, is a rice soup seller. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more ingredients to make her delicious rice soup. Her husband, Mr. Sin Seng Hong, is a village chief who doesn't earn enough to support the family. Mrs. ChhunH. S. has seven children, one of whom is a beautician while another is employed in a garment factory. One is a construction worker while another helps with the family business, and the remaining three attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients to make rice soup to sell

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha has been a cloth, charcoal, and firewood seller in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for 4 years. She belongs to Safi Nia Group. She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 60.Every day she works at her business from 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more "khanga" (traditional Tanzanian cloth), charcoal, and firewood for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Asha is 28 years old, married, and has four children: ages between 9 and 6. She also cares for one additional dependent.

loans.use: To buy more  "khanga," charcoal and firewood for her business

loans.name: Maurene

texts.en:
Maurene D. raises pigs. She is 30 years old and has 6 loving children. She has raised pigs for 13 years now. Her husband is a farmer and tills the land to support their family. Aside from pigs, she grows vegetables in their backyard. The harvest is what she uses to provide for their other needs. Maurene's income from her pig business greatly helps her family to pay for school fees and books. 

She is asking for a loan of PHP8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy piglets and feed for the pigs. The loan will truly help her develop her business more and have more piglets.

CEVI is a non-profit organization and a partner of WorldVision Philippines that helps people start and have their own businesses. They not only provide credit, but also training and insurance coverage to help their clients' businesses develop.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and sacks of feed.

loans.name: Haytham

texts.en:
Haytham, 25, lives with his parents in Tripoli, northern Lebanon where he has owned a CD and cassette shop for five years. He also rents out a sound music system for parties. Haytham is requesting a loan of $1000 from A. Majmoua  to purchase merchandise for his shop and a tool for his sound system. 

Haytham is speciA. in his work because he has a good relationship with his clients, who are his friends, neighbors and people from his region, and knows how to treat them.  Haytham decided upon this business because of his interest in music, and in the future plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his shop and a tool for his sound system.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru: Носирова Дилором проживает в городе Яван. Живут со своей семьей далеко от города . Домохозяйка , муж работает  строителем по найму. Сама клиентка занимается домашним хозяйством. Имеет несколько голов мелко рогатого скота. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить поголовье овец и коз. Таким образом она сможет улучшить финансовое положение семьи.
texts.en:
Dilorom N. lives in Yavan. She lives with her family far away from the city. She is a homemaker, and her husband is a construction worker for-hire. Dilorom takes care of the household. She owns several sheep and goats. She plans to obtain this loan in order to increase the sheep and goat headcount. This will allow her to improve her family’s financial situation.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of additional livestock

loans.name: Khadigeh

texts.en:
Khadigeh is a 49-year-old woman who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with her husband and their six children. Khadijeh has owned a clothing shop for 11 years. She is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, Kiva's partner, in order to purchase the new summer collection. This is the first time that Khadijeh has requested a loan.

Khadijeh is special in her work because she knows how to treat her clients and she is the only seamstress in her region. Her clients are people from her region. When she first started, she had financial issues. Khadijeh decided on doing her business because of her experience. In the future, she plans on expanding her business.

loans.use: Khadigeh will use the loan to purchase the new summer collection.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 37 years old and single with no children. She is a tailor. She also earns some income by selling sarongs.

She hopes to receive a loan in the amount of N50,000 to purchase material and sarongs to sell.

Joy sends her gratitude.

loans.use: To purchase material and sarongs to sell

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
Noemi travels to the Ayacuchan forest where she sells processed grains which she acquires from the mills. Noemi also has a store which sells spare parts. She rents the shop and her husband works there. Noemi is married, 28 years old, and has two children. She is a member of Banco Comunal Juanito.
Noemi needs a loan of 600 soles which she will use to buy more spare parts. Noemi’s dream is to have her own store and build a home in the center of the city.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts

loans.name: Benkadi (L’Entente) Group

texts.fr:
Les sept femmes du groupe Benkadi de l’association Jeunesse sont toutes mariées, elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 29 ans et 2 enfants vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier Médina Koura de la ville de Koutiala (région de Sikasso, république du Mali). Elles se sont  connues   à travers des liens   de voisinage et pour la pratique du même métier.
Elles exercent presque la même activité : la vente  de condiments  et de bois de chauffe. Elles sont très sollicitées dans cette activité. 
Afin  de satisfaire  le besoin de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, le groupe Benkadi a décidé d’intégrer  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son troisième  prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elles  comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter toute sorte de condiments en gros au grand marché de Koutiala (oignon, tomate, sounbala, piment et épices) et une quantité importante de bois  de chauffe en brousse pour les revendre en   détail et au comptant au marché et à la maison. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen  de 80 000 FCFA au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir au besoin de la famille élargie et investir le reste dans les activités. 
Elles ont pour ambition de diversifier leur commerce en embrassant d’autres activités génératrices de revenus telle que  l'achat  de réfrigérateur pour la vente des boissons.
texts.en:
The 7 women of this “Benkadi” (understanding) group, belonging to the Jeunesse Association are all married. They have an average age of 29, and on average 2 children. They live in big extended traditional families in the Médina Koura neighborhood of the town of Koutiala (Sikasso region, Republic of Mali). They met because of being from the same neighborhood and engaged in similar businesses.

They have almost the same businesses, selling condiments and firewood. They are much in demand in these areas. So as to satisfy the needs of their growing clientele, this Benkadi group decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom they are on their 3rd solidarity loan (group loan). Both the preceding loans were correctly reimbursed.

They intend to use this loan to buy various sorts of condiments wholesale in the big market of Koutiala (onions, tomatoes, “sounbala”, red pepper, and spices) and a considerable quantity of firewood. This merchandise is sold retail, for cash, in the markets and out of their homes.

They each expect to make an average profit of 80,000 F CFA over the course of this loan cycle. That money will be used to pay the interest on the loan and cover some needs of their extended families, investing any remainder back into their businesses. Their ambition is to diversify their businesses by taking up other money-earning activities such as buying a refrigerator so as to sell drinks.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of condiments and firewood for resale

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Hazel S. is from the village of Lilo-an, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old. Hazel is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Hazel operates a family member's business venture in the food sector, making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling baked foods in the local community. Hazel has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Hazel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hazel is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Hazel from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en: Sanaa is a 43-year-old married woman with 2 children. She has owned a clothing shop since 2008. Thanks to her business income, she has been able to meet her children's needs in collaboration with her husband. Today, Sanaa is requesting to borrow to buy more merchandise so she can increase her sales and therefore her income.

loans.use: buy more merchandise

loans.name: Hani

texts.en: Hani is 41 years old. He is married and has nine children to whom he wishes to give the best and be able to cover the expenses of schooling for his children. He dreams that all of them might be well educated. Hani sells different kinds of accessories in his store. Today he wants to expand his business and to increase his working capital in order to purchase new goods to sell. With this purpose in mind, he is requesting $2,000. Hani would be very grateful for your support.

loans.use: To purchase new goods to sell

loans.name: Lalaine

texts.en:
Lalaine C. is asking for financial assistance that will be utilized for the maintenance of their tricycle transport business of which is being drive by her husband with a travel route from their village at Barangay Rizal East San Isidro, Isabela to Santiago City. She wanted to borrow the amount of PHP5, 000 from KIVA lenders. She hopes that lenders will help her in the business to have smooth business operation for her family and to the daily passengers they used to give their transport service.  


She is already 45 years old, married to Joel C.. They are blessed with two children namely Kenjie - 19 years old who graduated in a two- year course and Kevin Joel - 17 years old is already a high school graduate. Lalaine is hoping that she could avail the amount of loan she is requesting to give her children a better education. She is optimistic that she will achieve all her goals in life.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Meang

texts.en: Meang R., 48, is married with 4 children. He operates his motor taxi in the city, earning an income of US $5 per day which is the primary source of income for the family.  His wife stays at home and involved in the agriculture sector of raising pigs, earning an income of US $2 per day. The family is also assisted by two of his children who are currently employed in a local garment factory with an income of US $2 each per day. To make a better living standard, he is asking for a loan of US $800 to purchase pigs and animal food to improve his wife’s business at home. He hopes that he will be able to make those pigs grow efficiently and sell them for good prices at the market.

loans.use: buy pigs and animal food

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en: Rosalina T. is from the village of Badjangon Springs, Gingoog City. She is 53 years old, is married and has three school-aged children. Rosalina owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Rosalina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Rosalina is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rowna Group

texts.en:
Rowna is the group leader of the Rowna Group. There are four members in this group, each of whom wants a loan to expand and enlarge her business. They are requesting a group loan of 40000 Afghani.

Rowna wants a loan for her embroidery business. She'll use the money to buy all of the materials that she needs for her business. Bibi Gul wants a loan for her husband's bakery so he can buy the materials that he needs. Fatama wants a loan to buy supplies for her tailoring business. She has many clients who like the way that she works, so her monthly income increases day by day. Leela wants a loan for her husband's veil shop. 

They all very happy about the availability of small loans in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Angelito

texts.en:
Angelito V. is popularly known as “Jay-r” in his village in Barangay Paniki, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. After graduating from high school, he married Analiza and they are now blessed with two children. They want to improve their standard of living to give their children a better future.
