Despite the hardships and difficulties, they have strong faith and determination to achieve their goal through patience and hard work.

As a way of earning income, Jay-r buys and sells rice in their village and also manages a piggery. Jay-r and his wife want to improve their businesses to earn a higher income. Due to financial constraints, they want to borrow 10,000 PHP from Kiva lenders to strengthen their capital and improve their business. They believe that through hard work they will achieve their goal.

loans.use: As additional capital for rice business

loans.name: Biyinzika Development Group B Of Mukono

texts.en:
Sylvia N. is the leader of her group in Mukono. She is 24 years old and is married with two children. In addition to taking care of her children, she also helps support her parents. Sylvia owns a retail shop operation and would like to use her loan of 300,000 USH to purchase more inventory. Some of her debtors have recently had trouble keeping up with their payments, so she requires an additional capital infusion to keep inventory levels stable.

In the future she will be much more careful concerning who she extends credit to and will work with the debtors to arrange repayment schemes. With hard work and determination she hopes to one day be able to afford her own plot of land.

loans.use: More Inventory

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline O. is 34 years old, married with three children. Her husband is a commercial driver and he also supports the home. Roseline sells groceries to make a living. She has been in this business for six years. Roseline hopes to own a supermarket in the future. 

Her challenge in her business is inadequate funds. She is requesting a loan amount of 50,000 Nigerian naira (NGN) to purchase more groceries to sell. This is the high season for sales and she hopes to make more profits. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

Roseline is a client of LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization). LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn, 33 years old, is a married woman. She has three children, the oldest being seven years old. She is a rice farmer. According to her, farming is like gambling. There are times that you win and also times that you lose. But Analyn is determined to go on and win. She works hard to ensure her crops are healthy and that they will produce an abundant harvest.

She applied for a loan to assist her farm financially. She requested 12,000 PHP from the Kiva field partner, Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use this loan to purchase the supplies she needs on her farm, like seeds, fertilizers and also crude oil for the tractor.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Lona

texts.en: Lona N. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and bread and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a charcoal store. Lona is 35 years old and is widowed. She has four children and her children go to school. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Eloy

texts.en: Eloy is a construction worker in New York City, originally from Ecuador. With his many years of construction experience, he decided to become his own boss two years ago. With his loan from ACCION USA, Eloy will purchase two jackhammers and other equipment for demolition work. He has found ACCION USA's financial education program very beneficial as it has provided helpful information and great support. Eloy dreams of being able to grow his business and employing others. By doing this he will be helping not only his family, but his workers' families as well, he says. About U.S. Microfinance and ACCION USA: Have you ever thought about how the cute new café on your corner or the salon you frequent every month got the financial resources to start their business? Chances are, they drummed up support from their friends and family, dipped into their personal savings, used a high-interest credit card, or all of the above. An estimated ten million small businesses in the U.S. face difficulty obtaining loans from traditional banks, even prior to the current “credit crisis”. Microfinance institutions, like ACCION USA, support these “unbanked” small businesses by giving them access to fairly-priced capital and business education. Small businesses also help stabilize low- to moderate-income neighborhoods and rebuild our economy through income growth and job creation. Self-employment provides workers with a way to increase their incomes, support their families, and strengthen their communities. As unemployment rises in the U.S., more and more people are turning to self-employment and start-up enterprises as a way to take control of their economic futures and provide employment opportunities in their communities. The need for support of small businesses in the U.S. is great, and it is one that ACCION USA has been striving to meet since 1991.

loans.use: To purchase two jackhammers and other equipment for demolition work

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 40 years old and married with two children. Her husband is a pastor and he also supports the home. Grace owns a grocery store where she sells groceries such as milk, loaves of bread and tomato paste. She is requesting a loan of 120,000 NGN to purchase more groceries to sell. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and own a supermarket. Grace thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Emad

texts.en:
Emad is a 50-year-old man who lives in Aley, Mount Lebanon, with his wife and their four children. Emad has been working as a builder for twenty years now. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that he has requested a loan. 

He is special in his work because of his experience. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties because he already had experience and had built up networking. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to have an independent job. In the future, he plans on expanding his work.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work

loans.name: Félix Rubén

texts.es: El Sr. Félix Rubén R. es profesor de secundaria del colegio san Rafael, es casado, el dinero lo solicita para mejora de vivienda aumento de un cuarto compra de arena, cemento, y bloque. Ya es el octavo crédito con Ceprodel lo cual se siente satisfecho de toda la ayuda que Ceprodel le ha brindado con estos crédito por que solo así ha podido salir adelanto con su casa y su familia. Le tienen tres hijos los tres en menores en edad escolar.
texts.en:
Mr. Felix Ruben Ramirez is a high school teacher at San Rafael School. He is married, and he is requesting this money to improve his home by adding another room. He will purchase sand, cement, and blocks. This is already his eighth credit with Ceprodel, and he feels very satisfied from all of the help that Ceprodel has provided to him. In this way, he has been able to move forward with his house and his family. He has three children, all of whom are of school age.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction materials such as cement, stone, and sand

loans.name: Lloyd-Ian

texts.en:
Lloyd-Ian S. is from the village of Brgy. 5, Talakag Bukidnon. He is 29 years old. Lloyd-Ian is single and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Lloyd-Ian owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing transport services to local community members. Lloyd-Ian has been using his "trisikad" for his business for over 4 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lloyd-Ian joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lloyd-Ian has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Lloyd-Ian is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Lloyd-Ian from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service.

loans.name: Yesenia Isabel

texts.es:
Yesenia es socia del Banco Comunal Ollantay II.
Yesenia es soltera, tiene 34 años y 2 hijos, Yesenia compra artesanía ayacuchana y lo vende a su prima que vende en el extranjero, también Yesenia elabora cerámica en frío, además en los últimos meses implemento una bodega en su casa.
Yesenia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz y azúcar.
Los sueños de Yesenia son que sus hijos sean profesionales y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Yesenia is a member of the Communal Bank “Ollantay II”. She is 34 years old, single, and has two children. Yesenia buys Ayacuchan crafts and sells them to her cousin, who distributes them abroad. She also makes ceramics. In recent months, she opened a grocery store in her home.

Yesenia needs a loan of 1000 PEN to invest in the purchase of rice and sugar. She dreams of seeing her children become successful professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice & sugar

loans.name: Kakenzi Women's Group, Mubende

texts.en:
Hardworking S. Francis, aged 49, is the married father of five children. He went into a business venture of trading in motor spare parts close to seven years ago. His business being strategically located in Ngabano, Mubende town, in western Uganda, Francis gets many customers, earning him 500,000 Ugandan shillings monthly.

With this loan, Francis is looking forward to restocking his business and also doing more advertising to increase the number of his customers. This will help him improve his sales and also be able to take good care of his family requirements.

loans.use: To restock his business and do more advertising

loans.name: Berrna

texts.en: Berrna is married with one child and her child goes to school. Berrna doesn’t take care of additional family members.  She has a bar in Kawempe selling all types of beer. She wants to use this loan to buy more crates of beer.  She has been in this beer business for eight years and MCDT for seven years. She sells to all categories of people, but only adults. Berrna works seven days a week. Her business challenges are seasonality and defaulters.  She aspires to own a fully stocked bar. She joined MCDT because of their low interest rates. She resides in and rents a two-room house and the family has access to electricity but no piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Sixty-three-year-old Josefina D. is one of the oldest members in one of the ASHI centers. As a member for 10 years, she has able to establish good rapport with her co-members and has proved herself worthy of a loan. She runs a small variety store financed with the loans and has able to make profits which she use to support her family and to make payments to ASHI on time. Josefina’s children already have their own families but she and her husband never felt alone because her business keeps them busy every day, and one of her grandchildren lives with them. They are paying this grandson's college fees.

Josefina’s requested loan will be used to sustain her business and increase her profits so she can continue to support her grandson’s education until he graduates from college and ready to have his own career. For herself and her husband, she is hoping that one day they will enjoy the fruits of their hard work by seeing their business stable and established.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
Carmencita L. is from the village of Olingan, Dipolog City. She is 48 years old, is married, and has two adult-aged children and one school-aged child. To make a living, she runs a general store, selling spices, vegetables, and daily use products in the local community. She is just starting this business.

In 2008, Carmencita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Carmencita is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her 5th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy fertilizer and enlarge area under cultivation

loans.name: Mireya Gioconda

texts.es:
Mireya Gioconda P. P. tiene 20 años.  Vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 2 niños de 2 y 4 años.

Mireya es un socio de la ventanilla rural El Placer, que está ubicada a tres horas de Chillanes. Son 19 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maíz y cacao. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Mireya se dedica a la agricultura y tiene cultivos de maracuyá. Realiza sus compras y ventas en Matilde todos los fines de semana. 

Solicita el préstamo para invertir para dar compra de semilla de cacao y poder sembrar. El crédito le ayudara para poder tener sus cultivos de cacao propios. Su sueño es poder darle una buena educación a su hijo.
  
Le gusta practicar la lectura y ver televisión.
texts.en:
Mireya Gioconda P. P. is 20. She lives in the canton of Chillanes in the province of Bolivar. She has 2 children ages 2 and 4. Mireya is a member of the rural El Placer solidarity group, which is located three hours from Chillanes. There are 19 members in total, the majority of whom cultivate corn and cocoa. This is their first loan with Cooperativa San Jose. Mireya is a farmer and grows passion fruit. She makes her purchases and sales in Matilde every weekend. She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of cocoa seeds to be able to sow them. The loan will help her to have her own cocoa crops. Her dream is to be able to give her child a good education. She likes reading and watching television.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to have more cocoa crops

loans.name: Jean Nepomuscene

texts.en:
J. Nepomuscene is a young man who is 23 years of age. He owns a retail shop that sells all types of drinks and he has done this business for four years.

He expects to broaden his inventory with this loan by buying more groceries for sale. This will lead to the accumulation of profits and, according to him, it will enable him to increase his savings. J. Nepomuscene loves his profession and he has a dream of raising his capital from both the loan and his savings to RWF 2,000,000 (approx. $3,400). He believes this can occur with the profits he generates from hard work.

loans.use: Buying more grocery items for sale

loans.name: Yénoukoumè Blandine

texts.fr: A. Yénoukoumè Blandine est née en 1976 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à FAMBO Sylvestre, Blandine est mère de deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Blandine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari au quartier Ayélawadjè à Cotonou, depuis neuf ans. Blandine a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire. Pour assurer ses besoins et ceux de ses enfants, Blandine vend des sacs de sortie par le système de distribution. Blandine s’approvisionne au Nigéria et à Lomé au Togo, deux Etats voisins du Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Blandine sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un crédit, en vue de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle. Son premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Yénoukoumè Blandine A. was born in 1976 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to Sylvestre Fambo and is the mother of two educated children. Blandine has lived with her husband and children in the Ayélawadjè neighborhood of Cotonou for nine years. Blandine stopped going to school at the secondary level. To meet her needs and those of her children, Blandine works as a distributor of handbags. Blandine buys her stock in Nigeria and in Lomé, Togo; both are countries that border Benin. This is the second time that Blandine has sought a loan from ALIDé in order to build her business and better satisfy the ever increasing needs of her clients. Her first loan was repaid on time.

Translated from French by Eileen Jessop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy handbags

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.en:
Adjowa L. is divorced and has six dependents. She has been through junior high school.

Adjowa smokes fish for sale at Elmina and uses her income in taking care of her dependents. She will use the loan to purchase more fresh fish to smoke for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to provide a good education for her dependents.

loans.use: To purchase more fresh fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina es viuda y tiene un hijo, Alejandrina tiene un taller de confecciones de prendas de vestir, confecciona ropa típica, sus ventas los realiza en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho y Huanta.
Alejandrina es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen de Cocharcas y solicita un crédito de 1500 soles para la compra de telas.
Los sueños de Alejandrina son ahorrar dinero para el futuro y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en: Alejandrina is a widow and she has one child. She has a sewing workshop where she makes traditional garments. She sells in the markets in Ayacucho and Huanta. Alejandrina is a member of the communal bank Virgen de Cocharcas and she's requesting a credit of 1500 soles ($550) to buy fabric. Her dream is to save money for the future and improve her business.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric

loans.name: Paulette

texts.fr:
Femme commercant de 44 ans, mariee avec 2 enfants dont l'age varient entre 23 ans et 8 ans, et tous vont au lycee, au college et a l'ecole primaire, connaissant sa charge , pour palier a la misere elle s'est lancee dans la vente de vaiselles en 2000 pour aider a ameliorer les conditions de vies de sa famille .
Elle vend en moyenne 15000f a 50000 f par jour.
avec le pret qu'elle souhaite recevoir elle tient a renforcer so commerce en achetant de la porcelaine de Chine; de Sevres; des flutes a champagnes, des verres en cristal; des produits qui marchent bien , puisque sesclients lui demandent ses produits durant les festivites de mariage et differentes ceremonies.

Tres strategique,elle est parfois ambulante ou fait des depots dans les administrations pour accroitre ses revenus, malgre la crise , elle s'efforce a trouver de nouveaux creneaux de vente pour joindre les bouts du mois; et aider sa famille pour subvenir aux etudes des enfants qui sont a l'universite. 
tres connu dans le marche, elle a une bonne reputation.
texts.en:
This 44-year old businesswoman has two children of 23 and eight years old, who are at secondary and primary school respectively; aware of her responsibilities and in order to appease her poverty and improve her family's living conditions, she set herself up selling crockery in 2000. She has an average turnover of 15,000 to 50,000 francs a day. 

With this loan that she is hoping to get, she is keen to strengthen her business by buying china, porcelain, champagne flutes, crystal glasses, products which sell well, since her customers request these products for marriages and various other ceremonies.

Her strategy is to sell on a door-to-door basis or deposit her goods in government buildings in order to increase her income. Despite the crisis she is making an effort to find new places to sell in order to make ends meet each month and to be able to help her family cover the costs of the children who are at university. She is very well known in the market and has a good reputation.

loans.use: Purchase of pots, plates and glasses

loans.name: Segundo Manuel

texts.es:
Segundo Manuel C. I. tiene 31 años. Es soltero vive con los padres, vive  en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. No  Tiene  hijos.

Segundo pertenece a la Ventanilla La Florida ubicada a media hora del Cantón  San Miguel, es un grupo que se dedica a la agricultura como fuente para los ingresos de las familias, esta ventanilla tiene 14 miembros.

Segundo se dedica a la agricultura, siembra maíz, trigo, fréjol y papa,  las comprar las realiza en San Miguel y vende en el mercado de San Miguel y en la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para la siembra maíz, trigo, fréjol y papa. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades de la familia. Su sueño es que la economía aumente.
Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Segundo Manuel C. I. 31 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the canton of San Miguel in Bolívar Province. He does not have children.

Segundo is a member of the Communal Bank “La Florida”, which is located a half hour away from the canton of San Miguel. The group engages in agriculture as the main source of income for their families. This Communal Bank has 14 members.

Segundo is a farmer who grows corn, wheat, beans, and potatoes. He purchases his supplies in San Miguel and sells at the San Miguel Market and in his community. Segundo is requesting a loan to purchase supplies for growing corn, wheat, beans, and potatoes. The support of this loan will help meet the needs of his family. His dream is to grow financially.

Segundo enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for growing corn, wheat, beans, and potatoes

loans.name: G.s. Nuñez Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario Núñez lo conforman María y Milagro del Socorro ambas poseen las mismas actividades económicas como la venta de comida. María realiza este trabajo todos los días pues es su principal fuente de ingresos para su hogar, es una Señora muy trabajadora y se encuentra feliz de juntarse con su Compañera de trabajo Milagros que también se dedica a lo mismo hace más de 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad económica como lo es la elaboración de comida. Pues es así que juntas deciden realizar este financiamiento con el fin de comprar materia prima.
texts.en:
The Solidario Núñez Communal Bank is comprised of María and Milagro del Socorro.  Both of them have the same business activity of selling food.

María does this every day as this is her main source of income for her household.  She is a very hard-working woman.  She is happy to join her work colleague, Milagros, who has been doing the same work for over five years.  She too makes food.  That is how they decided together to get a loan in order to buy ingredients.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana S. is a widow and has three children. She has no educational background. Nana produces and sells Fante kenkey (dumpling) at Elmina, which she has been doing for twelve years. Nana uses her income in seeing to the well-being of her family. Nana will use the loan to purchase more maize to prepare kenkey for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Nana plans to reinvest.

loans.use: To purchase more maize to prepare kenkey for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new shop and make his business bigger

loans.name: You

texts.en:
You B., 39, is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase fertilizer to improve his farming business. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to repair his house. B. is married and resides with his wife and three children in Bonteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia, an area known for its commerce with Thailand. 

B. is a farmer, earning an income of USD 3.5 per day. The family must spend USD 44 on food, USD 5 on electricity supply, and USD 15 on other necessary expenses every month.  This is B.'s first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to improve farm

loans.name: Terese

texts.en:
Terese owns a flower shop in northern Israe,l which also caters to special events and celebrations. She is the mother of four grown children with a business with huge potential. Terese is the backbone of her family and her flower and specialty shop makes it possible for her to earn a living with respect. Terese studied and worked in events planning and tourism and then worked within the educational system for years teaching music. In the mid 1990's, Terese opened her flower shop. At the same time, her husband was advancing as a tractor trailer driver. Unfortunately, hard times hit and the family suffered from an investment scam, which took them years to recover. Terese has kept the shop going and in recent years, she and her husband are seeing the light at the end of the tunnel.

Terese needs this loan to open a satellite location that is needed for special events. Funds will be used for plants, flowers and site setup to meet the high demand for special events and celebrations.

With the extra business coming in for celebrations and special events, Terese has hired a part-time sales person and assistant. In the future, she wants to hire two full-time employees to meet business needs and expand sales and her net income.

loans.use: To open a satellite location .

loans.name: Monaliza

texts.en:
Monaliza G. is from the village of Waterfall, Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 42 years old, married, and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Monaliza owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, junk foods, biscuits & toothpaste in the local community. Monaliza's husband has a motorela or habal-habal (transportation) services. Monaliza has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Monaliza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Monaliza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Monaliza is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like junk food & canned goods. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Monaliza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like junk food & canned goods.

loans.name: Ilhomjon

texts.ru: Султанов Илхомжон житель Гиссарского района. Ему 22 года. Он женат, имеет одного ребенка. Живет вместе с родителями. Жена, домохозяйка. Мама работает бухгалтером в одной коммерческой организации. Сам Илхомжон имеет средне – специальное образование, шафер. По специальности не работает. Занимается животноводство и одновременно торговлей. Он в основном разводит скот в дальнейшем для перепродажи их на мясо. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Ilhomjon S. lives in the Gissar Region. He is 22 years old, married, and has one child. He lives with his parents. His wife is a homemaker. His mother works as a bookkeeper in a commercial company. Ilhomjon has a technical education: he is a driver. He does not work in his field. He raises and sells livestock. He mainly raises cattle to resell for meat. He is taking out a loan to buy cattle.

loans.use: Purchasing cattle

loans.name: Leak

texts.en:
Mrs. Leak P. and her husband are farmers who own a 3-hectare plot of land where they grow rice to sell to support their family.  He is also a  fisherman. 

It is now time to plant rice in her field and and Mrs. Leak P. needs some money to do this work. To improve production, she is applying for a loan to buy rice seeds, fertilizer, gasoline, and a water pump. 

This couple supports four children, one is employed in garment factory, two are farmers, and one is a duck breeder. She and her family are living in Pongro village in Takeo province. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds, fertilizer, gasoline, and a water pump

loans.name: Melvis Del Rosario

texts.es: Melvis Del Rosario tiene 36 años, su actividad es la venta del servicio de limpieza. Hace más de 3 años que tiene este negocio, ella vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos menores de edad,  tiene un horario fijo y por el momento tiene cierta cantidad de clientes que son fijos. Por lo que Melvis solicita un préstamo para comprar aerosoles, ambientadores, pinesol entre otros productos.  Ella quiere tener los mejores productos, ser la atracción de los clientes y mantener en el negocio ya que es su fuente de ingreso.
texts.en: Melvis Del Rosario is 36 years old and has had a cleaning service for more than 3 years.  She lives with her husband and their two young children.  She has a fixed schedule and for the moment she has a certain number of fixed customers.  Melvis is asking for a loan to buy spray cans, air fresheners, Pinesol and other cleaning products.  She would like to have the best products in order to attract customers and maintain her business, since it is her source of income.

loans.use: to purchase cleaning products

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Fernando J. is from the village of Tuod, Manticao, Misamis Oriental. He is 52 years old and married, with 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Fernando sells seafood products including fish like sardines and milkfish. Fernando has been engaged in his business for more than 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Fernando joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fernando has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Fernando is requesting his second loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell, such as mackerel and sardines. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell such as mackerel and sardines

loans.name: Fidelima

texts.en:
Fidelima M. M. is a 46-year-old single mother of one. She operates a butcher shop and is able to raise her child with the income from her business. She has been operating the business for three years and employs two people. She has kept her business premises neat, thus attracting customers.

With a 50,000 KES loan, Fidelima will buy meat and rice to sell. She hopes to open other butcher shops in the future.

loans.use: To buy meat and rice

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.ru: Чеканов Хуршед проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Возраст, 39 лет. Женат. У него трое детей. Он более 5 лет занимается торговлей. В своей лавке он продает женскую и мужскую обувь. Еще он занимается продажей тканей. Кредит просит для покупки в оптом детской одежды и обуви, чтобы увеличить ассортимент своего товара.
texts.en: Khurshed C. lives in J.Rumy. He is 39 years old, married, and has three children. He has been working in trade for more than five years.  In his shop, he sells women’s wear and shoes.  He is taking out a loan to buy children's clothes and shoes wholesale, so that he can increase the variety of his goods.

loans.use: to buy children's clothes and shoes wholesale

loans.name: Erolon

texts.en:
M. is from the village of Talairon, Oroquieta City. She is 29 years old, married, and has one child. To make a living, M. runs a clothing business in the local community. M. has been engaged in her business for 10 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities. 

M. joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP with which she will purchase more clothes for her clothing business. This will be the second loan taken out by M. from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for her clothing business.

loans.name: María Josefina

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 21 De Noviembre se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

La señora María es socia fundadora del Banco comunal, es la fiscal de pagos y le gusta por las facilidades para conseguir los créditos y por los beneficios que da la institución. Tiene 42 años de edad, está separada y de esa relación tiene 3 hijos dos de los cuales ya son mayores de edad e independientes y uno de 10 años que estudian en  escuela.

Ella se desempeña como profesora en una escuela de la localidad, pero también se dedica al comercio, vende zapatos y productos Avon y Oriflame (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días en las mañanas en su escuela y por las noches visita a sus clientes para ofrecer sus productos, nos cuenta que también vende en su escuela a sus compañeras y a madres de familia que son sus clientes, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Sus productos los recibe en su casa y los zapatos los va a comprar a Quito. Tiene cuatro  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y zapatos.

Su sueño es tener un gran local.
texts.en:
The Banco Comunal 21 De Noviembre (November 21 Communal Bank) meets every fortnight in the Montecristi Canton, a place renowned for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its arts and crafts, celebrated both at national and international level. It is also the homeland of the famous Toquilla straw hats.

Meet María, a founding member of the communal bank who is also its Payment Supervisor. She likes being a member of her communal bank because it is easy to obtain loans and for the benefits provided by the institution. She is 42 years old and she is separated from her husband, with whom she has had 3 children: two are adults and economically independents, one is 10 years old and goes to school.

She is a professor in a school of her community, but at the same time she engages in trade selling shoes, Avon and Oriflame products (both Avon and Oriflame produce and sell beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and accessories for women). She works in the school every morning and at night she visits her customers to offer them her products. She told us that she also sells in her school, as she has customers among her colleagues and the students' mothers. She sells her products on credit and collects the cash every week-end. She goes to Quito to buy the shoes, while the beauty products are delivered to her at home. She has been engaging in this activity for four years and it is going very well for her.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and shoes.

She dreams of running a big shop.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and shoes.

loans.name: Gnor

texts.en:
Gnor, 41, is married and has a baby who is not enrolled in school yet. She and her husband live in a wooden house in Reuessey Kao commune, Phnom Penh. Gnor earns a living as a foreman for the construction workers of a small company. She and her husband earn $8.70 more or less each day.

With a loan Gnor and her husband could increase their income to meet their family’s needs. She will use her loan and money from her saving account to buy a second-hand motorbike in order to replace the old one which is often broken.

loans.use: to buy a second-hand motorbike.

loans.name: Justino

texts.pt:
nasceu na Provincia de Maputo, tem 39 anos de idade, vive maritalmente é pai de 3 filhos de 9 aos 12 anos todos vão a Escola. Fez  a 7ª classe não concluiu porque teve que cumprir o serviço militar obrigatório. Vive na casa própria com sua familia, responsabiliza se pelos seus irmãos que vivem na cidade enviando lhes em cada 3 meses 1.000.00mt.

Após ter cumprido o serviço militar obrigatòrio consegue aranjar um emprego na G4S como segurança, é trasferido para o Distrito de Namaacha onde fixa sua residência com a familia. Trabalha ha mais de 6 anos no periodo da manhã das 7h as 17h e no peiodo da noite das 17h as 7h do dia seguinte, auferindo mensalmente 2.932 que aplica nas dispesas da casa e da sua obra. Também conta com ajuda da sua mulher que é  funcionaria da fabrica de sumos no mesmo Distrito.

Este é o primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende compra de meterial de construção( cimento, areia, barrotes e mais)para dar continuidade da sua obra, ele tem vantagem porque constroi pessoalmente a sua casa.  trabalha com o BIM  e paga cem problema, conhece a hluvuku atraves dos colegas que são clientes da instituição.
texts.en:
Justino was born in Maputo Province. He is 39 years old, is married and has 3 children between 9 and 12 years old. All the children go to school. Justino finished 7th grade but did not finish school because he had to complete his obligatory military service. He lives in his own house with his family and supports his siblings, who live in the city, by sending them 1,000 meticais every three months.

After finishing his obligatory military service, he was able to get a job at G4S [translator's note: Group Four Securicor security company] as a security guard, and he was transferred to Namaacha District where he made his home with his family. For more than six years he has worked the day shift from 7:00 am until 5:00 pm and the night shift from 5:00 pm until 7:00 am the next day. Justino earns 2,932 meticais per month, which he uses for household expenses and for his construction project. He also relies on his wife's help; she works in the juice factory in the same District.

This is Justino's first loan with Hluvuku. He is asking for 10,000 meticais, which he will use to buy construction materials (cement, sand, beams and more) to continue work on his home. He has an advantage because he built his house himself. He has worked with BIM and made his payments with no problems. Justino learned about Hluvuku through coworkers who are customers of this institution.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (cement, sand, beams, etc.).

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 27 years old, single and lives with four family members (one of whom works). Hasan has owned a gym since 2005. He has a deep understanding of the field of training, fitness nutrition, health advice and consultation. He has a good reputation and is well known in his area. 

Hasan is requesting a $2700 loan. He is aiming to gain more profit so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a generator.

loans.name: Jeanine

texts.en:
Jeanine is a Rwandan entrepreneur married to a driver. They have four children between the ages of 4 and 13 years old. All of them are in school.

Since 2003, Jeanine has been selling charcoal. Her business has expanded, and in the time she once sold 20 sacks, she now sells 140.

She will use this loan to purchase more charcoal to sell to meet the growing demand in her business.

With the profits from her business, she plans to accumulate savings and renovate her family’s house. Her goal as a business woman is to become a wholesaler and run her own store.

loans.use: to buy charcoal for resale.

loans.name: El Milagro Oli Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama “EL MILAGRO OLI” y se ubica en el Estado de México; este municipio se distingue por las bellas fiestas del pueblo por su gente trabajadora y emprendedora, por su ganaderia y por la humildad en cada uno de sus habitantes. El grupo esta conformado por diez integrantes. La señora Carmen es la tesorera del grupo. Ella a trabajado en el comercio desde hace 20 años, requiere el prestamo para comprar ropa y sandalias playeras de baño y casuales, y asi tener una gran variedad de artículos para ofrecer a sus clientes. Ella tiene 39 años, estudió hasta la primaria y es casada, con las ganancias quiere ahorrar para brindarles una mejor calidad de vida y así seguir invirtiendo en su negocio que gracias a él se siente más emprendedora y que puede apoyar a su esposo en los gastos de la familia.
texts.en:
This group is called “El Milagro Oli” and located in the State of Mexico. Their town is known for its beautiful village festivals, the hardworking and enterprising people, its livestock industry, and the humility of each of its inhabitants. The group consists of 10 members.

Sra. Carmen is the group treasurer. She has worked in retail for 20 years. Carmen needs a loan to buy clothing, sandals, bathing suits, and casual wear so that she can offer a variety of products to her customers. She is 39 years old, married, and has an elementary school education. With her earnings, Carmen wants to set aside savings so that she can provide a better quality of life and continue investing in her business. She feels more like an entrepreneur and can help her husband with the family finances.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, sandals, bathing suits, and casual wear.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 42 years old and married to Ziporah. He has been operating his rental houses business for the past 11 months, making a monthly profit of KES 20,000. He has been loaned KES 12,000, which he plans to use to renovate the rental houses.

With the anticipated profits, he plans to buy another plot and built more rental houses. In the near future, he hopes to own more than five flats.

loans.use: to renovate his rental houses

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a married man with eight children; five attend school while three are underage for school. He lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, he has operated a jua Kali (recycled scrap metals) business, selling at the market to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase materials for his workshop business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for his workshop business.

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en:
Vardan works at the local school as a chess teacher. Unfortunately, a teacher's salary is too low to make ends meet. 

Vardan is also engaged in farming. Vardan would like to increase his herd and develop his land. With the requested loan, he plans to purchase livestock and forage. 

Agricultural development will help Vardan increase his income and ensure a brighter future for his family. Vardan lives with his parents and grandmother.

loans.use: to pay for livestock and forage.

loans.name: Haidee

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS FLORES DE YANACONA”; Situado a 10 minutos del mismo poblado de Urubamba, perteneciente al Departamento de Cusco.
La socia Hayde; tiene 32 años de edad, es casada, tiene 2 hijos de 17 y 7 años de edad, La socia se dedica  a la crianza de animales menores, para  la venta la socia cría gallinas y las vende, ella cría pollos, de doble pechuga y luego cuando crecer los lleva  a vender al mercado en Urubamba al por mayor, la socia trabaja comprando y vendiendo pollos, gallinas, gallos, la socia  se dedica a  la comercio de gallinas, en esta ocasión la socia desea poder comprar 40 aves para criarlas y reproducirla, y luego d esto venderlas en el mercado y ferias. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de aves de corral pollos y gallinas, para la venta.
La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a seguir cumpliendo de manera disciplinada el pago de las cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Hayde is a member of the "Las Flores de Yanacona" community bank which is located 10 minutes from Yanacona, Urubamba, in Cusco department.

Hayde is 32 years old, married, and has two children aged 17 and 7.  Her business is raising animals.  She raises hens and "double-breasted chickens".  When they have grown, she sells them in the market in Urubamba wholesale.  She works buying and selling chickens, hens and roosters.  On this occasion, Hayde would like to buy 40 birds to raise and breed, then sell in the market and street markets.  She is requesting this loan to buy farmyard birds (chickens and hens) to sell.

Hayde is grateful for the loan that she is receiving and values it.  She pledges to continue making her monthly loan repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to invest in buying farmyard birds (chickens and hens) to sell

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: El señor: Antonio nacido en la población de Itapochi - Santa Cruz, radicando actualmente desde hace 10 años en la comunidad de San Miguel perteneciente al municipio de la Guardia, convive  con la señora Dionicia y tienen 5 hijos ya mayores, el sr. Antonio se dedica a la agricultura justamente desde hace 10 años, es su primer crédito y lo va a destinar a la siembra de maní y lo que implica el preparado de la tierra. El señor Antonio esta a punto de conseguir la titulación de sus tierras, por ello el trabaja con esmero en la agricultura, estando agradecido por el préstamo.
texts.en: Antonio was born in the town of Itapochi-Santa Cruz but has lived in the community of San Miguel, La Guardia, for the last ten years.  He lives with Dionicia; they have five children who are all adults now.  Antonio has been a farmer for the last ten years.  This is his first loan and he plans to use it for his peanut crops, specifically in soil preparation.  Antonio is about to secure legal title of his land so he works very diligently at farming.  He is grateful for the loan.

loans.use: to invest in his peanut crop.

loans.name: Diamo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Diamo est créé depuis le 4 décembre 2007 il est composé de treize femmes qui sont animées d'un esprit d'entraide et mènent comme principale activité le commerce.

La responsable Adama est âgée de 38 ans elle est mariée mère de quatre enfants, elle a ses deux neveux en charge; elle s'active dans le commerce de poisson séché et capitalise une expérience de plus de dix ans. Elle est debout à droite habillée en boubou blanc avec des fleurettes roses et a levé la main droite.

Elle s’approvisionne au niveau du port de la capitale et revend au marché central de la ville.

Son prêt lui permettra d'augmenter la quantité de poisson séché pour satisfaire la clientèle et se faire plus de revenus.

Elle soutient son mari dans les dépenses de la famille et ses enfants pour leurs divers besoins. Elle souhaite avec ses bénéfices acheter un terrain pour ses enfants voire même leur construire une maison.
texts.en:
The Diamo solidarity group was established on December 4, 2007 and is made up of thirteen women who are inspired by a spirit of mutual assistance and run businesses primarily focused on trade.

Adama, the leader, is 38 years old. She is married and the mother of four children; her two nephews are in her care. She is very buS. in the trade of dried fish and makes the most of her more than ten years' experience. In the photo, Adama is standing at right, dressed in a white boubou [traditional African dress] with pink flowers and her right hand raised.

Adama gets her supplies at the port of the capital and resells them in the main marketplace in town.

Her loan will allow her to increase the quantity of dried fish in order to please her customers and increase her income.

Adama supports her husband in the expenses of the family and her children for their various needs. With her profits, she hopes to purchase a plot of land for her children, and perhaps even to build them a house.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish intended for sale.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a 32-year-old married woman with three children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been selling cassava flour for 17 years. She started with capital of 400,000 shillings and now has 4 million shillings. Her hardship is lack of capital, and her vision is having her own stock, building a better house and educating her children. Joyce needs the loan to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is 47 years old and lives in Catulayan, San Juan, Siquijor. She is married with three children. Her husband is a fisherman. She intends to buy a fishing net and her husband will manage said business. She earns,PHP  9,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan  of 5,000 PHP only  to purchase a new fishing net to use in catching fish.

Nena has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for one month. In the future, Nena hopes to acquire a big fishing boat for her husband to use in fishing.

loans.use: To purchase new fishing net to use in catching fish.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel de 56 años está casado con Reyda hace 28 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, de los cuales 3 son independientes. En su casa propia viven él y su esposa, su hija, su yerno y 2 nietos. La agricultura ha siso y será la actividad que lo mantendrá, a él y su familia, pues con todos estos años ha aprendido a negociar sus productos. En las parcelas de su propiedad, siembra papas de las variedades: “de color” y “única”, siendo éstas las más solicitadas. Además de arvejas de las variedades: “super mejorada”, “otrillo” y “rondo”. El trabajo del campo significa para Manuel, algo más que un sustento, es un entretenimiento, un arte, una dedicación. Sus plantas son cuidadas con cariño. Del mismo modo se dedica  ala compra y venta de ganado vacuno: toros y vacas; los que pasta y engorda, obteniendo de ganancia alrededor de 200 soles por cabeza. A la vez vende la leche que sus vacas producen ya sea para el consumo directo  para la elaboración de quesos y otros. Manuel se ve con la agricultura hasta el final de sus días, desea ampliar sus terrenos de producción y generar más ganancias. “Aquí nací y aquí moriré”, cuenta entre risas. Con su ayuda, Manuel accedería a su préstamo número 13 de MFP, por esa razón se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. “Santo Domingo de Tapo” es el nombre de su banco comunal, del que siente respaldo y confianza. Invertirá el dinero del crédito en la compra de semillas de arvejas y abonos de granja. Ahí destinará como 370 soles por bolsa de 25 kilos. Confía en que le sobrará el dinero para pagar la mano de obra para el proceso de siembra, cultivo y cosecha de sus tierras.
texts.en:
Manuel is 56 years old.  He has been married to Reyda for the last 28 years, and together they have four children of whom three are financially independent.  Manuel lives in his own home with with his wife, his daughter and son-in-law, and two grandchildren.  

Agriculture has been, and will be, the activity that keeps him and his family, and over the course of all these years he has learned the agriculture business.  He grows potatoes of the "de color" and "única" varieties on the parcels of land on his property, as these are the types that are most requested.  He also grows peas of the "super mejorada", "otrillo" and "rondo" varieties.  

Working in the fields signifies more to Manuel than just a means of sustenance.  It is a recreation, an art, a dedication.  His plants are tended with love.  He brings the same approach to his work buying and selling cattle, both bulls and cows.  He puts the cattle to pasture and fattens them up, obtaining earnings of about 200 soles per head.  At the same time, he sells the milk produced by his cows for either direct consumption, or for making cheese and other things.

Manuel sees himself working in agriculture until the end of his days.  He wants to expand his farming lands and generate more earnings.  "Here I was born, and here I will die", he tells us between laughs.  

With your help, Manuel will receive his 13th loan with MFP, and so he agrees to be punctual with his repayments.  “Santo Domingo de Tapo” is the name of his communal bank, in which he feels trust and confidence.  He will invest the money from his loan in purchasing pea seeds and farmyard manure.  He has allocated 370 soles for each 25 kilo bag.  The remaining money will be used to pay for labor for sowing, tending and harvesting his land.

loans.use: to buy pea seeds, sacks of manure and to hire workers.

loans.name: Las Vecinas (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Las Vecinas, está formado por 8 socias y 1 socio quienes trabajan en diferentes actividades, las mismas que le permiten solventar los gastos del hogar y así salir adelante con su familia. Viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es patrimonio cultural de la humanidad desde 1999, su mezcla entre lo colonial y lo moderno la hacen una ciudad muy bella, su gente mantienen la cultura y tradiciones, son personas muy cálidas y amables.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Mercedes, tiene 40 años y es casada. Su esposo es de profesión mecánico automotriz y labora en su propio taller, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.
 
Ella labora como empleada privada hace 3 años y trabaja de martes a sábados todo el día, en sus tiempos libres se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de varias marcas.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por una amiga, su primer crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de perfumes, cremas y cosméticos para tener más variedad para sus clientes.
 
Su meta es tener un negocio propio como un bazar.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Las Vecinas" is comprised of nine members who all work in different activities which allow them to cover household expenses and help their families get ahead.  They live in different parts of the city of Cuenca.  This city has been a World Heritage site since 1999.  Its mix of colonial and modern make it a beautiful city.  The local people maintain their culture and traditions and are very warm-hearted and kind.

One of the members of the group is Mrs. Mercedes.  She is 40 years old and married.  Her husband is an auto mechanic and has his own workshop.  They live in their own house.

She has been a domestic employee for three years, working Tuesday through Saturday, all day.  In her free time she sells different brands of cosmetics.

This is her first loan through the communal bank which she was invited to join by a friend of hers.  She plans to use the loan to buy perfumes, creams and cosmetics so she will have more variety to offer customers.

Her goal is to have her own business, something like a bazaar.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, creams and cosmetics.

loans.name: Huruma A Group

texts.en:
George is the facilitator of the Huruma A group. George and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

George takes care of 10 children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices and to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, George had a very good maize yield harvesting 11 bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, George was only able to harvest three bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to George and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, George will educate his children.

In 2012, the members of Huruma A group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Sokuseka Group

texts.en:
Marble is a 41-year-old single parent with one child who is 17 years old and who has just finished her secondary education. She lives in Gokwe. She operates a grocery shop and owns the premises. Marble has been in this business for 16 years and has one employee presently. Marble is requesting for a loan of $400 for the purchase of  grocery shop items.

Marble says that she faces the challenges of high competition and transport costs from wholesalers to her shop. Marble plans to open another shop at the same business center in Gokwe in the next five years, and to employ at least 5 people. With the income generated from this loan, she will be able to look after her extended family and other dependents from her rural home.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to resell.

loans.name: Adriana Mercedes

texts.es:
Adriana Mercedes se dedica a la actividad de docencia en el municipio de El Sauce desde hace muchos años, es una persona de buenas costumbres la cual le enseña a los niños de todas las edades. 

Es madre de tres hijos los cuales los está preparando para que sean profesionales y personas de bien para la sociedad.

Actualmente, está solicitando un crédito para mejorar su vivienda el cual será invertido exclusivamente en la compra de materiales como  ladrillos, cemento, arena y pago de mano con el fin de construir la cocina ya que no cuenta con este espacio por lo que en el futuro tendrá mejores condiciones de vida su familia.
texts.en:
Adriana Mercedes has been a teacher in El Sauce for many years.  She is a woman of good habits, something she imparts to her students who are of all ages.

Adriana Mercedes is raising her three children to work in professional careers and to be useful members of society.

Adriana Mercedes is applying for a loan to improve her house.  She plans to pay for construction materials--bricks, cement, sand, etc.--and labor to build a kitchen because she doesn't have one now.  She wants to make the investment because it will improve the family's quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for the construction materials she needs to improve her house.

loans.name: Reyneria

texts.es: Reyneria, de 60 años, es una mujer muy valiente y luchadora, toda su vida se la paso trabajando mucho para así poder sacar adelante a sus ocho hijos a quienes dio educación y crío junto a su esposo. Con el tiempo sus hijos crecieron y ahora son independientes. Ahora ella vive a lado de dos de sus hijos y su esposo con quien sigue trabajando mucho para poder tener una vejez tranquila. El trabajo de Reyneria consiste en la venta de comida,  por las mañanas desde muy temprano sale al mercado en busca de las frutas y verduras mas frescas y nutritivas para así tener lo mejor de lo mejor para sus fieles comensales, quienes van a su local en busca de los diversos y deliciosos platos innovadores que prepara. Por las mañanas solo vende jugos y algunos sándwiches, mientras que a partir de las 10 am comienza con la venta de menú, todo su trabajo lo realiza en su casa en donde acondiciono algunas mesas y sillas para recibir a sus clientes. Además de esto también vende bebidas gaseosas, todo su trabajo lo hace sola ya que su esposo trabaja en otras actividades. Le esta yendo muy bien, gana un buen porcentaje de lo que invierte y siente que el esfuerzo que tuvo al principio de trabajar solo para recuperar su inversión ahora le esta dando frutos, ya que tiene clientes que se los gano durante estos 15 años que lleva realizando éste trabajo. Ahora se prepara para mejorar su infraestructura y dar mejores comodidades a sus clientes. Este será el crédito número 5 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero para poder continuar aumentando su capital de trabajo, además esta convencida que seguirá siendo la socia buena y responsable de los créditos obtenidos anteriormente, le gusta pertenecer al banco comunal al que trabaja ya que todos son responsables y muy solidarios entre si. Con el monto solicitado 2500 soles, comprará ingredientes no perecible y vivieres para así tener en grandes cantidades y no tener que ir al mercado muy seguido en busca de ellos, además comprará bebidas para seguir vendiendo.
texts.en: Reyneria is 60 years old. She is a brave woman and a fighter. She has worked hard her whole life to be able to get her 8 children ahead. She gave them an education and raised them with her husband. In time, her children grew and now they are on their own. Now she lives with two of her children and her husband, with whom she still works a lot to be able to have a good life. Reyneria's job is selling food. She goes out early in the morning to the market seeking fruit and vegetables to be able to have the best for her faithful customers. They go to her locale seeking the varied and delicious and innovative dishes she makes. She only sells juices and some sandwiches in the morning and at 10 she begins to sell from the menu. She does all her work at her house where she set up some tables and chairs to receive customers. In addition, she also sells soft drinks. She does all the work herself, since her husband works at other activities. It is going very well for her. She makes a good percentage of what she invests and she feels that the effort she made at the beginning just to get her investment back is getting results now. She has customers that she earned during those 15 years that she has been doing this job. Now she is preparing to improve her infrastructure and make things more comfortable for her customers. This will be loan number 5 with MFP. She is very happy that she will have financial support to keep increasing her working capital. She is also convinced that she will continue being the good and responsible member she was with the previous loans. She likes belonging to the communal bank since they are all responsible and supportive of each other. With the amount she has asked for of 2500 soles, she will buy non-perishable ingredients and produce in large quantities so she doesn't have to go to the market so often, as well as buy beverages to keep selling.

loans.use: to buy meat and products such as soft drinks, to have ready to prepare her food.

loans.name: Micheal

texts.en:
Michael is 39 years old and married two children living in Masindi, Uganda. For the last nine years he has been dealing in phones and accessories. He started by hawking phones and after saving enough he rented an outlet. His dream is to educate his children and save for a wedding. 

He is challenged by customers not paying on time and the high cost of rent. Micheal wants a loan to buy phones for resale.

loans.use: to buy phones for resale.

loans.name: Melody

texts.en:
Melody is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy more items to sell like can goods, bread, egg, milk, sugar, etc for her general store business.

Melody has been in this business for 21 years. Melody earns more income from food vending.

Melody has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like can goods, bread, egg, milk, sugar, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on the stock of kiosk business.

loans.name: Elshan

texts.en: Elshan is an IDP from occupied Kelbadjar district of Azerbaijan. He came to Baku in 1993. In 2000 he started his business and in 2003-2006 he borrowed three loans totaling $700 totaling from Normicro Baku branch. Now he would like to borrow $1000.

loans.use: To increase variety of goods

loans.name: Sipriano

texts.en:
Mr. T. sells roast chicken from his business on one of the major streets in the Benito Juarez neighborhood. He cooks the chicken himself, but because his business doesn't have a seating area he can only sell for take-out. "I would like to expand my business and add some tables. Many people come here to eat but don't stay and buy because I don't have seating. I'm asking for $1200 to change this."

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Alexis Hult

El Sr. T. tiene su negocio ubicado en la colonia Benito Juárez, sobre una de las calles principales de ese sector, el tiene la venta de pollos asados, él mismo los prepara, como no cuenta con un comedor, todo lo que vende es para llevar. "Quisiera ver la posibilidad de ampliar mi negocio e instalar varias mesas para que la gente venga a comer ya que mucha de ella al ver que no cuento con ese servicio ya no me compran les pido su ayuda para lograrlo, se requieren $1,200.00 dlls".

loans.use: To expand business and add a seating area.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.es:
Business Description

Narcisa has four years experience with her business. When she was young, she began working at home where she was saving money. With this effort, she was able to buy a refrigerator and shelves, and by her own initiative, she began her little shop. The business has gone very well for her. She works every day of the week from 6 a.m. until 11 p.m.

Loan Use

She will invest the loan to boost her business with another line of products. Some of the products include: milk, games, candies, and cleaning products.

Personal Information

Narcisa is a single mother. She has two children that are studying. Narcisa is 31 years old. Her older son helps her by attending to the clients when she is on vacation. Her main desire is to attain security for her business and finish constructing her little cement home.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

Narcisa tiene una experiencia de 4 años con su negocio. Desde joven se inicio trabajando en casa de donde fue ahorrando. Con su esfuerzo logro comprarse una nevera y una percha. Por iniciativa propia pone su tiendita. Le ha ido muy bien. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 6 a.m. hasta las 11 p.m.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá surtir su negocio con otra clase de productos. Como lo son: leche, jugos, confites, y productos de limpieza.

Información Personal

Narcisa es madre soltera. Tiene 2 hijos los que estudian. Ella tiene 31 años. Su hijo mayor le ayuda con la atención de los clientes cuando esta en vacaciones. Su deseo primordial es poder darle seguridad a su negocio y terminar de construir su casita de cemento.

loans.use: Boost her business with more products: milk, games, candy, and cleaning products.

loans.name: Sahib

texts.en: Sahib B. is a 32-year-old farmer who live with his family, consisting of three children and his wife. Sahib lives in the Azerbaijani southern part of Saatli region. Sahib has two milk cows and sells dairy products to the local and capital traders. Sahib has four years of experience in selling dairy products. The milk products are in very high demand all across Azerbaijan and people use yoghurt and milk almost every day.  Sahib’s orders for these products are very high but the milk his cows give is not enough for traders and he decided to apply for 900 USD to purchase an additional cow and fodder.

loans.use: Purchase one one milk cow

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna E. is 68 years old and lives in Benin City, in the Edo State of Nigeria. She is a married mother of seven children and has been a LAPO client for six years.

She sells goats in the market. She is seeking a loan of $275 to buy more goats for sale.

loans.use: To buy more goats

loans.name: Wilfrida

texts.en: Wilfrida (smiling in the photo) is a 43-year-old widow who lives with her 7 living children at Sinaga Siaya Kenya. Her husband died in 1999. She initiated her fish-selling business in 1996. Wilfrida buys omena (a type of fish which is the locals’ favorite) in bulk and sells to consumers in small quantities. The omena is normally packed in bags going at US$93.75 a bag. She has applied for US$700 to enable her to purchase more omena to sell during this dry season when the demand tends to be high.

loans.use: Purchase stock of fish (omena)

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Mrs Carmen Graciela Martínez, owns a grocery store named “Carmen Graciela”, located in the city of San Ignacio Misiones.

She got married approximately 10 years ago and from that union she has a daughter attending preschool. She is separated and now she lives with a different man with whom she has a 3 year old daughter.

Her grocery store is well supplied and her husband delivers all types of merchandise to other business by motorcycle. Among the many products she sells are: sugar, flour, noodles, rice, fruits, vegetables, meat, milk, eggs, chicken, etc.

Carmen is requesting a loan to be used for purchasing merchandise in big quantities in order to obtain better discounts from her providers.

Translated from Spanish by Gabriel Santamaria, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Carmen Graciela Martínez, es propietaria de una despensa llamada “Carmen Graciela”, ubicada en la ciudad de San Ignacio Misiones.

Se casó hace 10 años aproximadamente; de ese matrimonio tuvo una hija que se encuentra en la escuela primaria; se separó y actualmente vive en pareja con otro hombre con el que tiene una nena de 3 años.

Su despensa está bien surtida y su marido realiza reparto de todo tipo de mercaderías a los demás negocios en moto. Entre los productos que comercializa podemos citar: azúcar, harina, fideo, arroz, frutas, hortalizas, carne, leche, huevos, pollos, etc.

Carmen solicita un crédito ya que con el mismo planea adquirir mercaderías en grandes cantidades, de esta forma obtiene mayores descuentos de sus proveedores.

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise such as sugar, flour, noodles, rice, fruits, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Parvina

texts.ru:
Parvina H. is 25 years old, single and does not have children. She has a college degree in programming. Parvina works as a programmer in the regional trade union of the city of Kurgan-Tube. She plans to use the obtained credit to purchase a personal computer to use at home. Having a computer at home will allow her to perfect her programming skills. She is planing to use her salary to repay the loan. Parvina is planing to repay the loan over a period of 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Хакимова Парвина, возраст – 25 лет, образование - высшее, по специальности программист, не замужем, детей не имеет. Парвина работает в областном профсоюзе города Курган-Тюбе на позиции программист. Полученный кредит она хочет использовать на приобретение собственного компьютера для дома. Кредит поможет ей приобрести собственный персональный компьютер для дома и совершенствовать свои зания в этой области. Кредит она планирует выплачивать за счёт получаемой заработной платы. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: to purchase a computer

loans.name: Mahmadrajab

texts.ru:
Mahmadrajab B. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi region. He is 46 years old, is married and has 6 children. Mahmadrajab has a college education and is a veterinarian by profession. He raises livestock. Mahmadrajab purchases calves, fattens them for 40-45 days and then resells them at a higher price when they are worth more and are used for meat. He then purchases new calves and repeats the process. This is his business model. This business helps to support his family as Mahmadrajab is the sole earner in his family.

The expansion of the livestock sector allows for the provision of markets with quality meat at affordable prices. Mahmadrajab has been in the livestock business for 22 years and will use this loan to purchase more calves. He will pay back the loan over a 12 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Бобиев Махмадраджаб житель района Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 46 лет, женат, имеет 6 детей.Образование высшее. По специальности ветеренар. Занимается животноводством. Покупает молодых бычков , откармливает около 40-45 ддней а затем продает по более высокой цене, так как откормленные и подросшие бычки сточт дороже и их используют на мясо.Затем он покупает новый молодняк , откармливает и продает. Так по этой схеме действует его бизнес.Этот бизнес помогает обеспечивать его семью так как клиент является единственным кормильцем семьи. Кроме того развитие животноводческого сектора позволяет обеспечить рынки полноценным мясом и по доступным ценам.Занимается животноводством клиент уже около 22года.Поэтому клиент планирует получить кредит для того чтобы купить бычков. Погаситькредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase calves

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is an internally displaced person (IDP). He started working as electrician assistant when he was 17 years old. When he started working on his own, he understood that there’s a big need for education in this field because you can’t learn only in practice. So he got his professional education as an electrician from Baku Technical Profession School in 2000. Now he has his own chain of clients who feel happy when they leave his garage because they know that they won’t be going back there for a long time. He needs this loan to change his tools and purchase materials.

loans.use: Purchase materials

loans.name: Chin

texts.en:
Mrs. Chin N. is a 51 years old. She earns about $5 a day from selling groceries. N. lives with four children in Svay At Village, Pursat Province. Her husband, Mr. Hem Vann, is 53 years old. Vann earns about $5 per day being a motor taxi driver and pig breeder.

N. requests a loan of $500 to buy grocery stocks. The remainder of the loan is to buy small pigs to raise. This loan helps increase their overall income and improve the living condition of the family.

loans.use: To buy grocery stock for the business, and the remainder of the loan is to buy small pigs to raise.

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en: Shahnaz is 36 years and is married to M.S., who is a milkman by profession. He has done this for the last six years. Currently, Shahnaz and her husband live in a two room brick house in Kasur, Pakistan, which is famous for its sweetmeat.  She has applied for a loan of $625 to help with her husband’s business.  Shahnaz has been joined in her loan group by two more members:  Sabiha wants a loan to buy a buffalo; and Sugran wants a loan to expand her shuttering business.  This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Carmen Maria

texts.es:
Carmen is 42 years old, married, and has a 10 year old son. They live in the La Fuente neighbourhood of the city.

She has a small cheese-making business, where her husband is also employed as a dairy technician. She has 28 years of experience in the industry and prior to starting her own business, she was involved in the training of small cheese-making businesses.

Carmen is a very enterprising woman. She started her business using her own capital and is always willing to train those involved in cheese-making as an additional source of income for their families. Her future plan is to put the business on a firmer footing and create a formal cheese production family business.

Carmen requires the loan to buy milk so that she can continue to supply the cheeses that her customers love so much.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Carmen es una pequeña comerciante que se dedica a la elaboración de quesos. Tiene 28 años de experiencia en la elaboración de quesos, anteriormente se desempeñaba brindando capacitaciones a pequeños productores, comenzó su negocio con capital propio. Es una mujer muy emprendedora, y siempre la están buscando para que brinde capacitaciones a los productores que también elaboran quesos artesanales. Los planes para un futuro es poder llegar a poner una empresa familiar de producción de queso.
