Ainsi, elle sollicite un quatrième prêt pour acheter auprès de ses fournisseurs de Sikasso mais aussi de Bamako,  45 paquets de boissons NBB, 50 casiers de boissons BRAMALI, 72 cartons d’eau minérale, 10 cartons de lait Candia, 32 cartons de boisson en canette de différentes qualités (Malta, Vimto, Ivorio, etc), 17 paquets d’eau minérale en sachets, des cartons de biscuits de qualité différentes, etc.
Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 350 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
A native of Sikasso and 29-years-old, Fatoumata is a divorcée and the mother of two boys. She lives in a large traditional extended area of Médine- Sikasso (third administrative region of the republic of Mali). 

After having conducted many businesses without success, Fatoumata started in the business of buying and selling groceries more than five years ago. She conducts her business in front of her home in Médine, Sikasso, where she is sought after by her customers for the quality of her products. 

To satisfy her growing number of customers, she decided to rejoin the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso more than two years ago and she has already received three loans which have been successfully repaid. Thus, she requests a fourth loan in order to buy from the suppliers from Sikasso and also from Bamakano, 45 packets of NBB beverages, 50 cases of BRAMALI drinks, 72 cartons of mineral water, 10 cartons of Candia milk, 32 cartons of different kinds of canned drinks (Malta, Vimto, Ivorio, etc.), 17 packages of mineral water in pouches, boxes of different types of biscuits, etc.

With this loan, she plans to make a monthly profit of 350,000 FCFA which will essentially be used to cover her family expenses, to pay the loan interest and to invest the rest in the business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her grocery store

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: El señor Jesús, es comerciante de  cabezas de llamas y también es maestro curandero, es decir que cura a la gente usando hierbas medicinales. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de más llamas, para luego vender su carne y las cabezas a los mercados donde se cocinan y se hacen comidas con carne de llama, que por ciento es muy apetecida y más saludable que la carne de res. Vive en casa propia la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Pasankeri  en la ciudad de La Paz, es viudo  y tiene cinco   hijos. Jesús es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2008 y esta será la segunda vez que su solicitud de crédito sea canalizada a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. Jesús sells llama heads and is also a master practitioner of folk medicine. He says that he can cure people through the use of medicinal herbs. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy more llamas so that he can eventually sell the meat and the heads at the markets where dishes using these ingredients are prepared. Llama meat is known for being more appealing and healthier than beef. Jesús lives in his own home in the District of Pasankeri in the city of La Paz. He is a widower and has five children.

Jesús has been a client of IMPRO since 2008. This is the second time that his loan request has been referred to Kiva for funding.

loans.use: to purchase llamas to raise and for eventual resale.

loans.name: Cramita Benilda

texts.es:
Carmita de 39 años, es una mujer trabajadora que es vendedora de cosméticos. Poco a poco fue desarrollando su negocio con variedades de cosméticos. En la actualidad trabaja vendiendo los productos por revistas a sus vecinos y amigos. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere comprar mas cosméticos, perfumes para mejorar y variar la mercadería que ahora tiene ya que quiere que sus clientes tengan mas oportunidad al comprar la mercadería.
texts.en:
Carmita is 39 years old and she is a very hardworking woman. She is a cosmetics vendor. Gradually she developed her business to include a variety of cosmetics. Currently she works selling all of types of products through magazines to her neighbors and her friends.

She has great aspirations for her business, which is why she wants to purchase more cosmetics and perfumes. She will improve and add variety to the merchandise she now has. She wants to give her clients more opportunities to purchase merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and perfumes.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married woman with three children, two of whom attend school while one is too young for school. Her husband is a taxi driver who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She has a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Mwanajuma has operated a charcoal selling business for the past four years. Her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of transporting her goods from point of purchase to her place of business. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu because of its good customer care.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Nilo

texts.en: Nilo is a married man with 10 children. He is a fisherman from Trinidad, Bohol. Nilo and his wife sell his catch at the market. Aside from fish, Nilo also sells seaweed. Nilo requested a loan to purchase fishing nets and more seaweed to sell. Nilo hopes to have a successful business in the future. He also hopes for his children to finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and more seaweed to sell.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is 30 years old, married, and has four children.  To earn a living, she does bicycle repairs and sells bicycle spare parts.  She has twelve years of experience in the business and has employed one person.  She also does farming for more income.

Damaris hopes to have a well-stocked spare parts shop in the future.  She has requested 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy bicycle spare parts.

loans.use: To buy bicycle spare parts.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, canned goods, soap, soft drinks, and sweets.

loans.name: Alfonso Esteban

texts.es:
El señor Alfonso Esteban es casado, tiene 50 años de edad, estudió la educación primaria, tiene 5 hijos 2 de los cuales estudian, se dedica ala tejeduría, inició este trabajo como operario y lleva 8 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien se dedica al tricotado de hilo.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de hilos de diferente clases y colores, y producir mas tejido, espera en el futuro ver un negocio rentable.
texts.en: Alfonso Esteban is 50, married and studied up to primary school.  He has 5 children, of whom 2 are students.  He has a weaving business which he has run for the past 8 years.  His wife assists him to knit the fiber into cloth items.  He now seeks a loan to buy thread and fiber of varied colors and kinds to increase his production of woven items, in order to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy thread and fiber for weaving cloth

loans.name: Maruni Group

texts.en:
Liru is the facilitator of the Maruni group. Liru and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Liru takes care of 10 children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Liru had a very good maize yield harvesting 7½ bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Liru was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize on ½ an acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Liru  and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Liru will educate his children and save for the future.

In 2012, the members of Maruni group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Hiru is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy jeans, skirts, boots, tops, and blankets

loans.name: Erika Marcela

texts.es:
La Señora Ericka Marcela es originaria del municipio de Telica, Actualmente se desempeña como maestra de educación primaria en un colegio de la localidad donde tiene muchos años de laborar y por ende ha adquirido mucha experiencia en el trabajo de la docencia.

Tiene un año de trabajar con Ceprodel donde se le han otorgado dos créditos para la construcción de su vivienda con el fin de tener su propio hogar ya que habita en casa de su mamá. Una de las necesidades que tiene en estos momentos es adquirir un nuevo crédito para la compra de ladrillos, zinc, cemento y pago de mano de obra ya que poco a poco está construyendo dicha casita para tener un hogar digno para su hijo que tanto ama y desea darle muy buenas condiciones para su desarrollo.
texts.en:
Ericka Marcela is from the municipality of Telica. She is currently working as a primary school teacher in a local school, where she has worked for many years. Through this she has acquired much experience in the teaching profession. 

She has been a client of Ceprodel for one year, and she has received two loans for the construction of her house. The goal is to have her own home, since she still lives in her mother's house. One of her needs at this time is to take out a new loan to buy bricks, metal sheets and cement, and to pay for labor. Little by little she is constructing this little house, so that she can have a proper home for her child whom she loves so much. She wants to give him a good environment for his development.

loans.use: to buy bricks, metal sheets and cement, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and supplies.

loans.name: Meluan

texts.en:
Meluan has applied for his third loan. He has planned to purchase farm inputs, i.e. fertilizers, seeds and chemicals, and to also buy animals for fattening. He has a good history with KADET LTD. His farming business is doing very well, and he is happy.

He intends to use the returns from the loan to plow back into farming and, in part, to repay the loan. His dreams are to become a famous farmer in the area and to educate his kids to a higher level of education.

He is hardworking man who aims to achieve if funded.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs, i.e. fertilizers, seeds and chemicals, and to also buy animals for fattening.

loans.name: Oluwatobi-Pouce Group

texts.fr: OLUWATOBI-POUCE est un groupement composé de vingt un personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la quatrième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Ahouandjinou (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 54 ans. Ahouandjinou est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Dossè. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Ahouandjinou et son mari. Pour cette raison, Ahouandjinou vend du vin de palme à son domicile. Ahouandjinou fait la transformation des noix de palme, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Ahouandjinou s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Ahouandjinou sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe OLUWATOBI-POUCE, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des noix de palme et du vin de palme.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 32 years old. He is married with 2 children.

He has had a transportation business for 3 years. He will be using this loan to purchase a motorbike and hopes this will help him to pay school fess for his children.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to buy a taxi car .

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Maria De La Cruz

texts.en:
My name is Maria de la Cruz G., I cook and sell breakfast, lunches and snacks which include, burritos, enchiladas, tortillas with cheese, tacos, baleadas-honduran tacos, nacatamales-honduran specialty, and I have been doing this for 4 years, my business attracts a large variety of clientel who like how my food tastes. My business generates earnings to support my family and my children. My goal is to increase my production and to increase sales which will generate more profits that will enable me to remodel my business and to cover family expenses, especially the studies of my children.

Loan Use: Purchase of beef, chicken and pork, rice, beans, vegetables, tortillas, dough, fish, cheese, butter, eggs, water,disposable plates, cups and spoons, churros, sodas, coffee, sweet bread, oil, tomatoe sauce, lard, margarine, confectionaries and juices.

Mi nombre es Maria de la Cruz G., me dedico a la produccion y venta de desayunos, almuerzos y golosinas entre ellas burritas, enchiladas, tortillas con quesillo, tacos, baleadas, nacatamales, actividad la cual tengo de realizar por 4 años, mi negocio tiene una gran variedad de clientes ya que esta localizado en un lugar muy transitado por personas y a mis clientes les gusta el sabor de la comida que produzco. Mi negocio me genera ingresos para mantener mi familia y mis hijos. Mi meta es incrementar mi produccion y asi poder vender mas comida a mis clientes, esto me generara ganancias para poder remodelar mi negocio y cubrir los gastos familiares y especialmente el estudio de mis hijos.

loans.use: Compra de carne de res, pollo y cerdo, arroz, frijoles, vegetales, tortillas, masa, pescado, quesillo, queso, mantequilla, huevos, agua, platos vasos tenedores y cucharas desechables, churros, refrescos, cafe, pan dulce, aceite, salsa de tomate, manteca, margarina, confites, jugos.

loans.name: Fololina

texts.en: Fololina never gives up on her business because she is sure that “she can earn more money from her farm.” Her husband doesn't have another job but instead helps her with the farm work. She sells her bananas in the town market while her husband tends the farm. It is a lively joint family business which sustains their family needs.

loans.use: To purchase planting materials, organic fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Shah Be Be

texts.en: Shah is 55 years old lives with 6 family members in district two in Kabul Afghanistan. Her husband died in the Afghanistan war and she also has a son. Her son owns a gallery shop and they want to expand it. So she wants to take a loan out for her son to expand the business and get more income, improving his life and to support his family economically.

loans.use: Expand jewelry store.

loans.name: Tek

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok Nim is 27 years old and works two jobs in Kampong Cham. First, she is a garment factory worker and earns a daily income of $2 from this job. Second, she sells dried fish on the roadside, giving her about $1/day. Her husband is a driver for a private company and earns about $3/day in this business.

This loan will be used to purchase dried fish to resell in her stall. In the future, she hopes to expand her fish sales so she doesn't have to work in the garment factory anymore.

loans.use: To purchase dried fish for her roadside stall

loans.name: Yun

texts.en:
Yun is a widow with 3 daughters She started her business selling grocery items at her house in 2006. One of her daughters assists her in the business. Her other 2 daughters have been working in the garment factory for over 10 years. They are polite and well respected by their neighbors.

Yun would like to borrow $700 from MAXIMA (her first loan) to buy more grocery items so that her neighbors can purchase the food and other things they use daily without spending a lot of time traveling to the market. Yun will not have any problem repaying the loan because they have a good business.

loans.use: Purchasing grocery items for her inventory

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice E. is a very active and enterprising woman. She is 40 years old, a married mother of three children, and lives in Benin.

In order to take care of her family, Eunice started her own business selling drugs 17 years ago. She studied her business for three years. She has been in LAPO as leader of her union for four years. She is requesting $400 to buy more drugs for sale.

loans.use: To buy more medicine

loans.name: Nasiran

texts.en: I am Nasiran B.. I am a mother of nine: four sons and five daughters. I live with my family in Arifwala, a small city in Pakistan. My husband is a very ambitious person; he wants to help his children by offering them a good future. He operates a shoe store in a nearby market. Eid (a Muslim religious festival) is around the corner and we would like to secure a larger  variety of shoes for our store. We lack the necessary funds for this purpose and hence are requesting this loan so that we may secure higher profits this Eid.

loans.use: Buy greater variety of shoes

loans.name: Anorhol

texts.ru:
Anorhol U. is 44 years old, has a high school education, is married and has 7 children. Anorhol purchases peanuts at wholesale prices and resells them. She plans to use her loan to purchase peanuts for further resale. She has been in this business for 1 year. She will purchase the peanuts in the Khuroson region and will sell them in Dushanbe to wholesale customers, thereby earning profits and helping her husband to support their big family.

Anorthol will pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Юлдошева Анорхол, возраст 44 года, образование среднее, замужем, имеет 7-х детей. Анорхол занимается оптовой куплей-продажей фисташек. На полученный кредит она планирует закупить партию фисташек у оптовых продавцов для дальнейшей их продажи. Этим бизнесом она занимается в течение одного года. Она приобретает фисташки в районе Хуроссон и продаёт их в городе Душанбе оптоывым покупателям, тем самым получая прибыль и помогая своему мужу содержать свою большую семью. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of peanuts for resale

loans.name: Mohira

texts.ru:
Mohira H. is 43 years old, has a high school education, is divorced and has 2 children. Mohira is a wholesaler of cotton. She has been in this business for 10 years. This is her main source of income. Mohira will use her loan to purchase a large amount of cotton. This loan will help her to get the required quantity of cotton, which she plans to resell after processing. Local residents will have the opportunity to purchase cotton from her, as it used in making mattresses and comforters. She plans to pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Ходжаева Мохира, возраст – 43 года, образование – среднее, разведённая, имеет 2-х детей. Мохира занимается оптовой продажей ватой. Этим видом деятельности она занимается уже в течение 10 лет. Это её основной источник дохода. Полученный кредит он хочет исползовать на приобретение большого количества ваты. Данный кредит поможет ей приобрести необходимое количество ваты, которая после обработки она планирует продать. Местные жители будут иметь возможномть приобретать у неё вату, так как она используется для пошива нациоанльных матрасов и одеял. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase Cotton for Sale

loans.name: Kabumbi Iii B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Damalie K.. She is currently in the business of brick laying and is requesting a loan to invest in her business. Damalie is 29 years old and is single. She has 1 child aged 3. Each week, Damalie makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to construct a house. Damalie has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to rent a piece of land for brick laying and the loan was paid back on time.

Damalie is joined in her small group by Beatrice K., Rosemary R., Joan S., and Justine N.. Beatrice K. has a business selling clothes and wants to boost business. Rosemary R. is currently operating a business in clothing sales and wants a loan to purchase more clothes to sell. Joan S. operates a business of used clothing sales and wants to increase inventory. Justine N. is currently in the business of selling clothes and is requesting a loan to add more working capital.

loans.use: To add capital to brick business

loans.name: Kosimova

texts.ru:
M. Kosimova is 35 years old, is married and has 2 children. M. and her husband have a bakery in their home where they make flatbread. M. sells the flatbread at the market. Her flatbread is in high demand at the market and 8 people currently work in her bakery. M. has been a client since May of 2007. She felt that taking out her first loan would increase her sales and product assortment. She plans to us her next loan to open an additional sales point to sell her products.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Косимова Муаззам возрост 35 лет , замужем имеет 2 детей .Она со своим мужем на дому имеет хлебопекарный цех, по выпечке лепешек. Сама Муаззам продает на базаре лепешки. Ее лепешки имеют хороший спрос на рынке.У нее в цеху сейчас работает 8 человек.Муаззам кредитуется с мая 2007 года.Она почувсвовала что взяв первый кредит у нее увеличился оборот,и ассортимент.В дальнейшем она планирует взяв следующий займ открыть ще одну точку реализации своей продукции.

loans.use: Make and sell flatbread

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị T., 48 years old, joined TYM fund in 1999. Her family is composed of 4 members: she, her husband and their 2 children. In the beginning, she used her savings plus the loan from TYM to buy machinery to husk rice. Her income has increased, the family living condition has improved a lot. After a while, she has opened a metal shop making iron doors, even boat parts. They are very busy with the work, their 2 children help out also. Despite the busy schedule, she makes time for herself to participate in her group activities. Her family income is 180-200 USD a month. She is seeking a loan of 625 USD to buy iron.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị T., 48 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 1999. Gia đình chị gồm 2 vợ chồng và 2 con đã trưởng thành. Thời gian đầu, với nguồn vốn tự có kết hợp với vốn vay của Quỹ, chị T. đầu tư vào mua máy xát gạo phục vụ nhân trong xã. Thu nhập tăng lên, đời sống gia đình được cải thiện rõ rệt. Sau một thời gian, chị đã mở thêm cửa hàng sắt với hoạt động chủ yếu là mua sắt về làm cửa sắt và gò hàn các vật dụng khác như thuyền chở lúa, ... Công việc bận rộn, chồng và 2 con đều hỗ trợ chị rất tích cực trong công việc cũng như tạo điều kiện cho chị tham gia các hoạt động của Quỹ. Mức thu nhập hiện nay của gia đình chị T. khoảng 180-200USD. Vòng vốn này chị đề nghị xin vay 625USD để mua sắt làm hàng.

loans.use: Buy iron

loans.name: Madronio

texts.en:
Madronio R. is married and has three sons; two are above 18 years old and both work in construction. The youngest is a girl who attends primary school.

Madronio runs a grocery store where he sells drinks, fruits and vegetables. Madronio’s wife is in charge of the grocery store while he travels door to door selling trifles in his town.

The grocery store is located in a strategic area near a crop of cotton. Since it is harvest time now, they have a huge demand and to supply this demand, they are requesting a loan to buy fruits, vegetables and drinks to sell in their grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase fruits, vegetables and drinks.

loans.name: Shohida

texts.ru:
Shohida is 28 years old, married and has two children. She is in the retail business and sells children's clothing at the central market of the town of Isfara. She has six years of experience in this business. She started out with small retail and now her cash flow has grown and allows her to support the family. She goes to the market in the early morning and sells there until the afternoon. This is the best time for her to sell and many of her clients buy from her. Her lively personality attracts the clientele and she has many regulars. Shohida has first come to MicroInvest two years ago and got her first loan. She has gradually increased commodity circulation and achieved the level of a well established business. At this time she is applying for another loan and will use it to increase the variety of summer clothes.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Шохиде 28 лет, она замужем и имеет 2 детей. Она занимается куплей продажей детской одежды на центральном рынке города Исфара. Опыт работы в этой сфере составляет 6 лет. Начинала она с мелкой торговли, сейчас ее оборотный капитал вырос и позволяет содержать семью. С раннего утра она приходит на рынок и и до обеда торгует там. В это время у нее очень хорошая торговля и многие клиенты приходят за покупками. Ее жизнерадостность привлекает клиентов и у Шохиды очень много постоянных клиентов. 2 года назад она обратилась в Микроинвест и получила свой первый займ. Постепенно увеличивая товарооборот она достигла уровня хорошо поставленного бизнеса. Сейчас она обратилась в Микроинвест за новым займом и потратит его на увеличение ассортимента летней одежды.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Norma Lidia

texts.es:
Norma is divorced. She started the business to obtain an income and to be able to pay some debts that she had. She began 3 years ago selling lunches and some foods. Little by little she increased her sales and in this way has been able to support her family.

She needs a loan of $500, that will be repaid in 6 months, to buy an industrial stove. With your support Norma will grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Norma es divorciada, inició el negocio para obtener ingresos y poder pagar algunas deudas que tenia, empezó hace 3 años vendiendo lonches y algunas comidas, poco a poco fue incrementando sus ventas y es así como ha podido sacar adelante a su familia.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar una estufa industrial. Con tu apoyo Norma hará crecer su negocio.

loans.use: to buy an industrial stove for her food business.

loans.name: Akua

texts.en: Akua B. is married and has three kids. She lives with her family at Goaso in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. She is 33 years old.  For the past nine years, she has run a clothing stand, selling ladies' and children's items like blouses and skirts, lingerie, underwear, slippers and dressing bags. She needs a loan to inject more working capital into the business to scale up business progress. She believes the loan will help her purchase a large quantity of good quality inventory. She says she would be grateful for that assistance.

loans.use: To purchase lingerie, underwear, dressing bags and slippers

loans.name: Mrs. Kang Sophy Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank in Traeuy Troeng Village in the Kandal Province has 27 members. Mrs. Kang S. is the village bank president. She owns a small grocery store in the local village. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it so she has decided to ask for a loan to buy additional grocery products for her inventory. Aside from this business, she is a recycle collector who gathers empty bottles, cans and plastic. Mrs. Kang S. is a 37-year-old widow wI. a child who is employed in a garment factory.  She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions wI. this loan.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products for her store.

loans.name: Sokhna Diarra

texts.fr: Sokhna Diarra S. habite à Ouakam, elle est célibataire et exerce le commerce voilà plus de deux ans. Elle peut gagner en moyenne 5000 cfa par jour. Elle Sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer ses activités pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle
texts.en:
Sokhna Diarra S. lives in Ouakam. She is single and has been in the sales business for more than 2 years. She earns on average 5000 cfa a day. She is requesting this loan to bolster her business so as to better satisfy the needs of her clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: selling clothing

loans.name: Djiby

texts.fr: Mr DJIBY T. est agé de plus de quarante (40) années , il est marié et pere de plusieurs enfants  .Il exerce depuis plusieures années le metier de tailleur il forme aussi des jeunes au metier de tailleur.l 'achat de fils,bouton,tissus et autres accessoires entraine des depenses importantes sa part et reduise ainsi ses marges beneficieres pour parrer à ça ,il sollicite un pret a fin de constituer un stock important de ces accessoires
texts.en:
Mr. DJIBY T. is over 40 years old, married, and the father of several children. For many years, he has been working as a tailor, and he also trains young people in his trade. Buying thread, buttons, cloth, and other supplies amounts to sizable expenses for him and therefore reduces his profit margin. To fend off this concern, he is requesting a loan to build up a healthy stock of these supplies.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating funds

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a member of the Azucenas (“White Lilies”) Village Bank. Sixty-two years old and married with ten children, Esther is a traveling salesperson buying fruits, vegetables and spices in Ayacucho and bringing them to rural markets to sell. She works alone since most of her children are adults and have their own jobs, while her three youngest children are still in school.

Esther is requesting a loan to buy a variety of fruit to sell, including apples, pineapples, mangoes and bananas. Her goals are to continue to support her children’s educational pursuits and to build a home of her own.

loans.use: To buy apples, pineapples, mangoes and bananas.

loans.name: Theun

texts.en: Mrs. Theun N. is a villager in Prey Chum village, Kampong Speu province, Cambodia. She is a 44-year-old widow who owns a small piece of land on which she cultivates rice to earn a living. Her son is a cabinet maker but neither he nor Mrs. Theun N. has enough money to buy the equipment he needs to make cabinets for his customers. Mrs. Theun N. therefore has decided to ask for a loan to buy cabinetry equipment for her son's business.

loans.use: To purchase cabinetry equipment

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
Florida S. (the woman in the left) has a junk shop. Florida is a resident of Santo Nino District, Pagadian City Zamboanga del Sur Province. She is married and blessed with 3 children. All of her children is at school while her husband also runs the junk shop. 

Florida and her husband are looking to expand their shop and to have a wholesale business in the future. They want everything to be financially secure as the need of their family increase, especially with the education of their children. An amount of PHP 10,000 is all they need for such project and they ask for help in fulfilling their dreams.

loans.use: addtional capital for junk shop business expansion

location.town: Pagadian-Purok Ferdinand, Santo Nino, Pagadian Cit

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en: Salamatu G. is married and has 6 dependants. She has received schooling through senior high. Salamatu sells food supplies like cocoyam, eggs and plantain at Abura, which she has done since about 5 years ago. Salamatu uses her income to support her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family. Salamatu will use the loan as additional capital to enable her to buy more food supplies to increase sales to meet the increase in demand by her costumers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Salamatu plans to reinvest back for the expansion of  her trade .

loans.use: Salamatu will use the loan as additional capital to enable her to buy more food supplies to increase sales to meet the increase in demand by her costumers.

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi: Chị Trần Thị Phượng  năm nay 32  tuổi. Chị tham gia Quỹ Tình Thương từ năm 2006.  Trước khi tham gia Quỹ tình thương thu nhập của gia đình chị chủ yếu dựa vào chăn nuôi, trồng trọt. Sau khi tham gia Quỹ, có thêm nguồn vốn vay chị đã mạnh dạn đầu tư mở cửa hàng may tại nhà phục vụ cho nhu cầu của bà con địa phương tăng thu nhập cho gia đình. Công việc đang phát triển thuận lợi đem lại cho gia đình chị thu nhập 2.000.000/ tháng  Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm vải về làm may.
texts.en:
Mrs. Tran Thi P. is 32 years old. She has been a member of TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam) since 2006. Before joining TYM Fund, her family's main source of income comes from raising animals and farming. After joining TYM, Mrs. P. was confident to use her loan to open her tailor shop at home to meet the needs of the villagers and increase her family income. Her business is very good, bringing her family a stable monthly income of 2,000,000 VND (equivalent to 122 USD). This time Mrs. P. would like to borrow 9,000,000 VND (equivalent to 550USD) to buy more materials to make clothes.

Translated from Vietnamese by P. Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 30-year-old, divorced man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon, with his two children. Hasan has owned a bakery for two years. He sells all types of bread. Hasan requested a loan of 1100 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop. This is the first time that Hasan has requested a loan.

Hasan is speciA. in his work because he knows how to treat his customers. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he had difficulty managing his time because he still felt like an employee. Hasan decided on doing his business because he had always wanted to open a bakery. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Hasan will use the loan to purchase merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Omariyeba

texts.en: Omariyeba L. is fifty-eight years old and married with five children. She sells women's and children's clothes in a big market in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. She is requesting a loan of $425 to purchase more clothes to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Domingos Francisco

texts.pt:
Domingos Francisco Z. é natural de Maputo, tem 28 anos de idade, casados maritalmente e pai de 4 filhos com idade entre 8, 7, 5 e um mês de idade respectivamente. Para alem dos filhos sustenta um sobrinho que vive com ele na sua casa.

Domingos estudou até 10ªclasse e parou por falta de condições financeira familiares, desde a sua infância nunca mudou se da cidade, a 10 anos que vive de negocio que consiste na compra e venda de diversos produtos. Tem rendimento  por este negócio 1000,00mt diário.

Para domingos este é o 6º empréstimo na Hluvuku e sempre investiu no aumento do estoque. Desta forma domingos sonha abrir outro estabelecimento comercial e conta com o crédito para a compra de mercadoria.
texts.en:
28 year-old Domingos Francisco Z. was born in Maputo, Mozambique, where he still lives. He is married and the father of four children, ages 8, 7, 5 and one month. In addition to supporting his family, he is responsible for supporting one nephew, who lives with them. Domingos's studies were interrupted in 10th grade, due to his family's financial constraints. Domingos' general store, a business he's had for the past 10 years, brings him 1000,00 mt per day. This is his 6th loan with Hluvuku, and he plans to invest it in increasing his stock--as he has done with all previous loans. With the help of credit, Domingos hopes to be able to open a new store, in the future.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell at his general store

loans.name: Ablaye

texts.fr: ABLAYE S. 	est un commerçant il vend des cassettes et radio à la gare routière de Mbour  depuis plus de cinq  5 ans.il a quitté l’école très top .pour gagner sa vie il s’est converti dans le commerce il a débuté par le commerce ambulants à travers les rues de Mbour avant d’ouvrir une boutique a partir de ses économies. Il a est a son troisième prêt au niveau de la caisse. Célibataire sans enfant il compte avec ses économies se marier et construire une maison. Avec le prêt qu’il sollicite il souhaite renforcer  en achetant plus de marchandises pour accroitre ses revenus.
texts.en:
Ablaye S. is a merchant who has been selling cassettes and radios at the Mbour bus station for over five years. He left school very early to earn his living. He got converted to commerce, starting off with going door-to-door through the streets of Mbour. Later, he opened a shop starting with his savings. Ablaye is on his third loan with the bank. He is unmarried and has no children. He intends to use his saving to get married and to build a house. With the loan he's requesting, he would like to bolster his business by buying more merchandise, so as to grow his revenues.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia M. is from the village of Acad, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 44 years old. Emelia is married and has 11 school-aged children. To make a living, Emelia owns and operates a business venture, buying and selling bananas. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from this business. Emelia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 300 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Emelia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emelia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional bananas to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Emelia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and for the tuition of their children.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas to sell

loans.name: Israel Plus Group

texts.fr: Dégaule gère sa propre boutique et une moto taxi. Il a commencé son activité en 2001 avec un capital initial de $120. Sa petite boutique a bien prospéré grâce aux bénéfices accumulés et une bonne gestion qui ont fait croitre le capital à $800 en 2005. L’ambition de Dégaule d’ouvrir un jour un magasin de gros, l’a poussée d’intégrer en aout 2008, un des groupes de Hope RDC dénommé ‘Israel Plus’ pour recevoir des crédits afin de soutenir son rêve. Il a obtenu trois fois les prêts de Hope qu’il a remboursé totalement.  Le quatrième prêt qu’il a reçu au mois de juin dernier lui a servi de renforcer le stock de la boutique en achetant des cartons des sardines, savons, du lait, du sucre, des sachets d’eau pure, etc… à revendre dans le but d’accroitre le revenu. Actuellement, son capital propre est de $1200 et le bénéfice réalisé par mois est de $250. Dégaule a 35 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants dont leurs âges varient entre 4 et 9 ans. Deux d’entre eux vont à l’école.
texts.en:
Dégaule manages his own shop and a motorbike taxi. He started his business in 2001 with $120 in capital. His small shop really prospered, thanks to accumulated profits and good managing that have made his capital grow to $800 in 2005. His ambition is to open a wholesale store one day, and so he was driven to join a HOPE RDC group in August 2008 called “Israel Plus” in order to receive loans for supporting his dream. He obtained a loan three times from HOPE and has repaid them completely. The fourth loan he received in this past June was used to bolster the inventory in his shop by buying boxes of sardines, soaps, milk, sugar, baggies of Pure Water, etc. to resell with the goal of increasing his revenues. Currently, his capital amounts to $1,200 and the profits realized monthly come to $250. Dégaule is 35 years old, married, and the father of three children, ranging in age from 4 to 9. Two of them go to school.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sardines, soap, milk, sugar, etc. to stock her shop

loans.name: Tes

texts.en:
Tes P., 54, lives in Pursat province, Cambodia. She has owned a plot of land since 1999 where she grows both rice and vegetable crops. She can plant her crops twice a year: in the dry season and the rainy season – a skill she learned from her grandparents.

Tes P. is married to Souy Kimsean, 56, who works with her on the farm. This couple has given birth to four children, three of whom are married and the other one attends the local high school.

Tes P. will be using her loan to buy a half-hectare (1.25 acres) of farmland and ten sacks of fertilizers in order to successfully grow crops.

loans.use: To buy a half-hectare of farmland and ten sacks of fertilizers

loans.name: Yem

texts.en:
Yem S. is local farmer, 41 years old, living in a rural area of Pursat Province. She and her husband have always cultivated rice. Besides their current farming work, Yem S.’s husband is also hired by neighbors to cook meals for their wedding parties. The family has seven school-aged children under their care.

Yem S. still needs more fertilizers in order to grow her crop but she does not have the money to buy it yet. She is therefore looking for a loan from Kiva to purchase additional fertilizer to serve her farm.

loans.use: To purchase additional fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Barno

texts.en: E. Barno is married and has two grown children. She owns a little place at the central market in Djabbar Rasulov, Tajikistan, where she sells various types of clothing. Some of the advantages of her business are: variety, consistency, and affordable prices. She has been working in this business for ten years. Barno is always seeking to grow and develop her business and improve her entrepreneurial skills. Currently she is requesting a loan of 3,000 Somoni to purchase more goods to sell. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family’s financial situation. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Fausta

texts.en:
Rizalina Bulabos, a 34-year-old mother of one child, sells vegetables. She earns enough income that she can support her family. She also has baking experience from high school. If she can get enough capital, she wants to open a bakery.

She would like to request a loan of Php 12,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy additional vegetables to resell. Some of the loan will be used to buy materials for making bread for her so she can start a small bakery business.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables to resell

loans.name: Magdalena Mirtala

texts.es: Magdalena Mirtala P. D. R. D. 49 años D. edad resiD. en Soyapango municipio del departamento D. San Salvador. Magdalena vive con su esposo y su hija estudiante D. bachillerato D. 16 años D. edad, posee su propio negocio el cual tiene instalado en su casa, donD.  confecciona ropa a la medida y diferentes tipos D. prendas deportivas para los alumnos D. escuelas, el  crédito que solicita Magdalena es para comprar tela  que utilizara para confeccionar prendas deportivas.
texts.en:
Magdalena Mirtala P. D. R. is 49 years old and lives in the town of Soyapango in the department of San Salvador. She is married and has a 16 year old daughter who attends high school. Magdalena operates her own business out of her home in which she manufactures clothing and different types of sportswear for students.

The loan Magdalena is requesting will be used to buy fabric for making sportswear.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric

loans.name: Michel

texts.fr: L. Michel habite à Womey, une agglomération périphérique de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Michel est marié et est père de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Michel est un guérisseur et un vendeur d'ossements d'animaux de tous genres. Il a été initié à cette activité pendant six ans et l'exerce depuis 1978 à Cotonou. Actuellement Michel est au cœur du marché VEDOKO à Cotonou où il a un stand. C'est pour renforcer son étalage en se ravitaillant en certains produits qui lui manquent actuellement qu'il a demandé un premier prêt à ALIDé.

loans.use: Achat d'ossements, peaux d'animaux et d'oiseaux

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
"Amahong", a local name for clams, and fish vending is the business activity of Riza M., 28 years old, married to Mr. Ronald M.. Both are residents of Purok-4 Pangabuan, Tangub City. As a couple, they have 5 children who are now school-age and one infant. Riza has been engaged in 'amahong' and fish vending for 14 years already which gives her an average net income of P 3,500 per month. Her income helps her husband in supporting their family. Her husband is also a fish vendor.

Since their children are now growing and the needs of their family have increased nowadays, Riza can’t help but find a way to meet the needs of their family. As a good member of PAGLAUM MPC under the PDP-LP Program, she is given the privilege of accessing her 3rd loan in the amount of P 5,500. She is very thankful to PMPC for the trust given her. She enjoys the other products and services offered to all the members of PAGLAUM MPC. The proceeds of this loan will be added to her capital for 'amahong' and fish vending and for buying materials for the renovation of their house.

loans.use: Additional capital for 'amahong' and fish vending and the purchase of housing materials

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
“If you want to achieve something, be patient!”: those are words of encouragement for Emily T. of Barangay Paniki, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. After her college education, she married Resty T. but they don’t have a child yet. They aim to become successful in the future so they will be able to support their parents and their future children. Her husband works in a construction company at Bagabag.

To help her husband in gaining income, Emily is engaged in the retailing of electronic cellphone loads and the selling of Avon, MSE and Natasha cosmetics and apparel products in their village. She wants to acquire more products but her capital is not enough, so she wants to borrow PHP 10,000 to be used in acquiring additional products to satisfy her customer's demands.

Emily believes that with her patience and sacrifices, she will be able to improve her small business and earn more income.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell

loans.name: Josphina

texts.en: Josphina L. is currently in the business of brewing local alcohol and selling beer and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell. Josphina is 42 years old and is married to a health worker. She has eight children of whom six are attending school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a hotel (restaurant). About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Kofi

texts.en:
Kofi, 61, is the married father of four children, all of whom work. His family is doing very well and he is so happy about that, as he works hard to support the basic needs at home. A specialist in school uniforms for both sexes and for those in the primary level, Kofi has been sewing for 12 years now, employing various styles appropriate for school uniforms, church attire, kaba and slit dresses, funeral clothes, wedding dresses, etc.

He is requesting a loan to buy increased supplies of sewing material including linen, threads, and thimbles to increase his output and efficiency. Kofi hopes to increase his savings to provide for both the business and rising family expenses. He would be grateful for your assistance and support.

loans.use: To buy increased supplies of sewing material to increase his output and efficiency.

loans.name: Bazarkul's Group

texts.ru:
Дуйшекеева Базаркул – лидер данной группы. Базаркул вместе с мужем вырастили четверых детей. Мужа уже нет в живых. Старшей дочери тридцать пять лет, сыну тридцать. Затем следуют две дочери, которым по двадцать девять и двадцать лет соответственно. Все дочери замужем. Сын работает и живёт с Базаркул. Люди, достигшие возраста Базаркул, уже сидят дома и воспитывают внуков. Базаркул уже выполнила свой родительский долг перед детьми и могла бы позволить себе заслуженный отпуск и покой. Однако Базаркул находит в себе силы заниматься любимым делом. Более того, она совсем недавно начала своё дело. Дело в том, что Базаркул ещё с молодости является талантливой мастерицей по изготовлению национальных изделий. Родственники порекомендовали Базаркул попробовать смастерить несколько изделий и сдать их в магазины по продаже таких изделий. И её изделия начали покупать. Базаркул получила возможность с пользой проводить свой досуг и при этом зарабатывать неплохие деньги. Чтобы начать это дело Базаркул потребовалось вложить четыре тысячи сомов ($90). Три года как она начала заниматься шитьём, и Базаркул смогла на заработанные деньги купить мебель для дома, и машину. Её ежемесячный доход достиг десяти тысяч сомов ($235). Базаркул с большим энтузиазмом занимается этим делом. В данное время она нуждается в средствах, чтобы вложить их в покупку необходимых материалов. Она надеется получить кредит и купить материалы и войлок. Базаркул мечтает открыть магазин у себя в селе, и продавать свои изделия. 

Партнёры Базаркул по группе:

Сагынбеку двадцать три года. Жена дома, не работает. Сагынбек работает продавцом потребительских товаров на местном рынке. Сагынбек зарабатывает около десяти с половиной тысяч сомов в месяц. Он нуждается в кредите, чтобы вложить деньги в товарооборот. 

Гулбайре сорок лет. Она разведена и сама воспитывает четырнадцатилетнего сына. Гулбайра держит корову, бычка и занимается их размножением. Она обратилась за этим кредитом, чтобы купить себе стиральную машину. 

Анаркуль сорок лет. Анаркуль – вдова и мать двоих детей. Она держит двух коров и двух бычков и зарабатывает себе на жизнь тем, что продаёт молоко. Её ежемесячный доход – три тысячи сомов в месяц. Анаркуль нужен кредит, чтобы купить телёнка.

Амангул сорок пять лет. Муж – строитель. Амангул находится дома и смотрит за скотиной и продаёт молоко. Амангул надеется получить кредит и купить баранов. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Bazarkul D. is the leader of this group. Bazarkul and her husband have raised four children. Her husband has passed on. The oldest daughter is thirty-five years old, the son is thirty. Then she has two daughters, twenty-nine and twenty. All of her daughters are married. Her son lives with Bazarkul and works. People who have reached Bazarkul's age keep house and bring up their grandchildren. Bazarkul has already fulfilled her parental duty to her children and could afford her deserved holiday and rest. However Bazarkul finds strength within herself to work at her favorite pastime. Moreover, she has recently gone into business. Bazarkul, since she was very young, has been a talented, skilled worker making traditional national goods. Relatives recommended that Bazarkul try making some handicrafts and offer them for sale in shops that specialize in that kind of merchandise. They have begun to buy her wares. Bazarkul has an opportunity to spend her leisure time earning quite good money. To begin Bazarkul's business, she needed four thousand som ($90). Three years after she began her sewing business Bazarkul earned enough money to buy a car and furniture for her house. Her monthly income has reached ten thousand som ($235). Bazarkul enthusiastically works at this. Currently, she requires funds to purchase necessary supplies. She hopes to obtain a loan to purchase fabric and felt. Bazarkul dreams of opening her own shop in the village to sell her goods. Bazarkul's partners are: Sagynbek is twenty-three years old. His wife keeps house and does not work. Sagynbek works selling consumer goods at the local market. Sagynbek earns about ten and a half thousand som a month. He would like a loan to increase inventory. Gulbaira is forty years old. She is divorced and raises her fourteen-year old son. Gulbaira has a cow and bull and works breeding them. She has applied for this loan in order to buy a washing machine. Anarkul is forty years old. Anarkul is a widow and mother of two children. She has two cows and two calves and earns enough selling milk to support herself. Her monthly income is three thousand som. Anarkul would like a loan to buy a calf. Amangul is forty-five years old. Her husband is a builder. Amangul stays home, looks after the cattle, and sells milk. Amangul hopes to take out a loan to buy rams. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric and felt for making traditional goods.

loans.name: Aramata

texts.fr: Aramata Mané est une femme âgée de 43 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de PETIT KANDE depuis 8 ans et a une bonne expérience avec le crédit pour l'avoir obtenu à 16 fois de suite. Elle achète et revend des chaussures et des habits. Son objectif est d'aider à la prise en charge quotidienne de sa famille et de renforcer ses épargnes.
texts.en:
Aramata Mané is a 43-year old woman who is married and has four children. She has been a member of the village bank in PETIT KANDE for eight years and has a good experience of borrowing, having had 16 consecutive loans. She buys and sells shoes and clothes. Her aim is to help out with her family's daily responsibilities and to boost her savings.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her self-financing capacity

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo es socio del Banco Comunal Los Sauces de Compañía. Las socias son de la comunidad de Compañía.
Pablo es separada, tiene 42 años y 4 hijos, Pablo se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos, actividad que realiza todos los días, sus ventas los realiza en la misma comunidad.
Pablo necesita un préstamo de 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tierra.
Los sueños de Pablo son salir adelante y dar un negocio a cada uno de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Pablo, 42, is a member of the Los Sauces de Compañía communal bank. The members are from Compañía. Pablo is separated and has 4 children. Pablo makes bricks every day and sells them in his community. Pablo needs a 1250 sol loan to buy firewood. Pablo's dream is to get ahead in life and give a business to each of his children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soil.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a 43-year-old married man with four children in school. He sells fishing flies and has been in the business for six years and employs four people. He also earns extra income from farming. He requested for a loan of KES 40,000 to buy materials for manufacturing fishing flies, to meet his customer’s demands. He hopes to buy a plot and build rental houses and to educate his children to higher levels of education. He dreams of becoming economically independent and of have a big business. He describes himself as humble and hardworking.

loans.use: Purchase of 'fishing flies' raw materials.

loans.name: Leonilda

texts.es:
Leonilda es socia del Banco Comunal El Roble.
Leonilda es casada, tiene 65 años y 9 hijos, Leonilda teje a mano chompas, colchas, ropa de bebes, y otras prendas, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Leonilda necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de hilo, lana, tela.
Los sueños de Leonilda son tener una tienda de abarrotes y construir el tercer piso de su casa.
texts.en:
Leonilda is a member of the El Roble (The Oak) communal bank. Leonilda is 65 years old, married and has 9 children. Leonilda hand knits sweaters, bedspreads, baby clothes and other articles of clothing every day. She needs a 2000 sol loan to buy thread, wool and fabric. Leonilda's dream is to have a grocery store and to build a third story on her house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy thread, wool and fabric.

loans.name: Ramzana's Group

texts.en:
Mussarat wants a loan to buy scrap for her scrap business. Ghafooran wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Nasreen wants a loan to buy clothes for her clothes-selling business. 

Ramzana is an active group leader. She resides in a city named Arifwala in Pakistan. Her family consists of five persons: four children and her husband. Her husband's name is M. M. and he has a cycle repair shop. He has been doing this work for over 5 years. Their kids are enrolled in school and are getting an education. 

Ramzana sees to her responsibilities of all kinds very efficiently. She takes care of her family and does domestic chores. She is applying for a loan to buy repair tools for her husband’s cycle repair shop.

loans.use: To purchase repair tools

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
W. Edward is married and has five children. He is a permanent resident of Naluvule Zone.
Edward has a poultry business and also sells water. He is using his loan to purchase drugs, feed and more chicks for his poultry business. He is a hardworking businessman whose dream is to obtain a taxi (car) to earn a side income.

loans.use: To purchase drugs, feed and more chicks

loans.name: Rowela

texts.en:
Rowela P. is from the village of Sto.Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 28 years old. Rowela is married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Rowela owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling mobile phone credit loads in the local community. Rowela has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rowela joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rowela has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Rowela is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Rowela from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Fatimoh

texts.en:
Fatimoh lives in Lagos with her family. She is married with 4 children and they are doing very well. She sells sarongs in her shop and also add the sales of shoes, bags and caps for more income. She has been in the business for some years. With it she earns her living and assists her husband in keeping the family. 

Fatimoh has the zeal to increase the size of her business and her profit margin in future. She hopes for the loan of NGN50, 000 to purchase more sarongs,shoes, bags, and caps to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes, bags, clothes and caps to sell.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: La Sra. Maria tiene 41 años  de edad es conviviente, no tiene carga familiar. Ella se dedica como empleada del hogar  prestando servcios demesticos, trabajando actualmente en los Viñedos de Santa Maria,  ella viene laborando hace 3 años  consecutivamente en la misma casa. Su conyugue es chofer de automovil tico el cual alquila. Ellos tiene un objetivo el cual es poder adquirir un terreno para  poder construir su casa, con el dinero que solicita sera para completar para la compra de un terreno.
texts.en:
Maria is 41 years old, lives with her life partner and has no dependents. She works as a domestic employee in private homes; she's currently employed at the Santa Maria vinyards and has worked continuously for the last three years in the same house. Her spouse drives a Tico automobile; he leases out its services. Their goal is to acquire a lot on which to build their house; the requested funds will complete the amount they need to buy it.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a lot.

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophal V. is 45 years old and a villager from Ampil Lech village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate vegetables and rice. Mrs. Sophal V. has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and garlic seed to support her farm.
In addition to farming, Mrs. Sophal V. works from home as a silk weaver. Her husband (pictured with her) is a teacher in the local school, for which he receives a small salary to add to his wife's income to improve their standard of living. The couple has six children – two are silk weavers, two are silk weaving laborers, while the other two are students.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and garlic seed

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally P. is from the village of  Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She is 34 years old. Sally is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Sally owns & operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing manicure and pedicure services to local community members. Sally has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Sally joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sally is requesting a loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Sally from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha es una madre de familia de 43 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en el sector San Pablo, una zona rural que se encuentra comprendida dentro del distrito de Pomalca. Las actividades económicas de la zona son la agricultura, la crianza de animales menores y la elaboración artesanal de sombreros.

Martha cuenta con un equipo de sonido, el cual alquila a sus vecinos del sector en donde vive y también a clientes de diversas zonas aledañas para que amenicen actividades de todo tipo como por ejemplo fiestas sociales y algunas ceremonias, generalmente los días en que alquila su equipo de sonido son los fines se semana, lleva mas de un año trabajando con esta actividad.

Adicionalmente trabaja criando y vendiendo animales, con los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades ella ayuda a su esposo, que es agricultor, con el sostenimiento económico de la familia. Martha desea implementar su equipo de sonido y de esa manera mejorar la calidad de su equipo de entretenimiento musical, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a cumplir su meta.

Martha es una mujer trabajadora y que siempre da lo mejor de si para sacar adelante a su familia, su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para colaborar con su esposo y juntos brindar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Martha is 43 and lives with her husband and two children in San Pablo,a rural area located in the district of Pomalca. The economy of this region is based on agriculture, the raising of small livestock, and the manufacture of handmade hats. Martha owns a sound system that she rents to people who live in her area and to customers in neighboring areas, for use in activities like parties and ceremonies. Generally she rents out the sound system on the weekends, and she's been working at this business for over a year. Martha also works raising and selling animals. With her earnings she helps her husband, who is a farmer, to support the family financially. Martha would like to make improvements to her sound system, and in order to reach this goal she is asking for a loan of 500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa [the Kiva field partner]. Martha is a hard working woman who always gives her best to help her family get ahead. Her greatest desire is to keep working in order to help her husband to give the family a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improvement of a sound system

loans.name: Ana Deysi

texts.es:
Ana tiene 46 años de edad reside en el municipio de Chinameca, departamento de San Miguel, es casada, vive con el esposo y dos hijos de las edades de 17 y 19 años , ella se dedica a la venta de tortilla de maíz. 
El negocio lo inicio hace 6 años, ella comienza a elaborar las tortillas de 10:00 am- 3:00pm, dicho negocio está ubicado en la casa de habitación.
Ella necesita invertir en compra de maíz, leña, cal, que son productos necesarios para elaborar las tortillas, por cual está solicitando el préstamo que le ayudara para seguir con el negocio y así solventar las necesidades básicas de la familia.
Los sueños de Ana mantener el negocio, continuar con su espíritu empresarial para mejorar las condiciones de vida de la familia
texts.en:
Ana is 46 years old and lives in the town of Chinameca, within the San Miguel department. She is married and lives with her husband. Her business is the sale of corn tortillas. She started her business six years ago and works out of her home, making tortillas from 10:00 AM to 3:00 PM. She needs to buy dried corn, firewood, and salt, which she needs to make tortillas. She is asking for this loan in order to continue the business and be able to provide for her family’s basic needs. Ana wants to maintain her business and continue with her entrepreneurial spirit in order to improve her family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice K. is a 44 years old mother with four children and a husband. She operates a food kiosk on a daily basis in Majaoni, Mombasa. Alice has been in this business for the past ten years and now wishes to expand her business and venture into fish mongering.  

This is the second time that she is borrowing from KADET and plans to buy stock of fish and a deep freezer. She hopes that the anticipated profits from the business will help her educate her children and also be able to own a well established fish shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of fish and a deepfreezer

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: La Señora Martha  vive en casa familiar de su suegro, tiene dos hijos, se dedica a la venta de ropa variada, desde hace diez años, tiene puesto fijo en el mercado San Antonio de la ciudad de Cochabamba, este crédito es para aumentar su capital, para la compra de variedad de ropa de temporada, su esposo también es comerciante, viaja a las provincias a vender en cada feria, su esposo le ayuda viajan juntos a muchas ferias provinciales a ofrecer sus producto, ella es muy trabajadora siempre pensando en el bienestar de su familia esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Ms. Martha lives in the family home of her father-in-law. She has two children. For ten years, she has sold a variety of clothing. She has a fixed stand in the San Antonio Market in the city of Cochabamba. This loan is to increase her capital, in order to purchase a variety of seasonal clothing. Her husband is also a merchant. He travels to the provinces to sell in each market. Her husband helps her, as they travel together to many provincial markets to offer their products. Martha is very hard working and is always thinking about the well-being of her family. She is very grateful for the support offered to her.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing

loans.name: Ramón Antonio

texts.es:
El Sr. Ramón Antonio T. T. es casado.Su esposa trabaja por campañas en los fundos.
Cuenta con un negocio de una renovadora (reparación de zapatos)desde hace mas de cinco años.
Requiere del préstamo para invertir en el negocio y así poder adquirir mas materiales de trabajo. Además cuenta con casa propia.
texts.en:
Mr. Ramón Antonio T. T. is married. His wife works as a laborer on plantations. He has had a shoe repair shop for over five years. He needs the loan to invest in the business and acquire more work materials. He owns his own house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies.

loans.name: Evaluz

texts.en:
Evaluz V. and her husband dreamed of having their own house in the future and to live a simple but comfortable life. However, her husband passed away and that dream was left to Evaluz to accomplish. At age 56 and a widow, she did not lose hope that she could still fulfill the dream of having their own house. Though life became tough for her, she never gave up. Instead she worked hard in order to perform her responsibilities as both father and mother of their three children. 

To have access to capital to start a small business, she joined Ahon sa HIrap, Inc.- a partner micro-finance institution of KIVA in the Philippines - in the year 2006. During those years she experienced hardship but she was so determined that she stayed active in her membership. She is one of the very good members of ASHI and serves as a model to her group and to the center. Her business is doing well and her profit helps in providing the daily needs of her family. 

Now she is applying for another loan of 14,000 PHP to use as additional capital for her store. She will buy more grocery products, canned goods, bath and detergent soaps, liquors, cigarettes, rice, sugar, cooking ingredients, shampoos, assorted candies and snack foods. She will also buy assorted toys in preparation for the Christmas season. 

She was able to send her children up to high school and is still dreaming of sending them to college someday. She hopes that with this additional capital she can earn more and save for the schooling of her children and hopefully start building their own house. She is optimistic that she will reach all her dreams with the help and support of ASHI and KIVA, and of course with the blessing from our Creator.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery products to resell

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys, de 30 años, convive con Elmer, de 30 años; ambos tienen 1 hijo, Jimmy de 11 años, al que cuidan y educan en su casa propia ubicada en la selva peruana (localidad las Palmas). Desde muy niña se dedica a la agricultura y como conocedora de sus cuidados y técnicas; hace ya 10 años se dedica a sembrar sus propios terrenos de cultivo, donde siembra una variedad de cítricos; pero no solo a eso se dedica Gladys, ella también participa activamente en el trabajo que desarrollo su gobierno local; en algunos meses terminó con el proyecto de alfabetización apoyando a los pobladores de su localidad; ahora el nuevo proyecto que tiene es de defensa ribereña (proyecto para que el caudal del agua de los ríos no afecten a la población). En adelante ella quiere abrir un restaurante, donde pueda vender comida típica de la selva peruana; sus cosechas de cítricos le dan mucha rentabilidad y con el dinero que gana en los proyectos del estado espera reunir el capital que requiere para su nuevo proyecto. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, y está segura que con el apoyo de su banco comunal y las personas que confían en ella, podrán salir adelante. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará abono orgánico (abono natural), para los cítricos que dentro de algunos meses cosechará.
texts.en:
Gladys, 30, cohabits with Elmer, 30.  They have a son, Jimmy, 11, who they care for and educate in their own home located in Las Palmas in the Peruvian jungle.

From a very young age she has been farming so she is quite knowledgeable about farming techniques and proper crop care.  She has been farming on her own fields for 10 years now.  She grows a variety of citrus plants.  However, this isn’t Gladys’ only occupation.  She is also quite involved in the work of her local government.  A few months ago she completed an alphabetization (literacy) project providing support to residents in her area.  Now, the new project she’s involved with is a riverbank protection project, a project designed to protect villages from river overflows.

In the future she’d like to set up a restaurant where she can sell dishes typical of the Peruvian jungle region. Her citrus crops are quite profitable and added to the money she earns on the government projects she hopes to gather enough capital for her restaurant.

This is her 3rd loan with MFP and she is sure that with help from the communal bank and people who put their trust in her she will be able to continue forward.

She will use the requested funds to buy organic manure for the citrus crops which will be harvested in a few months.

loans.use: To buy organic manure.

loans.name: Deniza

texts.es: Deniza G. López es vendedora ambulante y tiene un negocio de la venta de ropa usada desde hace 20 años el cual se ubica en lugar muy concurrido, donde se observa prosperidad. Ella es madre de solo tiene a su cargo 1 hijos al que desea ofrecerle una mejora calidad  de vida. En este momento ella requiere de un préstamo para surtir su negocio de ropa para temporada de frio.
