texts.en: Deniza G. López is a street vendor and has had a business selling used clothing for 20 years.  Her business is located in a busy and properous place.  She is the mother of 1 child and wants to offer them a better quality of life.  Now she is requesting a loan to stock her clothing buiness for the cold season.

loans.use: To invest in her used clothing business.

loans.name: Nancy Julia

texts.es: Nancy es una mujer emprendedora vende dulces como: lec he asada  y pasteles, diariamente reparte estos productos en los colegios e instituciones que funcionan en su comunidad. A sus 51 años de edad Nancy ha logrado que sus dos hijos mayores sean profesionales y uno aun esta   bajo su tutela  y está cursando la secundaria en una escuela pública, esta iniciativa de negocio se emprendió desde muy joven, pues sus padres tenían una pequeña panadería lo que la motivo para aprender el curso de repostería. Además se está dedicando a la crianza de cuyes que le generan buenas ganancias pues son de alta demanda en la zona, ha logrado mejoras en su vivienda  y se ha comprado una batidora moderna para el preparar sus postres. El préstamo será invertido en  insumos para sus diversas preparaciones  y en aportar junto con su esposo para el viaje de promoción de su hijo. Nancy está contenta por tener este financiamiento y pagara puntualmente sus cuotas mes a mes.
texts.en: Nancy is an enterprising woman who sells sweets like: leche asada (a flan-like dessert) and cakes.  She delivers these products daily to the schools and institutions that operate in her community.  At 51-years-old, she has accomplished that her two children become professionals.  One is still under her care and is studying in secondary school in a public school.  She began her business when she was very young.  Her parents had a small bakery that motivated her to learn how to bake.  Additionally, she raises guinea pigs which brings in good profits because they are in high demand in the area.  She has been able to improve her home and has purchased a modern mixer to prepare her desserts.  This loan will be invested in ingredients for her various preparations and will also be used to help support, along with her husband, her son’s class trip.  Nancy is happy to have this loan and will make her payments promptly every month.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es: Marcela de 51 años, está casada con Marcos, de 60 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos, pero solo viven con uno de ellos: Omar de 25 años. Los tres como una gran familia, viven en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Puente Paucartambo (selva central peruana). Como mujer trabajadora, apoya a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. Pues la agricultura, actividad de Marco, les proporcionan lo necesario para poder sobrevivir: “techo y comida”. Pero con una mirada emprendedora; Marcela, hace 7 años abrió una pequeña tienda de comestibles, donde vende productos de primera necesidad. Desde las primeras horas del día, los habitantes de la localidad visitan su tienda, pues ellos saben lo surtida que se mantiene, “siempre encuentran lo necesario”. Ya en sus tiempos libres, de dedica a la costura, todos la conocen y, constantemente la buscan para ofrecerle trabajo. Los clientes que ganó, le hizo aumentar sus ventas; es por ello que para más adelante desea comprarse una máquina industrial, con la que está segura podrá cocer con mayor facilidad y rapidez. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP y como autoridad de su banco comunal, se siente satisfecha del apoyo que puede realizar. De adquirir el crédito solicitado tiene pensado comprar paneton, chocolate y todo lo necesario para surtir su tienda en está navidad. Y si el dinero le alcanza, podrá comprar la máquina industrial de coser que tanto sueña.
texts.en:
Marcelina, 51, is married to Marcos, 60.  They have three children but only one of them, Omar, 25, lives with them.  The three of them form a great family.  They live in their own house located in Puente Paucartambo (Peruvian central jungle).  As a hard working woman she helps her husband meet household expenses.  Marco’s work, which is farming, produces the basics for them to survive: “a roof over their heads and food on the table.” But, with her eye toward enterprise, Marcela opened a small grocery store 7 years ago to sell basic need items.

From first daylight residents in the area visit her store because they know how well stocked she has it, “they always find everything necessary.” In her spare time she likes to sew and everyone knows her and seeks her out to offer her sewing jobs.  Customers she has gained have increased her sales so she’d like to buy an industrial sewing machine so that she can sew more easily and quickly.

This is her 5th loan with MFP and as an authority in her communal bank she feels satisfied with the support this can bring.  If she gets the requested loan, she plans to buy panettones (a cake typically consumed during the Christmas season), chocolate and everything else to stock her store for Christmas.  If the money goes far enough, she will buy the industrial sewing machine that she so dreams about having.

loans.use: To buy panettones to stock her store and also to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Yusufbek

texts.en:
M. Yusufbek is 39 years-old.  He is married with three children. During the last five years, Yusufbek is providing transportation services. He generally works in his region only. At the same time, together with the help of his wife and eldest son, he raises cattle in his house which gives additional income for his family. Currently, Yusufbek’s truck needs repair and for this reason he is requesting a loan of 12000 Somoni.  With a portion of the loan he will also buy additional cattle for his business. Yusufbek promises to pay the loan in time and thanks anyone for their support.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve agricultural production and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition.  Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To repair his microbus and purchase young cattle.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok S., 31, sells artistic items, earning an income of US $3 per day. S. is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Her husband is a police officer, earning an income of US $4 per day. 

The family has to spend US $120 on food, $16 on electricity supply, and $29 on other necessary expenses every month. S. is requesting a loan of US $800 to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To repair her house

loans.name: Solteritas Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal Solteritas, es un grupo de 8 mujeres que ha decidido unirse para recibir crédito, capacitación y atención en salud.  Esta Banca Comunal es parte del centro focal de Senkata, este es su primer ciclo.
Cada una de ellas tienen negocios propios de diferentes tipos, como ser: venta de fruta, crianza de ovejas, tienda de barrio, costura de edredones, venta de verduras y frutas.
Para su organización, la B.C. Solteritas cuenta con una mesa directiva integrada por una presidenta, una tesorera y una secretaria de actas.
 
La Presidenta, la señora Desideria, es una mujer de 54 años de edad, casada, madre de 6 hijos, quienes a la fecha ya son mayores de edad. (más de 18 años).  El negocio de la señora Desideria es la venta de plástico y chinelas y tiene su propia tienda de barrio.  Con orgullo comenta que aprendió el negocio desde los 18 años, sus hermanos le enseñaron.  Cada cierto tiempo viaja con chinelas a poblaciones cercanas como Caranavi.  Cuando se queda en su tienda,  se dedica a vender desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las nueve de la noche.
La señora Desideria está regresando como cliente de Pro Mujer después de cuatro años, cuando se le consulta que es lo que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde “el ahorro que se junta”.
texts.en:
The Solteritas community bank is a group of 8 women who decided to join together in order to access loans, training and health services.  This community bank is part of the Senkata regional office and they are in their first loan cycle.

Each woman has her own business.  Their businesses include: selling fruit, raising sheep, running a neighborhood store, sewing comforters and selling fruit and vegetables.

The Solteritas community bank has a board of directors which is made up of a president, a treasurer and a secretary.  The bank's president, Desideria, is a 54 year-old woman.  She is married and has six children who are all grown up (older than 18).

Desideria's business is selling plastic items and thongs (flip flops).  She also has her own neighborhood store.  With pride she tells us that she was taught the business 18 years ago by her siblings.  Every so often she travels with her flip flops to nearby towns such as Caranavi.  When she is in her store, she serves from 6.00am to 9.00pm.  Desideria is returning as a client of Pro Mujer after an absence of four years.  When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer she replied "the savings that we make".

loans.use: To buy beer

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.ru: Шарипов Хуршед житель района Хамадони. Ему 33 года. Женат. Имеет 4 детей. Образование - среднее. Зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Он разводит скот у себя дома. У него имеются условия для продвижения своего бизнеса. В этой области уже три года. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Khurshed S. lives in the region of Hamadoni. He is 33 years old. He is married and has four children. He has secondary education. He makes his money by breeding large cattle. He breeds the cattle at home. He has the means to develop his business and has been in this field for three years. He is taking out the loan to buy large cattle.

loans.use: To buy large cattle

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert M. was born in 1963, in Gandzakar village, an area of Ijevan. From 1984 till 1990, he worked as a driver, and in 1990 he participated in the Nagorno-Karabakh war conflict, after which he decided to continue serving in the army.  
Simultaneously with his serving, Robert is engaged in animal breeding. Robert’s wife and his two sons help him to raise cows, calves and pigs. Thanks to their joint efforts they take care of the major part of their family’s needs. 

Robert needs 600.000 Armenian drams loan to buy fodder for his farm animals.
This is Robert’s 4th loan from Nor Horizon, and he has never delayed his loans’ repayments.

loans.use: To buy fodder for his farm animals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en: Sophia N. operates a chop bar (a place where people come to eat) at Takoradi. She is married to a mason and has three children. She has been in this trade for a decade. Sophia assists her husband in the general upkeep of the home. A loan is going to help her buy more food items to cook to meet the demand of her customers. She has the plan of reinvesting her increased capital.

loans.use: to buy more food items to cook.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 24 year old single man from Baalback, Ali has owned an Internet Cafe since 2008. This service is becoming popular, in his region, and he has to improve his business to adapt more customers. 

Ali is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the first time. In order to improve his business, he will increase the number of computers at his cafe, buying necessary UPS connection, and useful hardware. Ali is planning to expand his business and hopes to open a new branch of his business. He hopes to stay updated and attractive his clients. Many of his clients are friends, relatives and neighbors.

loans.use: To increase his computers.

loans.name: Reginaldo

texts.es:
Don Reginaldo, tiene 68 años de edad, reside en Jiquilisco, departamento de Usulután, se dedica a  la compra y venta de cerdos, vive con su esposa y no tienen hijos, don Reginaldo tiene mucha experiencia en el negocio aprendió de sus patrones a trabajar con cerdos.
Actualmente necesita realiza la compra de cerdos y comprar mercadería para abastecer otro negocio donde ofrece productos de consumo, esta inversión le ayudara a aumentar la granja de cerdos y a ofrecer a los clientes diversidad de producto.
El quiere aumentar su comercio de cerdos, expandirse aun mercado más grande, así generar mayores ingresos para la familia.
texts.en:
Don Reginaldo is 68 years old and lives in Jiquilisco in the department of Usulután.  He lives with his wife and has no children.  His business is buying and selling pigs.  He learned to work with pigs and acquired his expertise thanks to what his landlords taught him.

Currently he needs to buy pigs and goods for his consumer products business.  This investment will help him increase his livestock farm and allow him to offer his customers a wider variety of products.

He wants to expand his pig business into a larger market to generate more income for his family.

loans.use: To buy pigs and consumer products

loans.name: Habibakhon

texts.ru: Абдурасулова Хабибахон проживает в районе Бохтар. Возраст, 56 лет. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Она имеет среднее образование. Более 6 лет занимается животноводством. Она разводит скот у себя дома. В основном она откармливает и продает скот. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота, чтобы увеличить их количество.
texts.en: Habibakhon A. lives in Bohtar. She is 56 years old, married, and has two children. She has a secondary education. She has been working in animal husbandry for more than six years.  She raises cattle at home. Basically she fattens and sells cattle. She is taking out a loan to buy cattle to increase her herd.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is 35 years old, married and a father of three.  He bakes and supplies cakes and bread so as to earn a living.  He has nine years of experience in the business and has one employee.  He was previously selling second-hand clothes.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has learnt how to save his money.  This has really helped him to manage his finances.  He has requested a loan of 80,000 KES to buy wheat flour and a bicycle for transporting his goods.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour and a bicycle for transporting his goods.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.es: La Sra. Anastacia  es una persona  muy trabajadora,  actualmente  se   dedica   a la  venta  de   ropa  usada  ,  en  este  momento desea comprar mercancía  porque   día   con día   tiene  un mayor  numero de  clientes y    su principal  objetivo es  ofrecerles  un excelente  servicio ya  que   este  negocio  representa la  fuente  principal de  sus  ingresos, agradece  el  apoyo  brindado  para   realizar   su  proyecto.
texts.en: Anastacia is a very hard working person. She sells used clothing and she wants to buy some merchandise to cater to her increased number of clients. Her primary objective is to offer them an excellent level of service. This business represents her primary source of income. She is thankful for the support towards the realization of her business.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to boost his business by buying more stocks of male and female clothing for sale

loans.name: Agali Awamu Kikajjo Group

texts.en:
35-year-old Justine has worked to the best of her ability the last five months to obtain firm footing in her poultry sales business in Kampala. Because she has been working hard, she has broken new ground for her business in a very short time. The single mother of three anticipates success for her fledgling business in the near future. She says her other assets, aside from hard work, have been determination, tenacity and good client relationship skills. She has learnt the ways and means of operating this genre of business in this relatively short time. 

Before that Justine was involved in a rental business. Monthly this business's financial returns amount to shillings 700,000. On the side, Justine also has a motorcycle business that she runs. With this loan, she says she is going to purchase more chickens to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens to resell.

loans.name: Gantulga

texts.en: Gantulga is 36 years old and lives in his older brother's ger (Mongolian yurt) in the Sansar area of Ulaanbaatar city. He manages a photography business in his town. He makes and prepares photo albums for students and pupils. He is planning to renew his equipment with the loan received from Xacbank, one of the biggest banks in Mongolia. He is polite man who says, "I want to have my own photo studio in the future." He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase equipment.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for his photo studio

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana sells maize at Elmina.  She is also into gari processing (as shown in the picture above). She is a single parent who is currently taking care of five children.  She has been in this business for six years. She is solely responsible for the education, feeding and clothing of her children. Her loan will be used to buy more bags of cassava to process for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: to buy more bags of cassava to process

loans.name: Aston

texts.en:
Aston is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo in the Mubende region of Uganda. He is married and has two children. One of his children is currently in school. Aston has a business selling clothes, which he has had for four years.

To help expand his business, Aston has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase clothes for resale. With the help of this loan from BRAC, Aston hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his child. In the future, Aston hopes to expand his business. Aston is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program, which has helped his prospects for the future by helping him increase his stock.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Elviz Rafael

texts.es:
Elviz de 20 años, vive con su familia en casa de sus padres, la cual cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicado en la zona rural del distrito de Reque que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Elviz desde hace un año se dedica a la comercialización de animales de corral (vacas, ovejas y aves de corral), los cría en los corrales que tiene en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada, granos y pastos naturales, una vez que hayan completado su crecimiento, los vende a sus clientes o en los diferentes mercados de la zona  y con los ingresos podrá cubrir sus obligaciones familiares.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para compra de animales como alimento balanceado, una vez que los engorde los comercializa a sus clientes, con las ganancias que obtenga pagará el crédito otorgado y mejorará su calidad de vida.  Elviz con trabajo y esmero a logrado sacar adelante poco a poco a su familia, algo que le da mucha alegria para seguir superandose.
texts.en:
Elviz is 20 years old. He lives with his family in his parents' house, which has only electrical service. It is located in the rural part of the district of Reque, which belongs to the province of Chiclayo.  It is an area characterized by farming and ranching activity. 

For the past year, Elviz has worked selling farm animals (cows, sheep and domestic birds). He raises them in pens which he maintains behind his house. He feeds them balanced animal feed, grains and natural grasses. Once they have completed their growth, he sells them to customers in the various markets of the area, and with the income he can cover his family obligations. 

He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1500 Peruvian new soles, to buy animals as well as balanced feed. Once he fattens the animals he will sell them to his customers. With the earnings he obtains, he will pay off the loan granted to him and will also improve his quality of life. With hard work and effort, Elviz has been able to help his family get ahead little by little, and it gives him much joy to continue improving his life.

loans.use: to buy farm animals and feed for them.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo, age 24, is married and has two children. He cultivates rice. During the last  season in May, Alfredo earned P20,000 from his crop. He used it to pay electric bills, school fees, daily expenses, and to save for security purposes for times when his income is low.  According to Alfredo, he has been cultivating two hectare of rice fields.

Alfredo is now asking for a loan of P20,000 in order to buy fertilizer and insecticides used in farming and for payments for the labor of transplanting rice in the rice fields.He hopes that he can increase his yield in the next crop so that he can provide for the financial needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer,insecticides and payments for the labor of transplanting of rice in the rice fields

loans.name: Davit

texts.en: Davit is a doctor. Unfortunately his salary is too low to cover the family's daily costs. So Davit also cultivates land and keeps livestock. Davit needs some financial investments to cultivate the land. With the requested loan Davit plans to pay purchase forage and fertilizer. With the help of this loan Davit will develop his business and get more income. Additional income means improved living conditions for Davit and his family. Davit lives together with his wife, two daughters and mother-in-law.

loans.use: to pay for forage and fertilizer.

loans.name: Abishyizehamwe / Rsz Group

texts.fr:
Samuel fait partie du groupe Abishyizehamwe / RSZ et sur la photo c'est celui qui a de l'argent. Le nom du groupe signifie « ceux qui sont ensemble ». Il a 42 ans. Il est marié avec 5 enfants de 2 à 25 ans, dont 4 scolarisés. 

Samuel est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est la semence du riz sélectionné. Dans les prochaines années, Samuel voudrait récolter une grande quantité de riz. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Samuel is a member of the Abishyizehamwe / RSZ group.  In the picture, he is the one holding the money.  The name of the group means "those who are together."  He is 42 years old.  He is married and has five children between the ages of two and 25, four of whom attend school.  

Samuel is a rice farmer.  This is his first loan cycle with ACB.  He is going to use his loan to buy chemical fertilizers to use in cultivating his rice.
 
His strategy for growing his business is to use only select rice for sowing.  In the coming years, Samuel would like to harvest a large quantity of rice. With his profits, he plans to educate and care for his children.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers to use in cultivating his rice.

loans.name: Ablaye

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune qui a arrete ses études aprèes deux ans au collége pour aller travailer afin d'aider sa famille.Il s'est alors lancé dans le commerce de pièces détachées et de matériel audio.Après cinq, il achéte une cantine au marché central et ouvre un compte à l'UIMCEC. Pour augmenter son fonds de commerce , il sollicite auprès de l'institution un pret de 300 000f et compte acheter 2 appareils de télévision, 2 DVD, 08 téléphone portables et des accessoirs. Il est marié et pére de trois enfants.Son ambition est d'ouvrir un grand magasin de vente en gros d'appareils audiovisuels.
texts.en:
This borrower is a young man who left school after 2 years of middle school so that he could work to help his family. At that time, he began selling small spare parts and audio equipment. Five years later, he opened a booth at the central market and opened an account at UIMCEC. To increase his working capital, he is asking for a loan of 300,000 francs which he plans to use to buy 2 TVs, 2 DVD players, 8 mobile phones and accessories.

He is married and the father of 3 children. His goal is to open a large wholesale store for audio-visual equipment.

loans.use: to buy 2 TVs, 2 DVD players, 8 mobile phones and accessories.

loans.name: Jehun

texts.en:
Jehun, 39, is married and has two sons. He is an internally displaced person who lives in Bilasuvar, IDP Settlement.

Jehun has been engaged in sheep breeding for the last five years. His primarily income comes from selling sheep. Jehun usually buys small lambs, fattens them, and resells them for a profit to the local butchers and vendors. He also works as the driver. His monthly income is 300 USD. 

He applied for a 1,000 AZN loan to purchase eight sheep and fodder.

loans.use: purchase eight sheep and fodder.

loans.name: Lendi

texts.en:
Lendi is a widower with two children. His children are seven and six years old. He has rented out retail space for the past year to supplement his income as a driver. This is his first loan with VisionFund Indonesia and he will use it for renovations to his rental spaces. He also will use some of it to pay school fees for his two children. His business is going well so far but there is other competition for retail space. Therefore his space needs repairs in order for him to keep renting it. 

He hopes that by having income from the rental business and being a driver, he can create a better life for his children.

loans.use: to pay for renovations for the retail spaces that he rents to shopkeepers

loans.name: Lynette

texts.en:
Lynette is 40 years old and is married with four children. She lives in Pangi, Siquijor, Siquijor.  For the past seven years, she has run a business where she sells an assortment of food. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP. Lynette has been a member of PMPC for one year.  

Lynette is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan to purchase ingredients for her food vending business. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients

loans.name: Kapkatenyi Star Group

texts.en:
Benson is the facilitator of the Kapkatenyi Star group. Benson and his group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Benson takes care of 10 children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund's low prices and in order to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Benson had an excellent maize yield harvesting 20 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Benson was only able to harvest eight bags of maize on that land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Benson and his group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs such as fertilizer and seed is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which also includes training, credit, and insurance. 

With the income from maize sales, Benson will educate his children and repay loans. 

In 2012, the members of Kapkatenyi Star group will each plant maize plots between one half and one acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Yenny

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS DIAMANTES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yenny; ella tiene 26 años de edad y es conviviente; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesanía, ella tiene una tienda donde vende chompas, tejidos y también productos en cuero como sombreros y billeteras, la socia vende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante en su negocio, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de artesanía. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales como cueros, hilos y lanas para hacer los trabajos de artesanía al por mayor. 

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Yenny is a member of the “Los Diamantes” communal bank, located in the Cusco district, province, and department.  Yenny is 26 years old, married, and sells arts and crafts.  She has a shop where she sells sweaters, woven items, and leather goods like hats, and wallets.

She works from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm and is getting ahead in life through this business.  She wants to expand the business and is asking for this loan in order to buy supplies such as leather, thread, and yarn to be able to make projects in large quantity.

She is grateful for the loan and is committed to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Beneth

texts.en:
Welcome to the world of this high-spirited married mother of 4 who makes no scruples about doing whatever it takes to succeed.  She goes by the name of Beneth, a lady who takes time by the forelock in whatever she does.  Beneth has been giving a good and assiduous account of herself in her retailing business venture for 6 years.  Most of her close friends and clients say this pro-activeness is principally the reason why she has struck such a deep chord with them.

In her grocery store, Beneth deals in essential home goods like maize flour, fresh fruits and vegetables, groundnut, rice, beans, etc.  She is hoping with this loan she can begin with a clean slate from the perspective of expansion.  Month in month out, her sales returns total up to UGX 350,000.  Beneth also practices farming on a small scale. She says she gets some of the food she sells like beans from her farm.  She says she is going to utilize her loan money to purchase more maize flour, groundnut, fresh fruits and green vegetables, etc. to resell.

loans.use: buy maize flour, groundnut, fresh fruits, green vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Lucas

texts.en:
Lucas is a 27-year-old retail shop owner and poultry farmer in Mombasa. He is single and has been doing this business for the past one year. 

He was introduced to KADET by another client and this marks his first borrowing to expand his business. He plans to buy more cooking oil, sugar, salt and maize flour to add to his shop stock. He will use the anticipated profits to purchase more stock for his business expansion. 

He hopes to realize more profits and build capital.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil, sugar, salt and maize flour.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila en Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  Para el Futuro De la Mujer. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, en este lugar se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Jacqueline, tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos, los mismos que ya son mayores  de edad, casados y viven en su casa pero independientes. Su esposo es empleado público.
 
Ella hace varios años aprendió corte  confección y tiene un local en su casa en el cual además de tener un taller de costura también tiene  unas cabinas telefónicas en las cuales pasa todo el dia sea controlando las llamadas que realizan sus clientes o cosiendo las prendas que sus clientes le piden. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 20h00, lleva 6 años con su local y le gusta porque allí se entretiene y gana algo por su cuenta.

Este crédito es para comprar telas, hilos, botones, cierres y otros materiales para la costura. Esta desde el inicio  en el Banco Comunal, es la tesorera del grupo y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy responsables y unidas. 

Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank for Future of the Woman meets every fifteen days in the town of La Pila in Montecristi. This place is well known in the province and in the country for its rich traditional culture, and you can find a wide variety of crafts there made by the inhabitants according to traditional customs.

Here we met Jacqueline. She is 47 years old and married, with three children who are already grown up and married. They live in her house, though independently. Her husband is a public employee.

She learned to sew some years ago and has a space in her house were, in addition to having a tailoring shop, she also has some phone booths. She spends all day there managing the phone calls made by her clients or sewing the clothes her clients ask of her. She works every day from 8am to 8pm. She has been at this location for 6 years and she likes it because she enjoys it and also earns something for herself.

This loan is for buying cloth, thread, buttons, zippers and other sewing materials. Since the beginning in the Communal Bank she has been the treasurer of the group. She likes it because her partners are very responsible and united.

Her dreams are to move forward with her business and to be healthy.

loans.use: to buy cloth, thread, buttons, zippers and other sewing materials.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en: Vestine, 27, is the mother of a one-and-a-half-year-old child. Vestine has spent three years operating a restaurant, and with this loan she will add more foodstuffs including potatoes, sugar and rice for use in the restaurant.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Maria Orfilia

texts.en:
My name is Maria R., I make and sell food, in my business I sell breakfasts, lunches, and I also sell snacks such as bread with beans, baleadas-Honduran tacos, tortillas with cheese, enchiladas, tacos and cakes). I have the help of my daughters to attend to my clients, my clientel is good and my business is located at a stop for the bus terminal. My business generates earnings to cover family expenses. My goal is to be able to increase my sales, and with the earnings I can improve my home, support my family and finance the studies of my children.

Loan Use: Purchase of chicken, pork, oil, lard, tortillas, bread, beans, salt, spices, salsas, tomatoe sauces, cheese, vegetables, sodas, water, juices, butter, margarine, chile, eggs and ham.

Mi nombre es Maria R., me dedico a la produccion y venta de comida, en mi negocio se venden desayunos, y almuerzos, tambien vendo golosinas como ser pan con frijoles, baleadas, tortillas con quesillo, enchiladas, tacos, pastelitos. Tengo la ayuda de mi hijo para atender a los clientes, y mi clientela es muy buena ya que mi negocio queda a la par de una terminal de buses, mi negocio me genera ingresos para cubrir mis gastos familiares, mi meta es poder incrementar mis ventas y con la ganacia que obtenga poder hacerle mejoras a mi casa de habitacion, sustentar a mi familia y proporcionarle estudios a mi hijo.

loans.use: Compra de carne de pollo y cerdo, aceite, manteca, tortillas, pan, frijoles, sal, especias, salsinas, salsa de tomate, quesillo, vegetales, refrescos, agua, jugos, mantequilla, margarina, chile, huevos, jamon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy welding tools and metal materials for the family's welding workshop

loans.name: Rahima

texts.en: Rahima is 40 years old and lives with 4 members of her family in District 2 in Kabul, Afghanistan. She is a tailor and helps her family because her husband has a smaller salary than she does and he wants her to continue working. She is in her 4th loan cycle and bought new machines and sewing materials. She wants to take a loan to expand her business. Rahima wants to buy  an electronic machine to sew nicer designs and meet all of her customers' orders.

loans.use: Buy new sewing machines and expand her tailor shop.

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en: Habiba lives in district 15 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is married, and she wants to help support her husband. She is skilled in embroidery, and she has good experience in her job. She wants to take a group loan to buy 3 more machines for her students to attract more clients. She wants to make a good income for her family to send her children to better education centers to study. She is happy with this loan.

loans.use: To buy new machines

loans.name: Channa

texts.en:
Channa married in 1987 and has 6 children, 3 sons and 3 daughters. She started up a grocery store in her home in 2000. In addition, she also sells alcoholic beverages in her store. Her husband produces and sells ice-cream. With their businesses, all of their children are able to attend school.

Channa has already borrowed and repaid three loans from MAXIMA. With the current loan in the amount of $400, she plans to expand her business by purchasing more grocery items for her inventory and buying a small freezer. Channa is capable of managing the loan and we feel sure she will be able to repay it without any problem.

loans.use: Purchasing grocery items for her inventory and buying a small freezer

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is a 48-year-old mother of three, who sells Kanga and Vitenge, the traditional attire commonly worn by women in Tanzania and most sub-Saharan countries. She is currently selling her items as a street vendor but her dream is to obtain a permanent location for her business to stop the disturbance from the Dar es Salaam  city council,  which keeps relocating the vendors every now and then. Amina is in need of a $600 USD loan to help boost her business.

loans.use: To find a permanent location for her shop and expand her business

loans.name: Ikram

texts.ru:
Ikram S. was born in 1967 in the village of Gegeli in the Agsu region. He has a family with four children. In his village people either raise animals or raise crops. Ikram raises animals. In order to expand his business, he came to Normicro that works with Kiva. He needs credit.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Ширалиев Икрам.Уроженец село Гегели Ахсуинского района.1967-года рождения.Семейный. Имеет четверых детей.Поскольку в этом селе сельчане в основном занимаются скотоводством и земледелием он выбрал первое.Чтобы активно заниматся он обратился за кредитом в Нормикро Ахсуинского филиала.Этот человек нуждается в кредите.

loans.use: To increase quantity  of animals

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
Hermelinda is a humble mother of two children, who since childhood has been very hard working, has held numerous jobs in order to get ahead, but upon seeing that the income generated did not cover her household expenses, she decided to create her own source of work. Therefore she renovated her home and installed a small artisan oven in which she makes a variety of breads to then distribute to the various little stores in her area.

The wish of this hardworking mother is to increase her production quantity and broaden her market in the city. In order to do this she needs a loan to purchase a large quantity of flour. Hermelinda promises to repay the loan in six months. “This hardworking mother needs your support in order to prosper in her business.”

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Hermelinda, es una humilde madre de dos niños, desde pequeña fue una persona muy trabajadora, dedicada a diversos oficios para tratar de progresar, pero al ver que los beneficios económicos que obtenía en sus actividades no cubrían todos los gastos que demandaba su hogar, decidió crear su propia fuente de trabajo, para eso dispuso adecuar e instalar al interior de su domicilio un pequeño horno artesanal, en el que elabora variedad de panes para luego distribuirlas a las diversas tienditas de su localidad.

El deseo que tiene esta empresaria madre es aumentar la cantidad de su producción y ampliar su mercado en su ciudad.Ante este anhelo requiere obtener un préstamo para comprar mayor cantidad de harina. Hermelinda se compromete a reembolsar el préstamo en un lapso de seis meses.“Esta madre empresaria requiere de tu apoyo para prosperar en su oficio”

loans.use: Purchase a large quantity of flour in order to increase her production.

loans.name: Rosalinda's Group

texts.en:
Genoveva, Karina, and Rosalinda have been members of the community bank “Las Golondrinas” for two years. In that time they have learned to be responsible, punctual, and to save. They also said that in the community bank they felt like someone believed in them.

Genoveva is 43 years old, and has one child. She has a business selling cebiche, which is a typical dish made from marinating fish in lemon juice. She has had this business for four years. Before that, she sold fresh orange juice. She hopes to start selling juices again, to compliment her cebiche.

Karina is 28 years old, and has two young children. She runs an auto parts business with her husband. Before that she had a business selling used clothing, but decided to change in order to realize a greater profit.

Rosalinda is 30 years old and also has two children. She now owns a restaurant, which she began many years ago. She sold her food from a cart. Five years ago she was able to buy space in a building to start her current business.

Genoveva, Karina, and Rosalinda need loans of 400, 2000, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in fruits, a juicer, a larger variety of auto parts, plates, cups, and food for the restaurant.

The community bank emphasizes the importance of saving and each associate has an interest earning savings account. Genoveva has epilepsy and is saving for treatment. Karina hopes to be able to hire a mechanic to work in her business, and Rosalinda would like to open a small grocery store in addition to her restaurant. Their dreams are to own land, put a roof on their house, continue working, and provide a better life for their children.

loans.use: Genoveva, Karina, and Rosalinda need loans of 400, 2000, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in fruits, a juicer, a larger variety of auto parts, plates, cups, and food for the restaurant.

loans.name: Chut

texts.en:
Mrs. Chut H., 45, is a widow with one child and works making cakes to sell in the market.

Typically, she earns $2.90 a day in profit. Her daughter works in the factory and normally makes on average $1.60 a day in profit.

Mrs. Chut H. wants to improve her business and is now requesting a loan from Kiva of about $400 to purchase rice, sugar and beans to make a large number of cakes to sell. The rest of the money she will use to buy pigs to raise for additional revenue.

loans.use: She will use this loan to purchase rice, sugar and beans to make cakes to sell in the market.

loans.name: Mahkamova

texts.ru:
H. Mahkamova is 49 years old, married and is a happy mother of four children. She has secondary education. Her husband is physically not capable to feed the entire family and this is why H. started her retail business selling groceries and food to sustain the quality of life of their family. Before she knew of Microinvest she took out loans from local illegal organizations which charged her high interest and fees and this did not allow her to make any profits. Now she buys inventory with cash and plans to start selling wholesale soon.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Махкамова Хабиба- 49 лет. Замужем, счастливая мать 4-х детей. Образование среднее. Муж физически не в состоянии прокормить свою семью и поэтому Хабиба начала заниматься торговлей продуктами питания для поддержания уровня жизни семьи. До кредитования в МЗФ она брала кредит у местных нелегальных кредиторов под большие процентные ставки, что не позволял автоматически увеличить доход. Теперь она покупает товар за наличные и скоро планирует перейти на оптовую продажу.

loans.use: Start selling wholesale and improve vendor space

loans.name: Halima's Kopa Ulipe Group

texts.en:
Halima is 35 years old and is a married woman with 5 children, ages 1-13 years old. Halima sells charcoal. She started in 2001. Every day, she works from 7am to 5pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members who have businesses selling food, stationery and fish.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda is a woman of much courage and bravery. The loss of her husband granted her these characteristics that now help her to take the reins of her home. With her first loan, after a lot of time of having been dedicated to agriculture, she acquired a calf, and with it, her economic situation has improved notably. With many dreams of continuing down the path of progress, she hopes to obtain a loan to purchase another calf, and little by little to establish a small stable.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Yolanda, es una mujer de mucho coraje y valentía. La pérdida de su esposo le otorgó estas características que ahora le ayudan a llevar las riendas de su hogar. Con un primer préstamo después de mucho tiempo de haberse dedicado a la agricultura adquirió una vaquita y con ella su economía ha mejorado notablemente. Con muchos deseos de continuar por la senda del progreso desea obtener un préstamo para comprar una vaquita más y así poco a poco establecer su pequeño establo.

loans.use: Purchase of a small calf

loans.name: Hem

texts.en: Mrs. Hem R., 54 years old, lives in the Prey Ving province in Cambodia with her husband and four children. She and her husband sell rice to support their family. In addition, her children also work to support the family: two are garment workers; one is a blacksmith; and one also helps with the rice business. The Roeuns are now seeking to borrow $1,200 in order to purchase a small truck to transfer their rice in a more efficient manner. They hope this will help them grow their business and help them earn more profit.

loans.use: To purchase a small truck to use for transport of rice

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
Gabriela Zorilla is a humble and hardworking woman. She lives in the lower zone of the city of Asuncion, always works hard and is singleand already retired. She receives a monthly pension for her retirement, but this money is not sufficient to maintain her house.

Gabriela works together with her daughter who lives with her, they are both single and take care of each other. Their primary activity is the creation and sale of all types of food. Their customers come to their house during the breakfast and lunch hours to enjoy their delicious plates.

To increase their income, she also prepares fast foods like empanadas, Milanese sandwiches, mbeyu (a traditional food), and other food to go and sell around the neighborhood in her basket.

She is asking for a loan that will let her buy ingredients in large quantities to increase her production. They include: meat, flour, milk, eggs, and vegetables.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva volunteer.

Gabriela Z., es una persona humilde y trabajadora, ella vive en una zona baja de la Cuidad de Asunción, siempre trabajo duro, es soltera y docente pero ya jubilada. Ella cobra una pensión mensual por su jubilación pero ese dinero no es suficiente para mantener la casa.

Gabriela trabaja junto con su hija quien vive con ella, ambas son solteras y se cuidan mutuamente. Su actividad principal es la elaboración y venta de comidas de todo tipo. Sus clientes van hasta su casa en los horarios de desayuno y almuerzo para disfrutar de sus deliciosos platos.

Para aumentar sus ingresos, ella también prepara comidas rápidas como empanadas, milanesas, mbeyu (comida típica) y otra cosas mas para salir a vender por el barrio recorriendo con su canasto.

Ella solicita un crédito que le permitirá comprar ingredientes en grandes cantidades para asi aumentar su producción. Entre ellos citamos: carne, harina, leche, huevos, verduras.

loans.use: Purchase of meat, flour, milk, eggs and vegetables

loans.name: Sitan

texts.fr:
Madame Sitan C. est âgée de 45 ans et vit avec ses 6 enfants et son mari dans une famille monogame dans le quartier Pelengana Nord de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région économique de la république du Mali).
Dès sa tendre enfance elle a commencé les activités génératrices de revenus notamment la vente des coupons de tissus rapiècés en habits et des condiments alimentaires auprès de sa mère .Avec  20 ans d’expériences elle jouit d’ une réputation et d’une  notorieté sans égale dans la ville de Ségou.
Afin de faire face aux ruptures de stock fréquentes au niveau du grand marché de Ségou, elle décida d’intégrer  le  programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso afin de pouvoir constituer un stock suffisant pour une période un peu plus longue.
En 3 ans de collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso, elle a obtenu  4 prêts solidaires avec une association de son quaertier et est à son  deuxième prêt individuel.  Avec le prêt actuel, elle compte achéter 15 sacs d’oignon auprès des grossistes au grand marché de Ségou soit au niveau des foires hebdomadaires des villages de Tonan, Dougabougou ou Séribala. 
Elle vend en gros au comptant ou à crédit au nouveau marché de Pelengana Nord où elle mène cette activité. .Les produits sont étalés sur une grande table et vendu en détail à une clientèle essentiellement composée de femmes et quelques hommes. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40.000 FCFA. Madame Sitan C. envisage devenir une grossiste pouvant ravitailler les détaillants du marché de la ville de Ségou.
texts.en:
Madame Sitan C. is 45 years old and lives in a monogamous family with her husband and six children in the North Pelegana neighborhood of the town of Ségou (the fourth-largest economic region of the Republic of Mali). Since childhood she has been participating in income-generating activites, particularly scraps of fabric re-sewn into clothes and food seasonings with her mother. With 20 years of experience she enjoys an unparalleled reputation and notoriety in the town of Ségou. In order to deal with frequent supply interruptions at the main market in Ségou, she decided to participate in the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso in order to build up sufficient stock for longer periods. During three years of collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso, she has received four solidarity loans with an association in her neighborhood and is on her second individual loan. With this current loan, she intends to buy 15 bags of onions from wholesalers in Ségou's main market or during the weekly markets in the villages of Tonan, Dougabouguo, or Séribala. She sells in bulk for cash or on credit at the new market in North Pelengana where she runs her business. Her wares are spread out on a big table and sold retail to customers comprised mostly of women and some men. She envisions making a monthly profit of 40,000 Francs CFA. Madame Sitan C. also envisions becoming a wholesaler who would be able to supply retailers in the town market of Ségou.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase onions

loans.name: Šemsa

texts.en: ŠEmsa M., 54, lives alone in the village of Stjepan Polje near Gračanica. Since retiring, she has operated a business raising both chickens and cows. She wants to improve her business and so is requesting a loan of $550 to buy a milk machine. Her work around cows will be much easier with this machine, and she will have more time for other labours involving her animals.  Emsa’s hope is to buy more cows and have her own little farm.

loans.use: To buy a milk machine

loans.name: Tiburciana

texts.es:
Tiburciana Es socia del Banco Comunal Agua Viva. Tiburciana es casada, tiene 50 años y 7 hijos, Tiburciana vende comida de manera ambulatoria en una avenida principal del distrito de San Juan Bautista, actividad que realiza a partir de las 4 de la tarde hasta altas horas de la noche, Tiburciana vende anticuchos, tripitas que son preparados de los intestinos de pollo, que compra diariamente en la granja. En algunas oportunidades Tiburciana viaja a las ferias de la región en donde compra quesos cereales, que vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Tiburciana necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de papa, condimentos y bolsas. Los sueños de Tiburciana son que sus hijos sean profesionales, construir su casa con material noble y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Tiburciana is a partner in the "Agua Viva" Communal Bank. Tiburciana is 50 years old and married, with seven children. She sells food from a cart along a main street in the San Juan Bautista district, starting at four in the afternoon and going into late hours in the night. Tiburciana sells kebabs and tripe, prepared from chicken intestines that she buys every day from a farm. When she has the opportunity, Tiburciana travels to regional markets where she buys cheese and cereals that she sells in the Ayacucho markets. Tiburciana needs a loan of 1050 soles, which she'll use to buy potatoes, condiments and bags. She dreams of her children becoming professionals, building her own house with solid materials, and improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tiburciana needs a loan of 1050 soles which she'll use to buy potatoes, condiments and bags.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a cow and fodder to fatten it

loans.name: Sum

texts.en:
Sum L., 29, is single and lives with her mother and her three younger sisters and brothers in Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham province, Cambodia.

She works with her mother on her paddy growing seasonal rice and vegetables, but the money they make is barely enough to support their household. Meanwhile, her little brother and sister are employed making incense with one of her neighbors, earning US$ 4/day each. Incense-making is a profitable business in her town and it’s simply to work on to generate profit.

Having a very close relationship with her neighbor, Sum L. would like to invest with him in the business by purchasing more items to increase their production. Meeting the financial constraints, Sum L. would like to request a loan from KIVA to put toward her investment.

loans.use: To use for her investment in a neighbor's business

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort B. is forty-five years old. She resides at Bawalashie with her husband and four kids, all in school. She sells kenkey, fish, vegetables, yam, and plantain at the Mmepeasem market, a small community at Bawalashie. Kenkey is a local dish prepared from milled maize and mostly served with grind hot pepper and fish. Comfort has been in this business for the past twelve years, a trade she learned from her late mother. She buys ingredients from Madina market to cook her kenkey and then sells in her community. She has a plot and hopes to build her own house and move in with her family. She will use this loan to buy maize.

loans.use: To buy maize to make kenkey.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
A la cabeza de Olga L. trece mujeres trabajan junto a Pro-Mujer hace seis años aproximadamente, se reúnen quincenalmente, en el centro focal de  Villa Exaltación, donde realizan sus actividades de manera responsable. Existen diversos negocios dentro la asociación, algunas  son costureras, otras se dedican al tejido y venta de chompas, también elaboran ladrillos para luego venderlos a pedido.
La asociación Nueva Esperanza” necesita ampliar sus ventas por lo que necesitan comprar materia prima, tienen la certeza que generaran mayores ingresos, únicamente con el fin de mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Together with Olga L., thirteen women have been working with Pro-Mujer for approximately six years. They meet every two weeks, in the center of Villa Exaltación, where they carry out their activities in a responsible manner. A diversity of businesses exist within the group, some are seamstresses, other dedicate themselves to knitting and selling sweaters, and they also make bricks to later sell on order. The association “Nueva Esperanza” (“New Hope”) needs to grow its sales so they can buy raw materials. They are certain of their ability to generate added income, with the final aim of improving their standards of living.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina O. sells medicine and provisions. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for a loan of $675 to purchase more medicine and provisions to sell. She is 39 years old and married with three children. She lives in Warri, Delta state, Nigeria. Paulina sends her thanks to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine and provisions to sell

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma es socia del Bancomunal Las Palmeras.
Vilma es separada tiene dos hijos ya mayores que están casados.
Vilma es de Cajamarca, estudio enfermería, trabajaba en un hospital pero tuvo mala experiencia y lo dejo, se caso y su esposo no quería que trabaje por que era muy celoso.
Vilma se dedica a la venta de ropa interior, lleva a provincias y reparte en los  puestos de mercados.  
Vilma necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles, para la compra de ropa interior, brasieres fajas, medias.
Desde que esta en Finca, su capital de trabajo a aumentado, ahora ha podido poner otro negocio, ella aprendió a ser responsable y puntual con los pagos, le gusta la puntualidad de las reuniones, son muy amenas.   
El sueño de Vilma es poner una óptica y viajar a Panamá para traer lentes.
texts.en:
Vilma is a member of the “Las Palmeras” Community Bank. Vilma is separated, has two children who are now grown and married. Vilma is from Cajamarca, she studied nursing, and she used to work in a hospital but she had a bad experience and left. She married and her husband didn’t want her to work because he was very jealous. Vilma sells underwear. She goes to the surrounding areas and delivers to the stands in the markets. Vilma needs a loan of 1400 soles to buy underwear, bras, girdles, stockings. Since she has been with Finca, her working capital has increased, now she has been able to open another business. She learned to be responsible and punctual with the payments; she likes the punctuality of the meetings and they are very entertaining. Vilma dreams of opening an optical shop and traveling to Panama to bring eyeglasses.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy underwear, bras, girdles, stockings.

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana N. is 39 years old and married with 2 children. She is a fashion designer. She makes lovely clothes for her customers to wear. She also sells sarongs and laces. Christiana is requesting a loan in the amount of N50,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to make more clothes. She says thanks to kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials

loans.name: Ericka Marleny

texts.es: Ericka es casada tiene 33 años de edad y 3 hijos, todos van a la escuela, su esposo la ayuda en el negocio de la venta de lácteos y productos de comida por unidad, y por mayor, ellos venden queso, crema, agua pura, refrescos, jugos, gelatinas en vaso etcétera. También tiene una lavandería, juntos salen a repartir el producto a las tiendas ya que cuentan con un vehiculo el cual les hace mucho mas fácil el trabajo por el motivo que tienen los clientes muy lejos de su comunidad, ellos salen a repartir los lácteos 4 días a la semana y los otros 3 días ella se dedica a su lavandería, el préstamo que ella solicita es porque necesitan surtir mas su mercadería por que las ventas son buenas, sus sueño mas grande es ver a sus hijos en la universidad y con un buen futuro
texts.en:
Ericka, 33, is married with three kids. All of them attend school. Her husband helps her with her business selling dairy and food products, such as cheese, cream, fresh water, beverages, juices, and jellies, etc. She also has a laundromat. Together they go out to deliver produce to the stores now that they have a vehicle that makes their work much easier, since they have customers far from their community. They distribute dair products four days a week and the other three she spends at the laundromat. This loan is requested because they need to stock more merchandise since sales are good. Their greatest dream is to see their kids at the university and with a good future.

Translated from Spanish by Todd Schmid, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence B. is fifty years old. She is a widowed mother of six children, two sons and four daughters. Some of her children are in the senior high school while others are in the junior high school and the primary school. She lives with some of her children in a family house in Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Goaso is one of the busy business centres in the region.

Florence runs a drug store by the road side in her community. She buys her drugs from Kumasi. She has been in business for over ten years and wants a loan to buy drugs in bulk to increase her stock. She hopes to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy drugs

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en: Brenda D. is from the village of Danao. She is 45 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. Brenda owns and operates a fishing business, primarily harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Brenda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fish to sell. Brenda is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Señor De Los Milagros De Chimpahuaylla Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “SEÑOR D. LOS MILAGROS D. CHIMPAHUAYLLA”, se encuentra ubicado a 35 minutos D. la ciudad del Cusco perteneciente aún ala comunidad D. Chimpahuaylla.

Nuestros socios alternan sus diferentes actividades con los negocios, ellos tienen pequeños comercios, son vendedores D. salchipapas, (comida rápida, elaborada a base D. salchichas fritas con papas fritas), venden granos (maíz, habas, cebada, trigo), venta D. verduras, algunos son docentes y otros tienen sus tiendas D. abarrotes, los socios requieren el préstamo para poder invertir en sus diferentes negocios y D. esa manera mejorar sus servicios.

Los socios se encuentran agradecidos con el préstamo otorgado y el apoyo prestado mediante este medio y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago D. sus deudas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
The Señor D. los Milagros D. Chimpahuaylla Community Bank is located 35 minutes from the city of Cusco in the Chimpahuaylla community. Their members have different, small businesses. Some sell “salchipapas” (fast food maD. from fried sausages and fried potatoes), grains (corn, beans, barley, wheat), and vegetables. Some are teachers and others have grocery stores. The members need a loan to invest in their different businesses. That way they can improve their services. The members are appreciative of the loan and the support given this way, and they promise to pay their debts on time as agreed upon.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Set up small businesses

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda C. is from the village of Zone 14, Kabacsanan, Iligan City. She is 49 years old. Nilda is married and has 10 adult-aged children. To make a living, Nilda operates a family member's business venture raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Nilda has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In July 2009, Nilda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nilda is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This loan will be Nilda's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

location.town: Zone 14, Kabacsanan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Simkol Group

texts.en:
Famata is 40 years of age and completely illiterate. She’s married with 3 children and is engaged in the buying and selling of goods across borders. She has been conducting this business for the past 25 years (she started at age 15). 

She purchases and sells any kind of commodity that comes her way and especially sells at retail prices. Being wholly associating with business friends, she has been very successful and is currently dreaming of building a good house for her and her children, as well as being able to send them to school to complete their educational process.

loans.use: To buy food staples for resale

loans.name: Pedrita

texts.en:
Pedrita L. is from the village of Makawa. She is 51 years old. Pedrita is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Pedrita owns & operates a fishing business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Pedrita has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Pedrita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pedrita has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. Pedrita is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Pedrita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita R. opened her sari-sari (variety) store in 2004. She has three children and a supportive husband who always helps her run the business. She started borrowing from CEVI in March 2009. It was her second loan from CEVI and she has been conscientious about repaying her loan from the beginning.

She would like to request another loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to purchase additional stock to resell. This loan will help her to offer a wider selection of goods. With variety, she will be able to attract more customers and earn more income.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise to resell

loans.name: Lim's Group
loans.use: To begin selling a few grocery items from her home

loans.name: Mutt

texts.en:
Mrs. Mutt S. is a villager in Pongro village in Takeo province. She is a duck breeder. Since her poultry business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more ducks and duck food for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's lives with this loan.

Her husband, Mr. Horn Hon, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. This couple has a child who is attending the local school.

loans.use: Purchasing more ducks and duck food for breeding.

loans.name: Ayoo

texts.en:
Ayoo Santa sells flour, beans and dried fish, and is requesting a loan to purchase shorgum and more fish to sell. Ayoo is 32 years old and is married to a policeman. She has five children who attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase food for resale

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Being engaged in her hog-raising business for already two years, Lourdes C. can say that hog raising is really helpful to their family. Because of that, she really wants to continuously engage in her business. Thus, she is requesting a Php 5,000 loan from Kiva lenders for her to obtain the needed feeds for her pigs.

Lourdes is married to Rodolfo, 42 years old and a farmer. As fruit of their love, they are blessed with four children. They live happily in the village of Santiago, Reina Mercedes, Isabela.

loans.use: To buy pig feed

loans.name: Kacu

texts.en:
Kacu F. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and groundnut paste. She is requesting a loan to purchase brewing materials like yeast, pipes etc. 

 Kacu is 32 years old and is married to a soldier. She has three children and her children do not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bar.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase brewing materials like yeast, distilation tubes etc

loans.name: Obeng

texts.en:
Obeng is 44 years old. He is married and the father of three children. His children are currently in school. To support his household, he has been selling cereals like maize and groundnuts in the community market to his loyal customers. He also transports a major part of his stock to Kumasi's central market to sell at a competitive price.

Obeng says selling of these products is very lucrative, with his fifteen years' selling experience. He believes providing quality education will happen. He takes delivery of stock from the farming communities. Therefore, he wants the loan to expand his inventory to enable him to make good income to support his family, especially in their education.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cereals like groundnuts and beans

loans.name: Valle Hermoso Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. Emprendimiento VALLE HERMOSO es un grupo antiguo se encuentra en su 9º ciclo,  son responsables y solidarios entre sus integrantes, como presidenta esta la señora Carmen, ella es lider D. su grupo por ser una persona dinamica y responsable, se dedica al auto tranporte, tiene 2 hijos dependientes, y su esposo trabaja en Fanexa y ambos comparten los gastos del hogar. 

Como tesorea esta La Sra.Claudia, quien es soltera no tiene hijos es muy responsable con el manejo D. efectivo y trabaja como chofer en una linea D. transportes, el credito lo utiliza para mantenimiento D. su vehiculo.

como secretaria del grupo esta la señora Jhaneth, quien tiene 3 hijos, ella venD. ropa americana y su esposo trabaja en una linea D. transporte. El grupo valle Hermoso esta agradecio con la institucion por el apoyo brindado
texts.en: The VALLE HERMOSO communal bank is a long-standing group currently in its 9th cycle; the members are responsible and unified. Carmen is group president. She is the group leader thanks to her dynamism and responsibility. She is in public transportation, has two dependent children. Her husband works for Fanexa (National Explosives Factory). Together, they contribute to taking care of family expenses. Claudia is the group's treasurer. She is single and has no children. She is very responsible managing the group's cash and she works as a driver for a public transportation company. She will use the funds for vehicle maintenance. Jhaneth is the secretary. She has 3 children and sells second-hand American clothing. Her husband works for a transportation company. The Valle Hermoso group is grateful to the institution for the support provided. [[[Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Magaly

texts.es: La Sra. Magaly, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres del 2000”, Distrito de Lamas, Provincia de Lamas, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 32 años y es madre de 01 hijo, que aun depende de ella.Magaly, es una mujer trabajadora y con su espíritu luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de Venta de Cosméticos de la línea Esika, CyZone, Avon y Unique, sin tener que tener un jefe y horario. Poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes, hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en este tipo de actividad. También se dedica a la venta de diferentes tipos de adornos (mercerías).En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio  ubicado en su misma casa donde vende todo el día también sale  a ofrecer casa por casa los productos que vende  a sus amistades. Se siente muy contenta y tranquila con lo que realiza. Con este préstamo de S/. 2,500.00, comprará productos de catálogos como: perfumes y colonias refrescantes, cremas corporales y de rostro, labiales y polvos compactos, así de esta manera mantener a sus clientes satisfechos y contentos. Parte del dinero también invertirá en la compra de diferentes tipos de adornos y regalos.  Magaly, se siente muy tranquila y contenta con lo que hace  y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Sra. Magaly is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres del 2000” (Women of 2000), which is located in the District and Province of Lamas, Department of San Martín. She is 32 years old, single, and the mother of one dependent child. Magaly is a hardworking woman who possesses a fighting spirit. In order to get ahead by her own means, she started a business selling cosmetics of various lines. These include Esika, CyZone, Avon, and Unique. Magaly does not report to a boss or maintain a set work schedule. Over time she became well known among her customers. She says her business is doing very well. In addition to selling cosmetics to her friends door-to-door, she manages a haberdashery in her home where she offers different types of ornaments. Magaly feels content and at peace with what she has accomplished.

With this loan of 2500 soles, she will purchase products from her catalogs such as perfumes, colognes, body and face crèmes, lipsticks, and compacts in order to keep her customers happy. Part of the money will also be used to purchase various types of decorations and gift items. Magaly thanks Manuela Ramos for contributing toward the fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products & merchandise for her haberdashery

loans.name: Jelly

texts.en:
Jelly S. is from the village of Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old. Jelly is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Jelly raises livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Jelly has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jelly joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jelly is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jelly from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
