Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Janylbubu's Group

texts.en: The coldest place in Kyrgyzstan is Naryn. In the period of the Soviet Union, Naryn was the capital, because everything was imported firstly to Naryn. Although Naryn is the coldest place, people there are very kind. Their hospitality is amazing. In spite of crisis, even now, they may cut a sheep for one guest. Whole families can be fed for about a month by one sheep, but citizens of Naryn may cut it for one person in order to show that he is welcome. Janylbubu K. is just like this. She is a kind, open-minded person. Because she gives something, God is giving her. God already gave her health; besides that, He gave her a really hardworking husband and brilliant son. She adores them because they are really good friends and her best supporters. Her husband is on pension but still works at home as a joiner and makes fascinating items. A simple piece of wood can turn out to be a beautiful souvenir. It is his hobby but, at same time, it provides an opportunity to earn their daily bread. They bought a joiner bench and began their business. Later on, with the money they earned (about 5,000 soms or $112), they bought cattle. Now their revenue is 4,000 soms ($90). They are planning to build a house and marry off their son. They decided to take out a loan to buy raw materials. Sabira O. is a 50-year-old married woman. She has two children: a daughter and a son. Her daughter is a student and her son also attends school. Her husband is a taxi driver. They want to take out a loan to buy two tonnes of coal. With the rest of the money, they will buy sheep. Cholpon O. is a 54-year-old married woman. Her two children attend the local school and her husband works as an electrician at the school. They want to take out a loan to buy coal. Their plan is to buy a house for their son. Aynagul M. is a 57-year-old married woman. She has five children: four of them live separately and her youngest daughter is a student. Her husband is a joiner who makes frames and doors. Their revenue is 3,000 soms ($67). They want to buy a horse – that’s why they need a loan. Suusar B. is a 50-year-old married woman. She has two sons. The older one is 25; he is a tractor driver and helps his father. The younger one is a student. They are planning to build a house for their sons and increase the number of their cattle. They want to take out a loan to buy a cow and, with the rest, they are planning to buy coal. ====================================== Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3 P's concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to further your support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for wooden souvenir production

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more women's jeans.

loans.name: Ileana Benita

texts.es: Ileana Betina tiene 37 años, es madre de familia tiene dos hijos que van al colegio, su  negocio es venta de ropa de manera ambulante, su esposo trabaja como albañil por cuenta propia el ayuda a su esposa a sufragar los gastos del hogar, por lo que el también ayuda a cuidar a sus hijas. Está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en su negocio por el motivo que se acerca la temporada de semana santa sus clientes le están solicitando una variedad de productos. Sueña con obtener otro medio de ingreso como es una pulpería así podrá estar en su casa y velar por sus hijas.
texts.en:
Ileana Betina is 37 years old and a mother of two children who are attending high school. She sells clothing as a traveling merchant. Her husband works as a mason and helps his wife with covering the household expenses, which contributes toward the care of their daughters.

Ileana is requesting a loan to invest in her business because the Holy Week season is approaching and her customers are seeking a variety of products. She dreams of obtaining another source of income, such as a grocery store, to establish in her home so that she can look after her daughters.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Salimot

texts.en: Salimot sells drinks, groceries and foodstuffs in her shop. She has been in business for over seven years. She is very happy with her business growth. She lives in Lagos with her family. She is married with three children and she is 32 years of age. She is able to make a reasonable profit from her business, which she uses to support her husband who is a mechanical engineer. She hopes for a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more drinks, foodstuffs and groceries to sell and make more profit for her business and her family upkeep. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks, foodstuffs and groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ozodjon

texts.en:
Ozodjon is 26 years old and lives with his wife and their two children. He has been very familiar with agriculture since he was young. Thanks to his parents he knows how to work the land. Now he supports himself entirely from potato and wheat production. He works all day weeding, irrigating, and fertilizing his fields so that his production will be good. He has always liked weeding his fields because it is important and is lighter work than many of his tasks. 

Ozodjon wants to improve his family's quality of life; that wish provides the motivation for his arduous work. He will invest the loan in the purchase of seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants, with the aim of having the best production in his community in a few months. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Moisari Ole

texts.en:
Moisari Ole L. is 30 years old. He is married to Nemuta L., and he is the father of two children who are currently in school.

Moisari is a farmer, and he has farmed his own piece of land for the last four years.
  
He learned about KADET from a colleague who is already a KADET registered client. This will be his second loan. He is planning to plant more wheat, which has proved to do very well in this area. He also intends to keep some sheep to sell later. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to reinvest in the farm and plant more acres of wheat.

His hope and dream is to become a large scale farmer, both in wheat farming and sheep rearing.

loans.use: To plant four acres of wheat

loans.name: Rosalba

texts.es:
La señora Rosalba esta agradecida por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual puso pagar los gastos escolares de sus hijos.
Nuevamente esta solicitando un préstamo para poder pagar en la escuela la inscripción ya que sus hijos no podrán terminar este siclo escolar.
Desea que sus hijos tengan el educación necesaria para salir a delante en su futuro y no tengan problemas de encontrar trabajo teniendo los estudios de una profesional.
Es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos bajo su responsabilidad.
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene de su trabajo en una fabrica en el área de producción.
texts.en:
Rosalba is grateful for your support of her previous loan, which she used to pay her children´s school expenses. Now she is asking for a loan to be able to pay the school tuition so that her children can finish the school year. She wants her children to have the education they need to get ahead in the future and that they do not have problems finding a job if they have a profession. She is a single mother and has three children to care for. She plans to repay the loan with earnings from her job at a factory.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: School expenses

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase livestock feed

loans.name: Gil

texts.en:
Gil S. is from the village of Gata Daku Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 23 years old. Gil is single. To make a living, Gil owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating motor transport services like "habal-habal". Gil has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Gil joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gil has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Gil is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to repair his existing vehicle to provide better service. This loan will be the 16th loan taken out by Gil from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Ercilia

texts.es:
Ercilia es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos, de los cuales 2 estudian y el ultimo es pequeño aun, Ercilia tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su mama.
Ercilia es socia del Banco Comunal Wiñarisun que significa Crezcamos en quechua y solicita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de galletas, caramelos, arroz y azúcar.
Ercilia sueña con ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Ercilia lives with her partner and has 3 children. Two of them are in school, and the last is still young. Ercilia has a store in her house, where she sells basic groceries, produce, meat, a business she manages daily with the help of her mother. Ercilia is a member of the Wiñarisun Communal Bank, which means “let’s grow” in Quechua. She is requesting a loan of 900 soles, to invest in purchasing cookies, candy, rice, and sugar. Her dream is to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cookies, candy, rice, and sugar

loans.name: Mach's Group

texts.en:
This group loan is made up of five people who live in Chong Kaoh village, Kandal province. Mrs. Mach M. is the group leader who has been selected by the members. Each member of this group will use her portion of the loan to support a different business.
Mrs. Mach M. and her husband, Mr. Touch Tai, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate leeks and bananas. In order to support this farm, Mrs. Mach M. has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer. The couple is able to earn a small income from the farm to support the family. The couple has two children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory and the other of whom is a student in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to cultivate leeks and bananas

loans.name: Togetherness Group

texts.en:
Augustine K., shown holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Togetherness. He is 38 years old, single and has five children who range from 11 months to 18 years old. He was only able to attend school through 11th grade due to financial difficulty.

For five years, Augustine has been selling diesel fuel at Soul Clinic Market, Paynesville outside of Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 8,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 37,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more gallons of diesel fuel. Describing himself as a determined and hardworK. man, Augustine's goals are to improve his business and educate his children.

loans.use: To buy more gallons of diesel fuel

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, de 46 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y alegre, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. Desde muy pequeña siempre le enseñaron a María a trabajar en todo para alcanzar sus metas, ahora se dedica a la venta de alfalfa y cuyes, los cuales ella misma cultiva y cría respectivamente. Paralelamente a esta actividad, también se dedica en la elaboración de quesos y manjar, negocio al cual la ayuda su hermana para llevarlos a la ciudad de Lima para su venta.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es criar cuyes y lo hace con mucho amor, lleva 16 años realizando esta actividad y espera que su negocio siga creciendo, para que le pueda brindar mejores ingresos económicos a su familia. Este es el décimo primer crédito con MFP, está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que no desea meter en problemas a su grupo comunal, en donde es muy solidaria con el resto de sus compañeras. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más comida para sus cuyes, ya que es la actividad que mejor ingresos le genera.
texts.en:
María, 46, is an unassuming, cheerful woman. She lives in her own house and what she most desires is to improve her quality of life. She was taught as a very young girl to work at everything to reach her goals. She currently sells alfalfa and guinea pigs which she herself grows and raises, respectively. In addition to these activities, she also makes cheese and manjar (sweet bread spread similar to cake frosting) that her sister helps her with to take into Lima to sell. What she likes most about her work is raising guinea pigs which she does lovingly. She’s been in this line of work for 16 years and hopes her business will continue to grow so that it will produce higher income for the family. This is her 10th loan with MFP and she’s willing to repay all her installments on time because she doesn’t want to cause any problems for her communal group where she is very supportive of her fellow members. She will use the requested 2000 new soles to buy feed for the guinea pigs since this activity is the one that generates the best income for her.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy guinea pig feed.

loans.name: Flor Ermencia

texts.es:
La Señora Flor Ermencia D. es socia del banco comunal Vegaspamba. Vive en la comunidad que lleva el mismo nombre, esta comunidad se encuentra a 45 min de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura.

La Señora Flor con su trabajo está sacando adelante a su familia, se dedica a la agricultura, vende  sus verduras hace 6 años un mercado de la ciudad, también compra a otros proveedores para tener un gran surtido de productos en su negocio, los días feriados sale al mercado con sus productos desde las 3 a.m. hasta que termine la venta, los demás de días sale a vender desde las 4 a.m.

Doña Flor tiene 36 años, está separada hace 5 años y tiene 6 hijos de 17, 13, 10, 8, 7 y 6 años de edad, su primera hija trabaja y es quien le ayuda económicamente, su segunda hija estudia en un colegio de la ciudad y sus últimos cuatro hijos estudian en la escuela. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Se encuentra en su sexto ciclo y los créditos le han  beneficiado en su trabajo, el crédito que recibe de la fundación Espoir lo va a invertir en la compra de más verduras para la venta.
 
Su meta es crecer más en su negocio para poder ofrecerle una mejor educación y alimentación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Flor Ermencia D. is a member of the Vegaspamba communal bank. She lives in Vegaspamba which is located 45 minutes from the city of Cuenca. Its residents raise farm animals and are farmers. Flor has raised her family through her work. She is a farmer and has sold her vegetables for the last 6 years in a local municipal market. She also buys from other suppliers in order to have a varied stock on hand. On feast days she goes to the market with her goods from 3am until she sells out. The rest of the days she starts selling at 4am. Flor is 36 years old, separated for the last 5 years and has 6 children who are 17, 13, 10, 8, 7 and 6 years of age. Her oldest daughter works and helps her economically. Her second daugther goes to school in the city and her youngest four are in the local school. She does not own a home, she rents. This is her 6th loan cycle. The loans have benefited her work. The loan she gets from Fundación Espoir will be used to buy vegetables to sell. Her goal is to grow more in her business so that she can offer a better education and nourishment to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables.

loans.name: Aiza

texts.en:
Aiza G. has a sari-sari (convenience) store and a rice and corn farm. From these, she is able to generate income for her family. She has three children. He eldest child is eight years old; her youngest is only one year old.  

She wishes to improve their living conditions, so she has applied to CEVI for a loan of Php 5,000. With the loan, she will buy additional merchandise to sell and farm supplies. She likes CEVI because of its insurance services. 

She hopes someday to have a bigger store so that she will be able to support the education of her children and give them a brighter future.

loans.use: To buy additional store merchandise and farm supplies

loans.name: Santos Esmeralda

texts.es:
la sra. Santos Esmeralda Z. tiene 52 años de edad, vive en la colonia Villa Nueva y se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pequeña pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion, tiene muchos clientes ya que se encuentra en un lugar muy estratégico y que es muy transitado.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia y asi surtir bien su pulperia.
con su pulperia bien surtida tendra muchas ventas y por ende mas ganancias, las cuales las necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Ms. Santos Esmeralda Z. is 52 years old, she lives in the neighborhood of Villan Nueva and engages in retail, selling popular consumer products. She runs a small corner shop located in her house, which is located in a very strategic and well-attended place, and as a result she has many customers.
The loan she is requesting will be used to buy products and supply her corner shop.
The better her corner shop is supplied, the more products she will sell, thus earning more money that will be used to pay for her family expenses.

loans.use: To buy different popular consumer products to sell.

loans.name: Sarhad

texts.en:
Sarhad B. is 55 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Bayan-Ulgiy province in western Mongolia. His oldest two sons are both university students and his youngest two daughters attend a local high school while his wife is retired.  He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent.

Sarhad has been operating a coal selling business in his town since 2001. Even though he is an old man, he operates two businesses in order to educate his children with the proceeds. In 2009, he started collecting livestock to sell.

Sarhad needs more funds to prepare meat in bulk for winter, therefore he is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more livestock to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more livestock

loans.name: Nara

texts.es:
La señora Nara es socia del banco comunal El Arenal, del Distrito de Callería, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 59 años de edad.  Está casada y tiene 10 hijos todos ya mayores e independientes. 
Nara  lleva 7 años trabajando con Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue de  S/. 300.00 soles, con ese dinero empezó su negocio.
Ella se dedica a la venta de comida  para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su casa  y lo hace solo por las tardes, vive con su esposo que se desempeña como agricultor. 
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 soles, invertirá una parte en su negocio de comida y la otra parte lo destinara para comprar 5 kg de  semilla de maíz, 2 kg de semilla de frejol, ½  kg de semilla de tomate, ½ kg de semilla de culantro de la región, ¼  kg de semilla de pepinillo, ½ kg de semilla de vainitas y otras semillas mas.  
La señora nara está muy complacida con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, porque con ese dinero puede trabajar para poder mantenerse y pagar los servicios de su hogar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nara is a member of the Arenal communal bank in the Callería district within the Ucayali department.  She is 59 years old.  She is married and has 10 children, all of whom are grown up and independent.

Nara has been working with Manuela Ramos for the past 7 years.  Her first loan was for 300 soles and was used to start her business.

She sells food in the afternoons in order to help her husband with the household expenses.  She lives with her husband who works in agriculture.

She will use part of the 1200 soles loan towards her food business and put the rest towards buying 5 kg of corn seed, 2 kg of bean seed, ½ kg of tomato seed, ½ kg of regional cilantro seed, ½ kg of green bean and other seeds.

Mrs. Nara is very pleased with the loans from Manuela Ramos because with this money she has been able to work towards maintaining herself and paying the household utilities.

loans.use: To buy groceries for food preparation.  To buy seeds.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
María, tiene 28 años D. edad, resiD. en San Francisco Gotera, administra una tienda donD. ofrece artículos D. primera necesidad, ella vive junto a su esposo, y su hijo Cesar D. 4 años D. edad, su esposo trabaja en una agencia D. viajes juntos velan por el bienestar del hogar.
Este negocio fue iniciativa propia como una alternativa para tener ingresos y crecer económicamente, lo tienen en su propia casa y el horario para vender no es fijo; actualmente solicitan un préstamo para la compra D. mercadería para el negocio como arroz, azúcar, maíz, frijoles y aceite, con el dinero D. este préstamo ellos estarán adquiriendo todo lo que necesitan para ofrecer a los clientes y tener la oportunidad D. mejorar sus ingresos.
Su principal proyecto es que su negocio cuente con la mercadería que demandan los clientes, que sea prospero y que le ayuD. a cubrir las necesidades del hogar, que su hijo crezca sano con todo lo necesario para su desarrollo.
texts.en:
María is 28 years old and lives in San Francisco Gotera. She looks after a shop where she offers daily items. María lives together with her husband and her son, Cesar, 4 years old. Her husband works in a travel agency and together they watch over the wellbeing of their home.

This business was María's own initiative, begun as an alternative way of earning income and growing economically. She has the business in her own home and the hours that she sells aren't fixed. She is seeking a loan to purchase stock for the business such as rice,  sugar, maize, beans and oil. With the money from this loan María and her husband will be acquiring what they need to offer customers and have better opportunities to improve their earnings.

María's principal goal is that her business has the stock that her customers demand, that it is prosperous and that it helps her cover the household costs, that her son grows up to be healthy with everything he needs for his development.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise, namely domestic items (oil, sugar, soap)

loans.name: Akil

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 45 years old. He is married and has three children. Two of his relatives also live at his place.

In 2004, Akil decided to open his own blacksmith workshop. Now he has good experience that has made him well-known in his region. Also Akil has an excellent reputation.

He is requesting a $2400 loan to renovate his workshop and install a roll shutter for his store. He plans to expand his business in the future.

loans.use: Renovate his workshop and install a roll shutter for his store

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
It was five years ago when Elsa ventured into the fish-selling business. The idea of having this kind of business crossed her mind when her husband, who is a fisherman, had caught more fish than usual in the lake. Elsa sold those in their neighborhood and she realized that selling fish brought bigger profits faster than any other kind of business she had in recent years. 

Fish is salable because it is one of the most basic needs of human beings, especially for people who live in very remote areas of the province. They are far from the municipal markets. Thus buying from vendors who come to their community is very attractive. Also, more people choose to buy fish than meat because it is cheaper and healthier.

From then on, Elsa used her loan from ASHI in her fish-selling business. Out of the profit she made, she was able to invest in her home and support her family financially. 

She kept on borrowing from ASHI to keep her business growing. Now, she plans to use her newly received loan to increase the volume of fish she sells so that someday, out of her business profit, she will be able to invest more in her home. 

Being a 46-year-old woman, Elsa wants her children to have their own livelihood. She believes that her business is the only inheritance she can turn over to them.

loans.use: To increase the volume of fish she can sell

loans.name: Hector

texts.es: Hector de 39 años de edad es casado, tiene 19 años de trabajar para la Alcaldia de Juigalpa como operario de limpieza; esta solicitando su 4to credito con el objetivo de construir un cuarto en su casa para asi de esta manera poder brindarle  mejores condiciones de vida a su familia. Sueña con poder tener una casa con las condiciones basicas del hogar para que su familia se sienta comoda y feliz.
texts.en: Hector, 39, is married and has been working in public sanitation for the municipality of Juigalpa for 19 years.  He is requesting his 4th loan, with the objective of adding a room to his house.  In this way, he can provide better living conditions for his family.  He dreams of being able to have a house outfitted with all of the basic necessities so that his family can feel comfortable and content.

loans.use: to build a room

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia M. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 56 years old. Aurelia is married and has 6 children. To make a living, Aurelia owns & operates a furniture making business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from making & selling general household furniture like beds & cabinets to local businesses and community members. Aurelia has been engaged in her business for over 18 years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Aurelia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aurelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional materials needed and as working capital. Aurelia is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Aurelia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture

loans.name: Gisele Kayumba

texts.en:
Gisele is 38 and is married with 3 children who are aged between 5 and 11 years old. Marie has been running a store that sells wedding clothing for the past 4 years. The store is open from 8am until 6pm during the week and employs one other person.

Gisele will use her loan to purchase some more stock for her shop and also to help start a new clothing business. All her profits will go back into investing in this new business.

loans.use: To purchase more wedding clothing to sell

loans.name: Ngoeun's Group

texts.en: This group loan consists of six people based in Angkor village, Takeo province. Mrs. Ngoeun S. is a group leader who has been selected by the other members. They will each use their portion of the loan in various ways to support their families. She was born in 1983. She and her husband, Mr. Ngoem You, are farmers who own a 1.5-hectare plot of land where they grow rice to sell to support their family. He is also a construction worker. In the dry season, it is time for growing rice, so she needs some money to support this. To improve rice production, Mrs. Ngoeun S. is requesting a loan to support her farm. She is the mother of three children who are studying at the local public school.

loans.use: To support her farming activities

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” SILKINCHANY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de San Jerónimo,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Andrea; la socia tiene 37 años de edad, casada y tiene 5 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de herramientas de agricultura como pico,acha,rastrillos entre otros más para luego venderlo en la feria de todos los sábados de nombre Baratillo en este lugar se vende todo tipo de cosas de segunda mano y cosas nuevas también , hay de todo ,la socia trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo y lleva ya un buen tiempo en este negocio y se siente feliz ya que mediante este negocio ella saca a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar más mercadería para su negocio y así tener más herramientas que ofrecer.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Andrea is a member of the Communal Bank “Silkinchany” which is located in the District of San Jerónimo, Province and Department of Cusco.

She is 37 years old, married, and has five children. Andrea divides her time between her daily activites and her business of buying and selling farming tools such as picks, axes, rakes, and other implements. She sells her products at the Baratillo Fair every Saturday. In this place, all types of new and secondhand goods are sold. Andrea and her husband work together and have a good time managing their business. She is happy that her family is able to get ahead as a result of this business.

Andrea is requesting a loan to buy merchandise for her business so that she can have more tools to offer. She is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: To purchase farming tools to sell.

loans.name: Namunda

texts.en:
Namunda N. is a widow with three children, all of whom are grown. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

For the past two years, she has operated an open food market, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. 

Namunda faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the rainy cold season the availability of food for sale is high, while during the hot summer season the availability of food in the market is low. She dreams of becoming self-reliant in the future. 

With the KES 25,000 she wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, beans, rice and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of maize flour, beans, rice and cooking oil

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane F. is from the village of Dalirig, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. She is 29 years old. Mary Jane is widowed and has one child, who is still an infant. 

To make a living, Mary Jane owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for her business comes from buying and selling canned goods, snack foods, shampoo, soap and beverages. Mary Jane has been engaged in her business for over  two years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2011, Mary Jane joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Jane is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like canned goods and snack foods. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Mary Jane from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products, like canned goods and snack foods, to sell.

loans.name: Joice

texts.en: Joice is currently in the business of selling books. She is 26 years old and married with two children. One of them goes to school. Joice borrowed a loan to stock more books to sell. She hopes to expand in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more books to sell.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is a resident of Nkubu inCentral Kenya where he has been farming for five years.  He is married and has 2 children, aged 11 and 4.   His farm produces beans, maize, bananas and milk. He hires two farmhands.  Nicholas also earns additional income from his employment as a driver.  

Nicholas has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to venture into pig farming.  He says this business will help him educate his children as well as provide them with basic needs, like food. He hopes to grow his farm faster and become fully commercial.

He praises Juhudi for its agricultural loan provisions.

loans.use: to buy piglets to start a pig farm

loans.name: Lani

texts.en:
Lani, from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City, is 44 years old, married, and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Lani owns and operates a mini-restaurant serving a variety of meals including afritada, caldereta and pancit bihon in the local community. She also runs a store selling snack foods and canned goods. Engaged in her business for over six years, she earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Lani joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 17000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional ingredients and as working capital, she is requesting her sixth loan for 20000 PHP to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant. Lani plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant.

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Annabell

texts.en:
Annabell is 35 years old and married with two children.

Annabell works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Annabell has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 10 years and earns additional income from food vending.

Annabell aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Zamiri Group

texts.fr: La cliente Masika, représentante du groupe d’affaire « Zamiri » est entrepreneur, âgée de 69 ans, veuve, grand mère de plusieurs petits fils et filles.  Elle est vendeuse de poissons frais et fumés au marché central de Virunga. Environs 30 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  17 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima dans la banque communautaire. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner  avec  4 paniers de poissons et le reste d’argent  sera affecté dans les petits projets de la famille.  Elle est confortable de vivre en paix avec ses enfants et petits fils et filles. Ainsi donc, elle ambitionne  acheter une parcelle qu’elle léguera à sa descendance.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Le groupe « Zamiri » reste caractériser par le travail et le succès dans les affaires.
texts.en: Masika, representative for the business group "Zamiri" is an entrepreneur, aged 69, a widow, and a grandmother of several boys and girls.  She sells fresh and smoked fish at the central market of Virunga. She has been in this business for about 30 years. She has just finished 17 rounds of loans with the banque communautaire Hekima. This new loan will help her stock up on four baskets of fish and the rest of the money will be used for small family projects. She lives comfortably in peace with her children and grandchildren. However, she has a goal to buy a small parcel of land that she can leave to her next of kin.  She thanks Hekima for its work with poor women who are excluded from the traditional banking industry. Zamiri group remains dedicated to its work and business success.

loans.use: to buy four baskets of fish

loans.name: Alexandre

texts.pt:
Natural  de Chibuto, povincia de Gaza ao sul de Mocambique casado e pai de 4 filhos de idades entre 4 a 11 anos. Fez a 3a classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem.
Saiu de Gaza para Maputo a procura de emprego, trabalha como segurança na empresa agro-alta a mais de 1 ano e tem um salario de 6.000.00mt por mes que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos. Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem sao clientes desta instituiçao e este e os seu segundo emprestimo no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construçao (bloco, cimento, areia e outros) para a construção da sua casa. O primeiro emprestimo foi de: 10.200.00mt habitacao.
O seu sonho é ver a sua casa concluida e confortar melhor a sua familia e melhorar o seu negocio ,para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Alexandre is from Chibuto, in the province of Gaza, in southern Mozambique.  He is married and the father of 4 children, who range in age from 4 to 11.  He finished studying through the third grade and stopped due to the lack of financial resources.  He lives in his own home with his family and doesn't support anyone besides them.

He left Gaza for Maputo in search of employement.  He has worked as a security guard in the Agro-Alta company for more than a year.  He makes 6,000 meticals per month, which he puts towards his home's expenses.  He also saves some in his bank account in the BIM bank.

He has never had a loan with another bank.  He became familiar with Hluvuku through friends who are also clients of the institution.  This is his second loan in the amount of 15,000 meticals, which he will use to buy construction materials (bricks, cement, sand, etc.) to do construction on his home.  His first loan was for 10,200 meticals and also went towards his home.

His dream is to finish his house to provide better comfort to his family and to improve his business, for which he plans on requesting more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (bricks, cement, sand, etc.)

loans.name: Nanuli

texts.en: Nanuli comes from the village of Shroma, West Georgia. She is 53 years old and lives with her husband Mamia and her 30 year-old daughter. Nanuli runs the agricultural business of the family. The family has four milk cows. Nanuli produces and sells on average 70 kg cheese per month. She sells cheese at a local open market. Also the family owns 500 nut trees. Harvested nuts are sold locally as well. With the requested loan, Nanuli plans to diversify her business. In particular, she plans to purchase five bee-hives with bee-colonies. She will get approximately 40 liters of honey per year. Sale of honey will increase the family’s income. In the future Nanuli plans to reinvest the profit from bee-keeping and increase the number of bee-hives.

loans.use: to purchase five bee-hives with bee-colonies

loans.name: Arleth

texts.es: Arleth de 27 años de edad vive en el municipio de Soledad, a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Barranquilla, con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en las edades de 11 meses a 11 años de edad, allí se dedica a una actividad comercial, pues vende todo tipo  de colonias, perfumes, suéteres, bermudas y   dulces en general, actividad que complementa con la venta de minutos en su casa ubicada en el barrio villa Carmen; estas actividades   le generan un ingreso importante para apoyar el bienestar de su familia. Tiene su clientela fija  en la ciudad de Barranquilla, ellos le hacen sus pedidos telefónicamente o cuando ella realiza su preventa. Las compras las efectúa donde sus proveedores cada 8 días y cobra su cartera cada 8, 15 y 30 días máximo. Tiene 4 años de experiencia en esta actividad que inició cuando quedó desempleada, tocó muchas puertas para trabajar, pero no encontró opciones, así que decidida emprendió un negocio, con tal de sacar adelante a su familia. Inicialmente acudió a préstamos de alto costo, con personas que le ofrecieron créditos informales, aunque ganó muy poco, esta fue su primera experiencia y con ello construyó su principal clientela, pagó todo sus deudas y continuó poco a poco; su mayor desafío es no tener un capital de trabajo suficiente, para responder a los pedidos de sus clientes de manera oportuna; esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a  la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará accesorios femeninos e infantil, productos de dulcería y galletería en general , que son los productos que presentan mayor rotación en sus ventas.  Su meta es llegar a ser una profesional, pues en la actualidad estudia auxiliar de odontología y tiene el sueño de convertirse en una persona exitosa y esta es su prioridad. Sus utilidades son no menores del 50% y reinvirtiéndolas, reconoce que saldrá adelante.  Arleth  espera que la inversión en inventarios se incremente con su crédito para mantener un stock del mismo,  su negocio tiene  infraestructura física pequeña pero apropiada, sus proveedores dan buenas referencias  de Arleth por el buen manejo de sus relaciones comerciales, lo mismo que sus vecinos quienes aprecian su persistente trabajo  y esto habla muy bien de su personalidad y forma de conducirse en sus nichos de mercado como persona y como empresaria de la microempresa.
texts.en:
Arleth is 27 years old and resides in the town of Soledad, which is 15 minutes away from the city of Barranquilla. She lives with her husband and their three children who range in age from 11 months to 11 years. She has a retail business selling all types of colognes, perfumes, sweaters, Bermuda shorts, and sweets. This complements her other business of selling phone minutes from her home in the neighborhood of Villa Carmen. These activities generate vital income to support the well-being of her family. Arleth has an established customer base in the city of Barranquilla who submit their orders by telephone or whenever she comes to visit them. She buys the merchandise from her distributors every eight days and pays her bills every 8, 15, or 30 days maximum. Arleth has four years of experience in this business. She started when she became unemployed. Arleth had knocked on many doors to find work, but encountered very few options. Therefore, she decided to start a business so that she could move her family forward. Initially she accessed high-cost loans from informal moneylenders. Even though she earned very little, Arleth was able to use her first experiences to build up her main customer base. She continued to pay all of her debts and make gradual progress.

Her greatest challenge is not having enough operating capital so that she can fulfill the orders from her customers in a timely manner. For this reason, she is accessing a Kiva loan, which is her first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Arleth will use the funds to buy women’s and infants’ accessories, as well as sweets and cookies, since these products have high sales turnover. Her dream is to become a professional, since she is currently studying to become a dental assistant. Arleth’s dream is to become a successful person, so this is her main priority.

Her profits are no less than 50% and reinvested into her business so that she can continue moving forward. Arleth hopes to use her loan to invest in more inventory so that she can maintain her stock at an even level. The physical infrastructure of her business is small, but adequate. Arleth’s distributors have given her good references so that she can continue to manage her business relationships. Likewise, her neighbors appreciate the persistence in her work and speak highly of her personality and the way she conducts herself in the market as an individual and as a small entrepreneur.

loans.use: to purchase women's and infants' accessories, sweets, and cookies.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is 28 years old and she is the sole bread winner for a family of three living in Hioma, Uganda. For three years she has been selling new clothes. With the income generated she has been able to increase her stock and pay school fees for her younger sister. 

She has limited funds to meet the different tastes of her customers and her desire is to own a boutique. Justine needs a loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
Mbodze is a widowed woman with five children.  Four attend school while one has already graduated. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, she has operated a charcoal-selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. Her major dream is to expand to wholesale charcoal selling in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude is a married woman with two children, all of whom have graduated from school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, Getrude has operated a retail shop, selling items to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of theft because of lack of security in her area of operation. Her major goal is to expand her business to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan of Kshs 40,000, Getrude wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and soap detergent. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and soap detergent.

loans.name: Celfita

texts.es: Celfita tiene 45 años, es madre de tres hijos de 11, 8 y 3 años, quiene desea darles una buena educación y alimentación. Asimismo es una mujer muy trabajadora. Juntos habitan en casa de sus padres. El trabajo al que se dedica es la venta de ropa, cuya mercadería lo trae de Lima y lo lleva al mercado Bellavista, lugar donde ofrece sus productos de forma ambulante. Tiene más de tres años trabajando en este rubro y hasta el momento lo hace sola, pues al separarse de su pareja tuvo que ver la manera de poder conseguir la alimentación y cubrir los gastos educativosw de sus hijos. Le gusta de su trabajo que tiene tiempo a disposición para que ella pueda hacer algunas otras actividades, lo que no le gusta es que tiene que caminar mucho para poder vender al menos algo. Ella sabe que tiene que esforzarse mucho y como es perseverante siempre lleva algo para su hogar. Este será el segundo crédito con MFP, por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para continaur trabajando por sus hijos. Con el monto solicitado, comprará mercadería para seguir con su actividad y no dejar de vender.
texts.en: Celfita is 45 years old. She is a mother of three children, ages 11, 8 and 3, for whom she wants to provide nourishment and a good education. She is a very hard-working woman. She and her children live in her parents' home. Celfita makes a living selling clothing, which she brings in from Lima and takes to market in Bellavista to offer to customers. She has more than three years of experience in this job and has done it all by herself, since after she separated from her husband she had to find a way to be able to provide for her children and cover their education. She enjoys her work since it allows her time for some other activities. What she doesn't like is that she has to walk a lot to be able to sell at least something. Celfita knows that she has to work very hard and is always persistent to bring something home. This will be her second loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she is hoping for your support in helping her continue working for her children. With the loan, she plans to purchase merchandise to continue her work and not stop selling.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to stock her business.

loans.name: Kaay  Bakh Group

texts.fr: Le groupe "KAAY BAKH" est composé de 5 femmes mariées qui pratique toutes le commerce.Elles appuient leurs maris dans la prise en charge des besoins de leurs familles respectives notamment ceux alimentaires.Le chef de groupe est mère de quatre enfants dont deux sont à l'école élémentaires.Elles vend des denrées de consommation courantes sur une table installée devant son domicile.Elle envisage d'y implanter une cantine pour élargir son commerce aux céréales locales.Le groupe sollicite un pret de 300000F pour acheter des denrées alimentaires tels que le riz, le mil, l'arachide.
texts.en: The "KAAY BAKH" group is made up of five married women who are all sellers.  They support their husbands in meeting their families' expenses, especially food expenses.  The head of the group is a mother of four children, two of whom are in elementary school.  She sells common food staples on a table in front of her house.  She plans to build a stall there to enlarge her business to local grains.  The group is requesting a loan of 300,000F to buy food staples such as rice, millet, and peanuts.

loans.use: to buy food staples like rice, millet, and peanuts.

loans.name: Bassem

texts.en:
Bassem is from Iraq. He is 44 years old, married, and lives with three family members- one of whom works.

He has owned his food market since 1993, selling soft drinks, juices, vegetables, cheese, dairy products, and household items. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs, as he has sufficient experience in this field. His market is situated in a crowded area, so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a loan of $2,700 in order to renovate his market’s floor and walls and to add more food items. He is aiming to gain more profits which would give him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to renovate his market’s floor and walls and to add more food items

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
This is Alicia, 57 and a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is single. She enjoys working at her business, which helps to support her daily expenses and enables her to extend help to her family.

Alicia sells food. She buys raw vegetables, meats, and rice. She prepares and cooks different delicacies and sells them to her neighbors, passers-by, tricycle drivers, and other people in her local community. She also sells charcoal and delivers mineral water based on orders from her neighbors. She earns 800 PHP in daily sales.  

She is requesting a loan for 10,000 PHP that will help her to have additional capital. She will utilize the loan to buy more raw meats, vegetables, rice, and charcoal. The loan will help her to meet the demands of customers, which will help her to earn more profit.    

Alicia hopes that her business will grow and that she will earn more profits. Her goal is to help her family. She dreams of having her own bakery someday. She never fails to attend the weekly fellowship* that helps her to gain more knowledge about the goodness of God to everyone. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as raw meats, vegetables, and rice.

loans.name: Eugene

texts.en:
Eugene is 37 years old and lives in Caipilan, Siquijor, Siquijor.  He is separated from his wife. He has two children.

Eugene is engaged in growing pigs to earn a living.  He earns PHP 7,000 each  month doing this type of work. He has requested a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 to purchase feed and medicines for his piggery.

He has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for one month. Eugene would like to see his children finish their studies.

loans.use: To purchase feed and medicines for his piggery.

loans.name: Las Trabajadoras De Tierra Blanca Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama las trabajadoras D. tierra blanca, decidieron ponerle este nombre ya que se consideran unas personas muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras, la historia es acerca D. señora Alicia, cuenta con 24 años D. edad y está casada con el señor sinforiano con quien tiene  2 hijos, Antonio y marcos D. los cuales el mayor cursa cuarto año D. primaria y el menor segundo año D. preescolar, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta D. antojitos mexicanos, y tiene un caber desD. hace 5 años.

Dice que decidió iniciar con esta actividad, porque quería buscar la manera D. apoyar a su esposo con los gastos D. la casa, mejorar su calidad D. vida y tener una mejor solvencia económica, también, para asegurar el futuro D. su familia, además D. que le deja buenas ganancias, el crédito que recibió lo va usar para invertirlo en la compra D. mas insumos como son: aceite, sal, jitomates, chiles, papas, cebollas, carne, pollos, maíz, para continuar con la elaboración D. sus deliciosos antojitos mexicanos.

La meta que se ha puesto doña Alicia, es hacer crecer mucho mas su negocio, ya que quiere construir un local más granD., para acondicionar mucho más el ciber, ya que quiere comprar sillas, 3 escritorios y otras 2 computadoras, también instalarle clima y así pueda mejorar e incrementar sus ingresos.

Nos cuenta que todos sus compañeros del grupo, son personas responsables, que cumplen con sus obligaciones, les gusta mucho el trabajo, para superarse y sobresalir ante cualquier dificultad, ya que ellos se conocen D. hace tiempo dice que son personas pagadoras, no les gusta defraudar a quienes confianza en ellos.

Doña Alicia le da las gracias a nombre D. ella y su familia a FRAC y a kiva, por que gracias a ellos va a poder cambiar su vida, puesto que a hora tendrán una mejor calidad D. vida.

Otros D. los compañeros D. doña Alicia son: feliscísima, rosa, teresa, Áurea, Braulia, reyna, Rafaela y Juana quienes se dedican a diferentes actividades como: venta D. ropa, abarrotes, venta D. comida, maíz, pan, tamales, ropa y antojitos mexicanos.
texts.en:
This group is called Las Trabajadoras D. Tierra Blanca.  They decided on this name since they consider themselves to be very hardworking and enterprising people.  This is a description of Alicia, who is 24 and married to Sinforiano, with whom she has two children, Antonio and Marcos.  Of these two, the eldest is in fourth graD. and the youngest is in his second year of preschool.  She makes and sells typical Mexican snacks for a living and has had an internet café for five years now.

She says that she decided to start this business because she wanted to find a way to help her husband with household expenses, improve her quality of life, and have greater financial stability.  She also wanted to ensure her family's future, asiD. from the fact that she makes good money from her business.  She will use the loan she received to buy more ingredients, such as oil, salt, tomatoes, chilies, potatoes, onions, meat, chicken, and corn to continue making her delicious Mexican snacks.

The goal Alicia has set for herself is to make her business grow a lot.  She wants to build a bigger location to better equip her internet café by buying chairs, three desks, and two more computers, and she also wants to install air conditioning.  This will allow her to improve and increase her income.

She tells us that all of her fellow group members are responsible people who fulfill their obligations and like to work in order to better themselves and overcome any obstacle.  As they've known each other for some time, she can say that they are people who repay their debts and do not cheat people who have placed their trust in them.

Alicia thanks FRAC and Kiva on behalf of herself and her family because, thanks to them, she will be able to change her life, since they will now have a better quality of life.

Some of Alicia's fellow group members are Feliscísima, Rosa, Teresa, Áurea, Braulia, Reyna, Rafaela, and Juana, who do different things for a living, such as selling clothing, groceries, food, corn, bread, tamales, and Mexican snacks.

loans.use: to buy oil, salt, tomatoes, chilies, potatoes, onions, meat, chicken, corn, etc.

loans.name: Elena Filadelfia De La Cuz

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Inmaculada se reúne cada quince días  en La parroquia La Sequita de Montecristi (Portoviejo), cantón conocido  por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar vive la señora Elena. Tiene  61 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tuvo 6 hijos pero dos fallecieron, los 4 restantes  ya son mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Ella para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se  dedica a la cría de chanchos y pollos, ella compra tanto a los pollos como a los chanchos cuando aun están pequeños,  luego los tiene por espacio de tres a cuatro meses hasta que tengan un peso adecuado para después venderlos a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa. Lleva en esta actividad desde que se comprometió con su esposo hace más de 40 años y le ha ayudado a sacar adelante a sus hijos cuando lo necesitaron.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar alimentos y medicinas para pollos y chanchos. Ella está desde el inicio en el  Banco comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que les dan con los créditos.
  
Nuestra amiga está repitiendo el crédito y ha solicitado este crédito para comprar más alimentos para que sus animalitos estén bien grandes o gordos para las fiestas que se avecinan ya que en estos días se venden muchos de sus animalitos y a muy buen precio. Ella con lo que gano en este ciclo construyo un nuevo corral para meter más animalitos y en su casa también hizo varios arreglos en su cocina con lo cual mejoro un poco su vida por eso espera seguir adelante con los créditos para seguir mejorando su vida.

Sus sueños son seguir adelante y salud para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
The María Inmaculada Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the La Sequita de Montecristi parish. The canton is known for their famous Panama hats, which are valued inside and outside of the country.

Elena lives in this area. She is 61 years old and married. She has had six children but two of them have died. The other four are older in age and independent. Her husband works in farming. 

In order to help her husband with the household expenses, Elena raises pigs and chickens.  She purchases as many chickens as she does pigs when they are still young. She keeps them for three or four months until they are at an adequate weight to sell to vendors who come to her house. She has done this work since she started her relationship with her husband more than 40 years ago. The business has helped her children make progress when necessary. 

This loan will be used to purchase food and medicine for the chickens and pigs. She has been a part of the communal bank since its start. She likes it because of the help provided by the loans. 

Our friend, Elena, is repeating her loan and she had requested it in order to purchase more food to make the animals larger and to give them a good price. The money received in this cycle was used to construct a new farmyard for more animals. She also made various repairs in her kitchen to improve her quality of life a little. She hopes to continue to make progress with the loans in order to continue improving her life.
 
Her dreams are to move forward and to have good health for her and her family.

loans.use: purchase food and medicine for chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Anush

texts.en:
Anush lives together with her husband, daughter, mother-in-law and father-in-law.

Anush is engaged in farming. The current income Anush gets doesn't allow her to expand her farm. Thus she has applied for a loan. 

With the requested loan, Anush plans to purchase livestock. With the help of this loan, Anush will get enough income to meet the her family's needs and insure a sustainable future for them.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a 24 year old businessman who operates a video shop and also keeps livestock in the Mariakani area. He is single and has been operating these businesses for the last 4 years with great returns.

He was introduced to KADET by another client in his area of residence, and this marks his first time borrowing to finance his business. He plans to use the loan to purchase new movies, DVDs and video games for his business. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business and repay his KADET loan. 

He hopes to become a successful businessman in the future.

loans.use: To purchase new movies, DVDs and video games.

loans.name: Kurbongul

texts.ru: Курбонгул занимается посевом зерновых культур. Этим видом деятельности занимается 10 лет. Ей 41 год. Она замужем. У нее 8 детей. Она берет кредит для закупа топлива.
texts.en: Kurbongul plants cereal crops. She has been engaged in this activity for 10 years. She is 41 years old, married, and has 8 children. She is taking out a loan to purchase fuel.

loans.use: to purchase fuel

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 

Rosalinda has a food shop or "sari-sari store" that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Rosalinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Rosalinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Icyerecyezo Group

texts.en:
Olive is a group leader; aged 30 years. She is married with 2 children aged 2 and 4 years. The group is called ICYERECYEZO means “Vission” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for changing their better future. 

She sells crafts and has been running in a business for 5 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more crafts such as baskets for sale. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more crafts such as baskets for sale.

loans.name: Jlg-005-Keelanandhavanakadu Group

texts.en:
Bhuvaneshwari is 30 years old having a family size of 6. She leads a group of 4 in Kulithalai, Tamil Nadu. They come from similar backgrounds, working hard to sustain their families. Bhuvaneshwari does not have a toilet at home. Her family has no access to toilets, and therefore they have to resort to open defecation using the false privacy of nearby fields and surrounding shrubbery. This puts them at risk of infection, molestation or attack, and even insect or animal bites.

Taking matters into their own hands, Bhuvaneshwari and her group want to build toilets for themselves in their own homes. They seek a loan of Rs. 56000 to cover the cost of raw materials and labor for constructing these toilets. Your loan will help these 4 hardworking rural Indian families to access basic sanitation, and consequently, safety, improved health, medical savings, and improved productivity.

loans.use: to fund the installation of a toilet in her home

loans.name: Felista

texts.en:
Felister lives in Mbagala area of Dar es Salaam. She is married with seven children. Felister owns three retail shops selling general consumable items. She is in the process of opening the fourth shop. She had a training in entrepreneurship and small business development from YOSEFO.

She has two assistants who help with the shops and she wants to employ one more assistant. Felista is usually faced with stockouts due to inadequate working capital. The expansion will even demand more working capital. To implement her ideas she needs USD 1000.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Sevda

texts.en:
Sevda is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Kalbadjar region ,settled in  Absheron region, Masazir village.

Sevda has had her own grocery store for 4 years. Her diligent, hard work has helped her succeed in business and maintain loyal customers.

Having borrowed $400, she bought foodstuffs.
Now she needs a loan of $1000 to buy 2 refrigerators.
Her business success will allow her to help her with family expenses.

loans.use: To buy 2 refrigerators

loans.name: Kiese Akwa

texts.en: Kiese Akwa L. was born in 1960 and is the mother of six children. Kiese has been in business since 1994. She has been selling soft drinks and clothing. Due to the high demand of her clients in the community, Kiese is requesting a loan of $1000 in order to buy 100 crates of beverages and purified water and to better serve her clients by generating additional profit, which she plans to reinvest in the business. Her long-term plan is open a cement warehouse.

loans.use: To buy 100 crates of beverages and purified water for resale.

loans.name: Saadat

texts.en: Saadat V. is 26 years old and lives in Yenikand village in the Salyan region. She is divorced and doesn't have children. For three years she has been running her own orchard, and this business gives her the opportuniy to support herself. Now she needs a loan of $475 to buy pesticides to improve her orchard.

loans.use: To buy pesticides for her orchard

loans.name: Mokhbali

texts.en: Mokhbali Q. is 47-year-old farmer who lives in the small village Otuziki, in the southern part of Azerbaijan in Imishli. Mokhbali lives with his wife and three children. Mokhbala has nine years of experience in animal breeding and he has one milk cow and sells milk and yoghurt to the local and capital traders. There is a big competition in dairy products selling and he is working very hard to cover his family needs. Mokhbala is going to purchase an additional cow and a calf.  He purchased his current milk cow two years ago when he borrowed $800 USD from Aqroinvest CU. He successfully paid back his loan and now he is applying for $1000 USD for a second loan. The estimated cost for the cow is $700-800 USD and $200-300 USD for the calf.

loans.use: To purchase one milk cow and one calf

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en:
Mrs. Bridget I. is 54 years old, married with 8 children, and lives in Benin City. Being a very enterprising woman, Bridget started her own business selling provisions, drinks, yams and garri. She has been in this business since 1980 and has been a member of LAPO for 7 years.

During these years with LAPO, Bridget has been able to increase the variety of the products she offers. To keep the business growing as it has up to this point, Bridget is requesting a loan of US$ 250, which will enable her buy more of the things she sells and thus increase her turnover and her profit.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and foodstuffs

loans.name: Andrés

texts.es:
Andrés is 36 and is married to Graciela, 37, and they have two children

They have run a convenience store out of their home for the past five years, and Andrés' wife is a teacher at a school in their neighborhood.

They are hard-working and responsible people. According to their neighbors, they also help in the community.

They are requesting a loan to purchase supplies for their convenience store, such as sugar, noodles, soft drinks, snacks, milk, bread, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

El señor Andrés tiene 36 años y esta casado con la señora Graciela de 37 años, y tienen 2 hijos.

Tienen en su casa una despensa, desde hace 5 años, y su esposa es docente y enseña en la escuela de su barrio, por las mañanas y por las tardes.

Son personas muy responsables y trabajadoras, según referencias de los vecinos, ellos también realizan trabajos comunitarios y obras sociales junto con los vecinos del barrio.

Solicitan el crédito para comprar mercaderías para su despensa, tales como azúcar, fideos, gaseosas, golosinas, panificados, leche, etc.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for convenience store such as sugar, noodles, soft drinks, snacks, bread, milk, etc.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Two years ago Rosa began selling fruit she brought from San Juan de Loro city in the small neighboring towns of her city, Juliaca. This small significant business that she began with her husband Néstor’s support, is helping her family get ahead and above all is covering the education, food and healthcare needs of their four children. She is able to improve the living conditions of her home as the business is generating good income. Rosa wants to acquire a permanent and safe space inside the Fruit Section of the Túpac Amaru market in order to offer and increase the quantity of her merchandise. We support this proud mother’s efforts to offer her delicious fruit to her community.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Rosa, inició su negocio de venta de frutas hace dos años, mercadería que trae de la ciudad de San Juan de Loro, para comercializarlas en los pueblitos limítrofes de la ciudad donde vive, Juliaca; este pequeño significativo negocio que emprendió con el aporte de su esposo, Néstor, le está ayudando a salir adelante y sobre todo a cubrir las necesidades de estudios, alimentación y salud de sus cuatro hijos. Así mismo está logrando brindar mejores condiciones de vida en su hogar, ya que su negocio le va generando buenas utilidades. El deseo de doña Rosa es adquirir un espacio estable y seguro dentro del mercado Túpac Amaru - Sección frutas, para ofrecer y aumentar la cantidad de su mercadería. Posibilitemos su petición para que esta digna madre siga ofreciendo sus deliciosas frutas a su comunidad.

loans.use: Rent a regular and safe stall in the market.

loans.name: Urania Maria

texts.es:
Ms. Urania is 58 years old. She lives alone; her three children live on their own. She lives in the Villa Venezuela neighborhood, a neighborhood located in the most conflict-ridden zones of the city. Her children help Ms. Urania economically but this help is not sufficient to cover her expenses and that is why she decided to begin selling cosmetics and perfumes door-to-door.

Despite her age, Urania is a very entrepreneurial woman. Her short-term goal is to put a small store in her house that will permit her to be able to generate more necessary income without her having to go out of the house. Due to her advanced age and the neighborhood in which she lives, this is difficult for her. With this money she will buy more cosmetics and perfumes to be able to continue investing in her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Conover, Kiva.org volunteer. La Sra Urania tiene 58 años de edad, es una mujer que vive sola, sus tres hijos viven de manera independientes. Habita en el barrio Villa Venezuela un barrio ubicado en las zonas más conflictivas de la ciudad. Sus hijos ayudan economicamente a Doña Urania, pero esta ayuda es insuficiente para solventar sus gastos, es por eso que decidió empezar la venta ambulante de cosmeticos y perfumes. A pesar de su edad Urania es una mujer muy emprendedora, sus metas a corto plazo es poner poner una pequeña tienda en su casa de habitación que le permita poder generar los ingresos necsarios sin necesidad de salir de su casa, ya que por su avanzada edad y por el barrio donde habita muchas veces se le hace difícil. Con este dinero comprará más cosméticos y perfumes para seguir inviertiendo en sus ventas.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Min

texts.en:
Mrs. Min S. is a widow with four children and works as a vendor of grocery products. She usually earns $4 a day in profit.

Two of her children are garment workers, one is farmer and last one works in security. All of them normally earn around $1 to $1.50 a day.

Mrs. Min S.’s business is growing, so she wants to purchase more products to sell. She hopes to use a loan of $700 from Kiva to expand her business by purchasing more grocery products. She wants to provide her family with good living conditions.

loans.use: Hopes to use this loan to purchase more grocery products.

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
Adama is 30 years old and married with 4 children. Her husband is a teacher and is earning less than $100 a month. Adama’s business income supplements her husband's. With her previous loan, she started a small restaurant in the own of Kabala in Sierra Leone and, at the same time, she manages a small grocery kiosk in the house. Adama would like to expand her restaurant and is requesting a loan of Le.1, 000,000.

Adama works hard to manage both a restaurant and a small grocery shop. She would like a small loan to help expand her restaurant business so she can meet the demans of her hungry customers.

loans.use: To expand her restaurant.

loans.name: Noor M

texts.en: Noor M is 50 years old. He lives in District 17, Kabul, Afghanistan and is the father of 6 children. He has a metal-working business. He makes various designs from metal and sells them at the bazaar. He has requested an individual loan from AFSG  to complete his stock and  move ahead in his business in future.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Elias

texts.es:
Elias has been laboring in the production of bread for 11 years, but he had to leave that occupation. Currently, he distributes bread wholesale and sells provisions in his small grocery store.

For the past year, he has been purchasing packaged bread from third parties and wakes up at 3 am to distribute it throughout the zones near his neighborhood.

The loans he has previously received have been used to purchase more products for his grocery store. Elías would like to leave the distributing of bread to open a button factory because his brother has told him that it is a good business, however, he needs capital to acquire the machinery.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Elías se ha dedicado a la producción de pan por 11 años. Pero, tuvo que dejar esta labor y, actualmente, se dedica al reparto de pan al por mayor, y a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su bodega.

Desde hace 1 año, él compra pan embolsado a terceras personas y se levanta a las 3 de la mañana a repartirlo por zonas aledañas a su barrio.
