Los préstamos que ha pedido le han servido para comprar más productos para su bodega. Elías quisiera dejar el reparto de pan y montar una fábrica de botones, porque su hermano le ha contado que es buen negocio. Sin embargo, él necesita de capital para poder adquirir las máquinas.

loans.use: Purchase products for his grocery store.

loans.name: Tak

texts.en:
Mrs. Tak Savoeun, 56, is a farmer in the Prey Vang province of Cambodia. She lives with her husband who is also a farmer, and five of their six children. Two of their children are garment workers and the rest are students who help their parents with the farm work.

Mrs. Savoeun is now seeking to enhance and grow her family’s farming business. She is requesting a loan for $1,200 in order to purchase two cows, fertilizer, and rice seeds. With these purchases, she believes her farm can grow and be more efficient and productive.

loans.use: To purchase two cows, fertilizer, and rice seeds

loans.name: Unida Para Seguir Group

texts.en:
Eloise M. is a married mother of three children, ages 10, 12, and 17, who wishes to see her children advance in their studies. She has a salon/barbershop that she has been operating for about 5 years now, 3 of the most recent years being with help from loans. When she is not busy with her business, she enjoys reading a variety of genres and watching television. Mrs. M. hopes to grow her business and continue earning income so that she can pay for the education of her children.

Mrs. M. is a member of a 5 person group, Group 2, which part of a larger micro-bank is called Unida Para Seguir, United to Continue in English. In the picture, Mrs. M. is in the center in the center along with the other four members of her group. Her story is just one of a list of men and women who are improving their quality of life through the help of micro-credit loans of Esperanza. Together, this group has united with a common vision of a better life with faith and hope in their hearts and an unbreakable spirit. The concept of group lending is to have loans paid in a group to reduce the risk of a person defaulting, as others pick up where a person may lag to receive the next loan. Each of the associates in this bank has a similar business whether it is a salon service or selling clothing. Thank you for your support and awareness of this issue, and it is your concern and efforts that is able to bring a difference to the lives of people such as Mrs. M..

loans.use: The women of this group would like to improve their businesses, like Eloise, who would like to improve her salon.

loans.name: Marciana

texts.es:
Ms. Marciana Bogarin is 45 years old and is married to Mr. Jose Quiñonez, 44 years old. The have two children who are in high school students.

Ms. Marciana Bogarin approximately opened her store in 1995 with a small amount of money that her husband acquired through the sale of some agro-products. She currently has a store in her home, as well as a cafeteria, which she also runs. She has already gained a client base due to the good service she offers, while her cafeteria operates in a school in the area.

This loan application is submitted for the purchase of supplies such as, sugar, rice, vermicelli, meat, dairy precuts, soft drinks, and snacks for the school cafeteria.

She believes that change comes from within, and we must take care because our children will act according on the education we give them.

Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juárez, Kiva volunteer.

El Sra. Marciana Bogarin de 45 años, esta casada con el Sr. José Quiñonez de 44 años, ellos tienen dos hijos, que estan cursando sus estudios secundarios.

Doña Marciana Bogarin emprendió su despensa aproximadamente en el año 1.995, con un pequeño dinero que su esposo adquirió con la venta de algunos productos del agro. Actualmente tiene una despensa en su casa y además una cantina administrada por ella misma. En su despensa ya tiene su clientela formada gracias a la buena atención que ofrece, mientra que su cantina funciona en una escuela de la zona.

La solicitud de crédito es para comprar más mercaderías como: azúcar, arroz, fideos, carnes, lácteos, gaseosas y golosinas en general para su cantina que funciona en una escuela.

Cree que de nosotros mismo tiene que partir el cambio, atendamos por que depende de la enseñanza que nosotros le demos a nuestros hijos ellos estarán actuando.

loans.use: to buy supplies like: sugar, rice, noodles, meat, dairy products, soft drinks and snacks.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica A. sells used clothing at Bantama in Elmina. Veronica has received no formal education. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a security guard. Veronica has been selling used clothing since 2003. She is responsible for feeding the family and utility bills. Her loan will be used to add to her capital to buy more goods for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest to increase sales, which will eventually increase her income.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to add to her capital to buy more goods for sale.

loans.name: Zenovia

texts.es:
Zenovia tiene 42 años de edad, estudió primaria completa, es casada y madre de 1 hija de 22 años de edad. Vive en el Centro Poblado de Chatuma, sector Bellavista, distrito de Pomata, provincia de Chuchito, Puno.

Zenovia es una de las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal “Buenavista” en Chacachaca. Con su crédito inicial de S/.300 compró 3 llicllas a S/.240.00 (tejido artesanalmente). A los 18 años de edad tuvo su pareja y desde los 20 años hasta la fecha tiene el negocio de llicllas, compra en las ferias de Yunguyo, Puno e Ilave y comercializa semanalmente en las ferias de Juliaca, Cuzco y Arequipa.

Con este crédito de S/.1,800, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, tiene presupuestado comprar 10 llicllas a S/.80 y S/.100.00 cada uno. Con el resto del capital comprará chuspas e istallas.

Su meta es comprar su casa en la ciudad de Puno, seguir con su negocio y que su hija estudie.
texts.en:
Zenovia is 42 years old, an elementary school graduate, married, and a mother of 1 daughter of 22 years. She lives in downtown Chatuma, Sector Bellavista, District Pomata, Province Chuchito, Puno. Zenovia is one of the founding members of the community bank “Buenavista” in Chacachaca. With an initial loan of S/.300, she bought llicllas (handmade fabric) at S/.240. At 18 years old, she got married. Since she was 20 years old, she has had her business of llicllas that she buys in the street markets of Yunguyo, Puno, and her town’s central market. She sells them weekly at the street markets in Juliaca, Cuzco, and Arequipa. With this loan of S./1,800, to be paid in 3 payments, she will buy 10 llicllas (handmade fabric) at S/.80 and S/.100 each. With the remainder of the money, she will buy pencil cases and accessories. Her goal is to buy a house in Puno and continue her business so that her daughter can go to school.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise (handmade fabric, pencil cases, and accessories)

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith N. sells bread that she bakes herself. She also sells gari and groundnuts. Edith is a single parent with three children. She received no formal education. She is solely responsible for caring for her children and paying for utility bills.

Edith has been in her business since 2002. Her loan will be used to buy flour and other ingredients for the baking of the bread and also to increase her inventory of gari and groundnuts. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards a house that she wants to build for her family.

loans.use: To buy flour and other baking ingredients and increase her inventory of gari and groundnuts.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es:
La señora Nieves es socia del Banco Comunal “Espíritu Santo” del Centro Poblado de Chimbo, distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno. Tiene 40 años de edad, es casada y madre de 4 hijos que aún mantiene.

Con el primer préstamo de S/. 500 aumentó su capital y compró tela para confeccionar casacas. Tiene casi 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal. Nos cuenta que no terminó sus estudios secundarios porque no tenia medios económicos y tuvo que trabajar para ayudar a su familia.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,800, el cual será cancelado en 5 cuotas, comprará 2 rollos de telas para vender en Lima.

Nieves desea continuar trabajando para que sus hijos terminen de estudiar y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Nieves is a member of the “Espíritu Santo” (“Holy Spirit”) Community Bank, located in the village of Chimbo in the Yunguyo region of Puno. She is 40 years old, married, and the mother of four dependent children. She did not finish secondary school because she had to work to help support her family. She has worked with the bank for two years. She invested her first loan of 500 Peruvian nuevos soles (approximately US $165) in the purchase of fabric to make jackets. With this loan of 1,800 nuevos soles (US $600), to be repaid in five installments, she will buy two bolts of fabric to sell in Lima. Nieves wants to continue working to ensure that her children complete their studies and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bolts of fabric

loans.name: Oreni

texts.en: Oreni A. is 28 years old, and married with three children. She makes pancakes and sells them to people in the village five days a week. She is a new member of SPBD. Oreni expects her weekly net cash flow to be 60 Tala (~$20USD). SPBD loans are Oreni’s only access to capital because she was unable to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use the loan of $275 to establish her business.

loans.use: To establish her bakery business

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es socia del Banco Comunal Ollantay.
Margarita es conviviente, tiene 38 años y 4 hijos, Margarita vende frutas en la puerta de su casa. Además margarita junto a su esposo tienen una pequeña ferretería, sus ventas son también a domicilio. Margarita los días sábados y domingos trabaja haciendo limpieza en un hospedaje.
Margarita necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de fierros.
Los sueños de Margarita son educar a sus hijos, brindarle todo lo mejor a sus hijos y aumentar su negocio.
texts.en:
Margarita is a partner of Banco Comunal Ollantay (Ollantay Communal Bank). Margarita is 38 years old and has four children. She sells fruit outside her house and owns a small home-delivery hardware store with her husband. Margarita cleans a home on Saturday and Sunday. She needs a 1050 sol loan to invest in the purchase of tools for her store. Her dreams are to educate her children and provide them the best while growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jonathan Bradshaw, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tools

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam D. is married and has one child. She has received schooling through junior high level. Mariam is a hairdresser who owns a beauty salon at Abura, which she has done for about 5 years. Her husband is a commercial driver.

Mariam uses her income to help her husband pay rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family. Mariam will use the loan to purchase different varieties of hair products to meet the demand of her customers who come to the salon. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mariam plans to reinvest for the expansion of her little salon.

loans.use: purchase different varieties of hair products

loans.name: Marifat

texts.en:
P. Marifat lives in the B.Gafurov region. She is married with four children. Marifat has been engaged in the livestock business for 30 years, so she is experienced in the business and has the appropriate knowledge that she uses in practice.

Marifat takes care of one milk cow, one bull and four rams. She also makes milk products that she sells in a local bazaar. Marifat wants to open a specialized trade outlet for selling self-made milk-sour products. Marifat applies to Kiva with the request of a business-support loan of 1400 STJ for six months to purchase the specialized milk-making equipment that permits her to use modern technologies to speed up the existing milk-making process.

loans.use: Purchasing specialized milk-making equipment

loans.name: Yao

texts.fr: Monsieur A. yao est un résident du quartier d’agoè dalimé, il est marié et a 02 enfants. Il est un topographe dessinateur de métier, mais ne trouvant pas assez de marché, il s’est lancé  l’an dernier dans le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale, il a ouvert à cet effet une boutique qu’il a appelé « la GRACE », sa clientèle est de jour en jour grandissante pour, répondre convenablement à la demande de sa clientèle il veut agrandir sa boutique par l’achat de 20 boîtes de Tomates , 10 cartons de riz , 05 cartons de pâtes, des cartons de savons et de détergents , 10cartons d’eau minérale.
texts.en:
Mr. Yao A. is a resident of the Agoè Dalimé neighborhood. He is married and has 2 children. He is a draftsman-topographer by trade but since he has not been able to find enough of a market for his specialty, he began to sell groceries last year. He opened a little shop that he calls « la GRACE ». His clientele is growing day by day, and to respond to their demand, he wants to expand his inventory by buying 20 tins of tomatoes, 10 cases of rice, 5 cases of pasta, cases of soap and detergent, and 10 cases of mineral water.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of grocery staples for re-sale

loans.name: Hadjah Muwanga‘S Group

texts.en:
Hadjah is 45 years of age, married, and has two children aged 10 and 27 years. She owns a four-roomed house where she is staying with twelve people and doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She has access to electricity and piped water at home. The family gets three meals a day.

Hadjah sells charcoal in Bwaise and doesn’t incur any extra transport cost as she buys from her place of work and that is how she earns her living. Her monthly expenses include licence and school fees for her children. Hadjah sells to all categories of people and works six days week. She has done this business for four months now and before joining the charcoal business she used to fry eatables.

This is her tenth loan since she joined MCDT five years ago, working with the same group-mates. Hadjah wants to use this loan to buy more charcoal for resale. She would like to see her business grow bigger and wants to own permanent business premises.

loans.use: To buy charcoal for resale

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
JUANA A. L., pertenece al Banco Comunal “DAMAS DEL ORIENTE” su negocio está ubicado en el Mercado N° 2 Distrito de Calleria, tiene 59 años y 3 hijos mayores de edad.
Su esposo es coadministrador del negocio (venta de prendas de vestir).

	El primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, que invirtió en compra de ropas para Damas y niños, desde hace 7 años que está trabajando con Manuela Ramos.
Su negocio ha ido creciendo cada vez y por eso le ha sido necesario subir el monto de sus préstamos.

Con el préstamo  de S/.1,400.00 Nuevos Soles,  comprará 1 docena de blusas, 2 docenas de polos para niños y niñas y 1 docenas de pantalones para damas. 

“Si no fuese por Manuela Ramos, no tendría el negocio ni tampoco a mi familia unida porque gracias a la oportunidad que me dieron, pude educar a mis hijos”.
texts.en:
Juana A. L. belongs to the Communal Bank “Ladies of the East”. Her business is located in the District of Calleria. She is 59 years old, and has 3 older children. Her husband is the co-administrator of the business (sale of clothing). The first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos was of 300 PEN, which she invested in the purchase of clothing for women and children; she has been working with Manuela Ramos for the past 7 years. Her business has been growing as time has passed, and because of that she has found it necessary to increase the loan amounts. With the loan of 1,400 PEN, she will purchase 1 dozen blouses, 2 dozen children’s polo shirts, and 1 dozen women’s pants. “If it had not been for Manuela Ramos, I would not have this business nor would my family be united because thanks to the opportunity that I was given, I can educate my children.”

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase blouses, polo shirts for children, and pants.

loans.name: Marciano

texts.es:
El Sr. Marciano L. tiene 43 años. El es padre soltero y tiene una hija mayor de edad casada.

El Sr. L. se dedica a la compra y venta de mercaderias en general y a la cobranza en forma semanal, quincenal y mensual.  Hace 2 años en forma independiente antes trabajaba como cobrador de una casa comercial que luego salio para independisarse y formar su propio negocio.

Actualmente esta actividad lo realiza en forma personal pero su objetivo mas adelante es el de tener mas vendedores y asi poder agrandar su zona de trabajo y llegar a tener mayor ingreso.

El credito será  destinado a la compra de mercaderias.
texts.en:
Marciano L. is 43 years old. He is a single father and has one adult daughter who is married. Mr. L. is involved in the purchase and sale of general merchandise and he allows repayments from his clients on a weekly, biweekly and monthly basis. For the past 2 years he has worked selling general merchandise, prior to that he worked in a commercial concern before setting out on his own and forming his own business. Currently this activity is done in person, but his goal is to have more vendors and thus enlarge his territory and generate higher income. The credit will be used to purchase goods.

Translated from Spanish by Tim Hassett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy jeans, quilts, sheets, towels, tablecloths, etc. ..

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida E. is from the village of Bay-bay, Balatacan, Tangub city. She is 43 years old and is married. Aida operates a family member's business venture in the food sector selling fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Aida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and to supplement the needs of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Saribel

texts.es: Saribel es casada,  vive en la comarca la  Ceiba a 9 km  de Nueva Guinea, trabaja como docente de esa comarca en la Escuela Manteles Verdes desde hace 10 años, tiene una niña de 9 años estudiando primaria, está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 8vo crédito con AFODENIC, ya obtuvo un credito con el financiamiento de KIVA para invertirlo en simpre en mejora de su vivienda construyendo satisfactoriamente una habitacion, ahora solicita un nuevo credito para continuar con las mejoras  cambiando el zinc a la cocina que esta en mal estado, su esposo trabaja como agricultor y la apoya con los gastos, todos los dias se levantan a las cuatro de la mañana para hacer los quehaceres del hogar, en la finca donde viven siembran diversos cultivos como yuca , quequisque, piña, sandias,  los cuales comercializar en la zona urbana de Nueva Guinea,  Saribel es una mujer que trabaja de la mano con su marido para asi mejor sus condiciones de vida,   su sueño  es  terminar de estudiar la carrera en ciencias de la Educacion, salud  y estabilidad laboral.
texts.en:
Saribel is married, lives in the La Ceiba district 9 km from Nueva Guinea, and has a 9 year old daughter in elementary school. She has been a teacher for 10 years in the Manteles Verdes school district.

She is requesting her 8th AFODENIC loan, which will be funded through KIVA, to continue improvements on her structurally-sound one bedroom house. She will be changing the zinc in her kitchen, which is in poor condition.

Her husband is a farmer and helps with the household expenses. He wakes up at 4am every morning to begin his work. He raises crops -- such as cassava, taro root, pineapple, and watermelon –- and sells them in the urban markets of Nueva Guinea. Saribel works closely with her husband to improve their living conditions. Her dream is to finish her studies in educational sciences, enjoy good health, and have a stable job.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replace the kitchen ceiling

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza E. is from the village of Anito, Mambajao Camiguin. Liza is married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Liza is starting a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Liza is just starting this business.

In July 2009, Liza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Liza is requesting a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Liza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Willy

texts.es:
Willy vive en casa propia en la zona de Villa Alemania de la Ciudad de El Alto; es soltero, tiene dos hermanos menores que dependen de él ya que sus padres no se encuentran con ellos, trabaja como electricista y es chofer propietario. Estas son sus principales fuentes de ingreso.

El crédito lo destinará para compra de material eléctrico para su negocio de electricista  y también para el costo de  cambio a gas natural de su movilidad la cual le ayudara con sus ingresos.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por el cliente.
texts.en:
Willy lives in his own home in the Villa Alemania zone of the City of El Alto. He is single and has two small brothers that depend on him, since his parents are no longer with them. He works as a electrician and as a private chauffeur. These are his main sources of income. The loan will be used to purchase of electric components for his electrician business and also for to cover the cost of changing his vehicle to natural gas, which helps him with his income. This is his first credit with Impro. The evaluation carried out qualifies him for the approval of the loan requested by the client.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy electrical components for his electrican business and also cover the cost of converting his vehicle to natural gas

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a thirty five year old father of four school going children who runs a carpentry business in Nairobi. He has requested for a first loan of Ksh. 20,000 in order to add stock of timber. Joseph has been in carpentry business for the last four years. Joseph hopes that one day he will own another carpentry workshop in Nairobi,  ensure that his 4 children get educated to the highest level and become economically independent. He describes himself as hardworking, polite and genuine.


About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add stock of timber

loans.name: Eucharia

texts.en: Eucharia bakes and also sells baking materials like baking powder, sugar, flour, etc. She hopes for the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more baking materials to sell. Eucharia is 35 years old and married with four children.  She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more baking materials to sell

loans.name: Moun

texts.en: Moun T., 52, is married and resides with four of her children in the Battambang province. Since 2000, she and her husband have been making and selling rice noodle to earn approximately US$5 of profit every day. Three of the children are employed with different jobs. Moun T. is asking a loan of US$1200 to purchase more rice, wood and ingredients to make rice noodle to sell.

loans.use: To buy rice, wood and ingredients to make noodle.

loans.name: Maria Sofia

texts.pt:
Maria V. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, capital do país, tem 54 anos de idade casada e mãe de 3 filhos de 30, 32, e 34 anos de idade. Vive na casa própria com o marido e a sua neta, porque os filhos já são maiores de idade e tem residências próprias. Fez o nível médio trabalha como funcionário da Educação, o seu marido tem um negocio próprio e ajuda no sustento da família.

Nunca mudou de cidade e trabalha como professora a mais de 25 anos, formou se no Instituto de Magistério Primaria da Matola. Tem um rendimento mensal de 6.200.00mt com o qual sustenta apenas a sua família e ainda consegue poupar algum no final de mês através de sistema tradicional de poupança (Xitique).

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de conversas com as senhoras de mercado SANTOS e acompanharam ate a sucursal da Catembe. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.500.00mt com o qual pretende comprar cimento, areia e ferro. O empréstimo anterior também do mesmo valor e finalidade.

Tem como objectivos melhorar as condições da sua residência. No futuro pretender levantar mais empréstimos para concluir a sua residência e construir uma capoera para criacao de frangos de corte.
texts.en:
Maria V. was born in the city of Maputo, the country's capital, she is 54 years old and has 3 sons who are 30, 32 and 34 years old. She lives in her own house with her husband and her granddaughter, because her sons are older now and have their own houses. She finished middle school and works in Education, her husband has a business and helps supporting the family. She never moved to another city and has been working as a teacher for the last 25 years, he studied at the Primary Magistrate of Matola. She earns 6,200MT monthly which is used to support her family and is able to save some money at the end of the month thru the traditional saving system (Xitique). She never requested a credit before from other banks, she learned about Hluvuku thru conversations with ladies at the market of Santos who accompanied her to the branch in Catembe. This is her 2nd loan with Hluvuku for 10,500MT which will be used to buy cement, sand and iron. The previous loan was for the same amount and for the same reason. Her goal is to improve the conditions of her residence. In the future she expects to request more loans to finish building her house and a fence to raise chicken.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials (cement, iron, sand and others)

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en: Tamara S. lives in Sevan with her son, daughter-in-law and granddaughter. Tamara has been working in a laundry about 16 years. Three years ago, she opened her own food shop. Now, Tamara wants to sell household goods in her shop, so she is asking for $1.200 loan. With the future income from her loan, she intends to install a heating system in her house.

loans.use: To sell household goods in her shop

loans.name: Narcissa

texts.en:
Narcissa T. is from the village of D'Ban, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old, is married, and has five school-aged children. Narcissa owns and operates a business providing recycling services, selling scrap metal and other used products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Narcissa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Narcissa is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital to purchase scrap metal for sale. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase scrap metal to sell

loans.name: Maria Mairena

texts.es:
María Mairena tiene 26 años se divorció del padre de sus dos hijos hace algún tiempo, vive con ellos y con su madre  que enfermó  y  la dejó  en silla de ruedas,  en el centro de la urbe mantense donde ha podido sobresalir a pesar de los múltiples inconvenientes, debido a su situación tuvo que dejar de estudiar para dedicarse a trabajar  en horarios de la tarde y noche porque en la mañana se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, al cuidado de sus niños y de su madre; una prima le ayuda con el cuidado de los niños cuando ella sale a trabajar.

María Mairena asistió a las reuniones del Banco comunal incentivada por su cuñada, le gusto mucho los beneficios otorgados por la Fundación y desde ese momento formó parte del mismo,  ella  se dedica a la  venta puerta puerta  en su localidad ofreciendo  ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, ropa de cama, etc.,  inició su  negocio con el primer crédito de  trescientos dólares obtenidos de la fundación, para abastecerse de  mercadería ella viaja cada mes a Guayaquil y trae un aproximado de 900 dólares en cada compra,  manifiesta que tiene ya sus clientes fijos.

Con el préstamo solicitado va a comprar  más mercadería como pantalones, camisetas, blusas, calcetines, interiores, ropa de cama, etc.  para damas, caballeros y niños para incrementar su negocio y contar con un stock surtido para sus clientes para la época navideña.
texts.en:
María Mairena, 26, has been divorced for some time now. She lives in dowtown Manta with her two children and her mother, who is confined to a wheel-chair due to illness. She has managed to get ahead little by little despite many difficulties. Because of her situation, she had to leave school and go to work during afternoons and evenings because during the morning she has to do her domestic chores, take care of her children and her mother. A cousin babysits for her when she goes to work. Her sister-in-law motivated María Mairena to attend communal bank meetings and she liked the benefits the Foundation offered very much. So, from that moment, she became a member. She sells clothing door-to-door. She began her business with help from her first, 300 dollar, loan from the foundation, which she used to buy stock inventory. She travels to the city of Guayaquil each month to get her merchandise and brings back about 900 dollars worth each time; she tell us that she has regular customers. With the requested funds she wants to buy merchandise like pants, t-shirts, blouses, socks, underwear, bed linens, etc. for women, men and children to increase her inventory and have varied stock available for her clients during the Christmas season.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pants, blouses, shirts, socks, underwear, bed linens, etc. for women, men and children.

loans.name: Gulrukhsor

texts.en:
Gulrukhsor U. is 33 years old. She is married with four children.  Gulrukhsor sells jewelry and has been in business for more than three years. Today she requests $1000 loan to purchase new items like earrings, rings, bracelets, and chains to increase the variety of goods she sells. This is the fifth loan for Gulrukhsor and she promises to observe all procedures concerning the payment of the loan, as she has with her previous loans. 
------------------------------------------------------------------
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing the new jewelry items to sell.

loans.name: Raquel Marie

texts.es: La profesora Raquel trabaja en la Universidad Nacional de Nicaragua (UNAN) desde hace 11 años, tiene 2 hijos, Raisa de 20 y el varon de 23 años, ambos trabajan y estudian la universidad, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que trabaja en la Policica Nacional y asume los gastos del hogar; esta solicitando su 6to credito para seguir mejorando su casa, y espera seguir siendo beneficiada con KIVA, pues el credito anterior fue financiado por este fondo con el cual logro ponerle la ceramica a su casa y ahora desea pintarla para que se mire mas bonita. La profesora Raquel manifiesta que se siente muy agradecida con AFODENIC ya que gracias a los creditos que le ha concedido ha logrado acondicionar su casa poco a poco, el mayor sueño de Raquel es lograr tener todas las condiciones en su casa ara que su familia disfrute de un ambiente agradable.
texts.en:
Professor Raquel has worked in the National University of Nicaragua (UNAN) for 11 years. She has two children, Raisa, 20 and the son, 23. They both work and attend university. She counts on the support of her husband who works for the National Police and takes on the household expenses. She is requesting her sixth loan to continue improving her house and she hopes to continue to benefit from KIVA. The last loan was financed by this fund to lay tile in the house and now she wants to paint it so that it looks prettier. Professor Raquel expresses that she feels very thankful for AFODENIC. Thanks to the loans, she has been awarded, she has been able to renovate her house little by little. Raquel’s big dream is to be able to have all the comforts in her home, so that her family can enjoy it in a pleasant atmosphere.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to paint the house

loans.name: Fortunato

texts.es:
Fortunato es socio del Banco Comunal Fe.
Fortunato es casado, tiene 55 años y 6 hijos, Fortunato tiene una peluquería en su casa, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además Fortunato junto a su esposa se dedican a la medicina natural.
Fortunato necesita un préstamo de 1650 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de hierbas.
Los sueños de Fortunato son terminar de construir su casa y comprar un carro para que trabaje su hijo.
texts.en:
Fortunato is a member of the communal bank "Fe" (Fe.) He is married, 55 years old and has 6 children. Fortunato has a hair-dressing salon in his home, and he carries out this activity every day. In addition, Fortunato, along with his wife, has a natural medicine business. Fortunato needs a loan of 1,650 Peruvian soles that he will invest in the purchase of herbs. Fortunato dreams of finishing the construction on his house and buying a car so that his son can work.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy herbs

loans.name: Chrorn

texts.en: Mrs. Chrorn P. is a villager in Cheav Bdei Khang Kaeut village in Takeo province. She is 59 years old. She is a vegetable seller in the local village and her husband, Mr. Be Kry, is a farmer who owns three hectares of land used to grow rice to support their family. This family has a problem because their rice field is far from the irrigation system. Thus, Mrs. Chrorn P. decided to ask for a loan to dig a well and buy a machine to support their rice field. This couple has three children, two of whom are farmers and one is a laborer in the local village.

loans.use: To dig a well

loans.name: Isi

texts.en: Isi has a good relationship with LAPO. She is 58 years old and married with five children. Her children attend school and they are excelling in school. Her husband is an electrician and he also supports their home. She sells groceries and foodstuffs at retail prices to her customers. she is requesting a loan of NGN 150,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and groceries.She hopes to own a super market in the future. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Khudakerim

texts.en:
Khudakerim R. is a 39 year-old married man with four children. Khudakerim is a hardworking man who started his own business as a source of  income and for savings in case of unemployment. He knew many people who purchased sheep and this motivated him to start his own business more than 15 years ago.

Over time he has increased his sheep sales and he is proud to say that the business has been running well. Now Khudakerim needs additional capital to expand and is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,600 AZN to purchase additional sheep to sell. More specifically, he will reinvest the loan proceeds and grow the business, as he has been doing.

Khudakerim and his family thank you very much for the support that you offer them in helping to expand his business and give their children a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase 15 sheep and feed

loans.name: Wokulira Development Group, Mukono

texts.en:
N. Annet, shown at the top left as well as in the group photo, is a very hardworking lady with a restaurant business. She is a single mother of three children who are all in school and this is the best reason why she works so hard.

Annet prepares breakfast, lunch and supper for her customers in Nabuti. She is able to make 75,000/= as weekly income and she says that this would be more except that at times the food prices are hiked due to external factors.

Annet needs to expand her business further by being able to prepare a variety of foodstuffs as well as building a comfortable home. She needs a loan to be able to buy more foodstuffs for her restaurant.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for her restaurant

loans.name: Kaycee

texts.en:
Kaycee is 40 years old, married, and has two children. Her husband is a fashion designer and they live in Lagos.
Kaycee sells baby items, such as baby seats, strollers and more, in her shop. She has been in business for the past three years and now wants to open another shop where she can sell the same goods in order to increase productivity and profitability. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more baby items to sell. Kaycee thanks all Kiva lenders for this great opportunity.

loans.use: To purchase more baby items to sell

loans.name: Tin

texts.en:
Mrs. Tin A. is 36 years old and hA. been a merchandise trader in the busy local market for more than three years. She sells items such A. cooking supplies and some groceries, earning US$ 7 each day. She wA. married but divorced her husband some years ago. She hA. a young school-aged child, who is dependent on her income. 

Tin A. is very busy at her business activity A. there are many customers who need to buy her wares. By increasing her clientele, she hA. also not enough merchandise to satisfy the needs of her customers. So she hopes to improve her business and is asking for a loan from Kiva’s project partner, HKL, in the amount of US$ 700, to be used to grow her working capital.

loans.use: To grow her working capital

loans.name: Tekero Ole

texts.en:
Tekero Ole N. is 42 years old. He is married to Leah Nkowua and he is the father of seven children. Tekero is a farmer and he has been farming his own land for the last twenty years.
  
He learned about KADET from a colleague who is already a KADET registered client. This will be his third loan. He is planning to plant more potatoes which have proven to do very well in this area. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to re-invest in the farm and plant more acres of potatoes and start wheat farming.

His hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer both in potatoes and wheat farming.

loans.use: To plant potatoes on a bigger piece of land

loans.name: Hortense

texts.fr: Née en 1979 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, L. Hortense est mariée à YONLI Moussa et est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Hortense vit depuis sept ans au quartier Gankpodo à Cotonou, avec son mari et ses enfants. Hortense vient en aide à son mari en assurant avec lui les charges de la famille. Hortense n'a jamais été à l'école. Pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales et satisfaire ses besoins, Hortense vend des bois de chauffage à son domicile. Hortense s'approvisionne à Pahou au Bénin. Hortense mène cette activité depuis six ans et a déjà bénéficié de quatre prêts qu'elle a bien remboursés à ALIDé. Face à la demande nombreuse de sa clientèle, Hortense  désire renforcer davantage son activité et se faire plus de revenu pour mieux assurer les besoins de ses enfants. C'est ce qui l'amène à solliciter un autre crédit.
texts.en:
Hortense L. was born in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, in 1979. She's married to Moussa YONLI and the mother of two school-attending children. For seven years, she's been living with her husband and children in the Gankpodo neighborhood in Cotonou. Hortense helps her husband and provides for the family expenses with him. She never attended school. To contribute to the family expenses and provide for herself, Hortense sells firewood at her house. She gets her supplies in Pahou, Benin. She's been running this business for six years, and already benefited from four loans that were repaid without problems to Kiva's partner, ALIDé. To meet customer demand, she would like to bolster her business and increase her income to better provide for her children. This is the reason why she's seeking another loan.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood wholesale

loans.name: Yes Yes Group

texts.en: Nancy J., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Yes Yes. She is 30 years old, single and has two children, 7 and 13 years old. She was only able to attend school through 9th grade due to poverty. All of her children are in school. For 5 years, she has been selling crushed rocks at the S.K.D Boulevard on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy shovels and hammers for rock crushing. Her dream is to leave rock crushing and move to a more lucrative venture.

loans.use: To buy shovels and hammers for rock crushing.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia F. is from the village of Dalipuga, Iligan City. She is 57 years old, married, and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Alicia owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty food products in the local community. Alicia has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Alicia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alicia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Alicia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy raw materials (corn, firewood, mineral lime)

loans.name: Ren

texts.en: Mrs. Ren T. was born in 1982 and lives in Srae Vong village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. She also sells Khmer cakes door to door. Her husband, Mr. Phoeurn Yorn, is a construction worker. Mrs. Ren T.'s problem is that she does not enough oxen to plow her field. To solve this problem, Mrs. Ren T. is seeking a loan to buy two oxen to plow the land. She is a mother of a child who is too small to work or study. Her husband is shown in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy two oxen to plow her field

loans.name: Sonnie United Group

texts.en:
Kebbeh B., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Sonnie United. She is 28 years old, married, and has three children who range from 6 to 11 years old. She was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to poverty. She cares for one sibling.

For seven years, she has been selling red oil in Redlight Market, Paynesville, outside of Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 6,000 LRD portion of this 30,000 LRD group loan to buy more gallons of red oil. She describes herself as a principle-minded woman.

Her goal is to expand her business and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more gallons of red oil.

loans.name: Jiparbubu

texts.en:
Jiparbubu K. is 48 years old and has three children, the youngest of whom is 5 years old.  Her husband works for the Water Association, which provides irrigation to local farmers.   After graduating from Trade College, Jiparbubu worked in the trade sector for many years. She is known as a very optimistic and hard-working person. 
  
Since her family has limited resources, Jiparbubu decided to start her own business in cattle-breeding.  She bought a horse and one milch cow, whose milk she sold to the dairy factory. Also, Jiparbubu engaged in cultivating apples and kidney beans.  She purchased and planted seeds and worked hard to get a good harvest.  All these activities allowed Jiparbubu to broaden her farm with more cattle and grow a small-scale apple garden. 

Jiparbubu will use her loan of 50,000 KGS to buy one milch cow and mineral fertilizers to fertilize the land with apple gardens. Using the revenue, she would like to acquire a drying machine to process her apples and those of other farmers. Jiparbubu believes that the loan will help her achieve new levels in her activities.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population.  Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine A. is from the village of Calaocan, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 49 years old, married, and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, she buys and resells fruit and vegetables in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately $100 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Josephine joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, such as bananas, eggplant and other fruits and vegetables. This will be her 1st loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell such as bananas, eggplant and other fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Razia Allah Wasaiya's Group

texts.en:
Razia lives in the small Pakistani city of Kasur, which is famous for its leather industry. She is a 27-year-old housewife who spends most of her time staying at home and doing her household tasks. She is married to A. W. who runs a small restaurant in the market. In his restaurant he sells Punjabi foods such as naan chanay (made with chickpeas and served with bread) and daal chawal (made with rice and lentils and served with pickle). He has been in this business for the past seven years, during which time he has earned an advantage in the form of a healthy profit and a good customer base. From the profits of his restaurant business, he is able to manage his family's financial expenses.
Razia is a very supportive lady by nature. She supports her husband by preparing food for the restaurant so that he can better provide service to his customers. Razia has four sons and a daughter. Her eldest son works in a factory and the next son operates a tea stall in the market. Her remaining children are enrolled in school and receiving an education.
Razia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her son’s tea-stall business. With the loan amount, her son will buy items such as tea, sugar and milk in bulk. These bulk purchases will help him to serve more customers and increase his income. Razia is a regular Asasah loan user and this is her fourth loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit record and never missed a meeting.
Note: In the picture, the lady who is raising her hand is Razia.

loans.use: To buy required items for tea-stall business

loans.name: Celso

texts.en:
Celso is 50 years old. He lives in his own home with his wife and children. The family is well known in the region and very well respected. They live in Anexo Sorronto in the district of Oyotún.

Celso raises animals in his backyard. These include ducks, chickens and sheep. He has been raising animals for over ten years and is very well versed in their proper care and management. He is respected in the zone for his high quality animals.

This is his first loan with Edpyme Alternativa. He plans to use his current loan to increase his herd, make a few necessary repairs to his corrals and purchase additional feed. He appreciates the opportunity to access credit quickly in opportune times and is thankful for the reduced interest rate that the Kiva product will provide.

loans.use: To increase his herd, repair his corrals and purchase additional feed

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok L., 54, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. L. is a vegetable seller, earning an income of USD 13 per day. L. has to spend USD 90 on food and USD 45 on other necessary expenses every month.  

L. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for the family use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a motorbike

loans.name: Araceli Del Carmen

texts.en:
Araceli is thirty-nine years old. She lives, along with her husband and her two children, in the village of Espinal in Oyotun. Both of her children are minors. The family owns its small home.

For ten years now, Araceli has run a small general store out of the front of her home. She sells a wide variety of products including rice, beans, soap, toilet paper, hygiene items, beverages and candy. Her children are able to help in the business every now and again, meaning they get to learn about business.

Araceli plans to invest the funds in expanding her selection of merchandise and deepening her inventory of highly requested goods, as currently she finds that she is often unable to meet the demands of her clients. She hopes to be able to continue to expand her market share. She is very happy to be able to work independently and to care for her children.

loans.use: Purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es: Agustina, de 20 años de edad, es una valerosa madre soltera, que junto a su hijo Antony de 3 años de edad, viven en unión familiar en la casa de sus padres, ubicada en la comunidad de Sanchirio (selva central peruana). A pesar de los constantes altibajos que tuvo, logró salir adelante. Hace tres años que comenzó a cultivar el terreno agrícola que sus padres le heredaron, pues ahora ya tiene responsabilidades y motivos para salir adelante. Sus principales cultivos consta de café y plátanos, según afirma Agustina, en todo este tiempo gracias a Dios, pudo encontrar muy buenos compradores para sus cosechas, los que vende constantemente en el mercado central de su ciudad. Por su trabajo duro y buen juicio, ahora Agustina quiere seguir aumentando sus cultivos con más terrenos agrícolas. Es el primer crédito con MFP, y ya no se siente sola, pues según afirma ahora que ingresó al banco comunal más reconocido de su localidad, siente que ya tiene el apoyo económico que tanto le faltaba para hacer realidad todos sus objetivos. Es por ello que ya ha pensado invertir el crédito en la compra de 10 sacos de abono orgánico para esparcirlos en sus 2 hectáreas de café.
texts.en:
Agustina, 20 years old, is a brave single mother. She lives at her parents' home along with her 3 year-old son Antony in the village on Sanchirio (in the Central Peruvian Jungle). Despite her life's ups and downs she has succeeded. Three years ago she started planting in a lot of land given to her by her parents. Now she has responsibilities and reasons to get ahead. 

Her main crops are coffee and bananas. Agustina states that thanks to God she has always been able to find buyers for her crops. She often sells to her town's central market. For her hard work and good judgment Agustina now want to expand her crop with more land. This is her first loan with MFP. She no longer feels alone since she joined the most well known bank in her village. She feels she has the financial support she needed to make her goals a reality. She plans to invest the loan in the purchase of 10 bags of organic fertilizer to use in her 2 ha. of coffee.

loans.use: Purchase ten bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy has a mixed farm in the town of Murang'a in central Kenya. She has been farming for the last seven years and employs four farmhands. Her mixed farm produces milk and horticultural products, which she sells to the local market. She also earns income from her small-scale farming of coffee.

Lucy is 33 years old and married with four school-aged children who all attend school.

She has requested this loan of 62,400 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help her educate her children without straining. She, however, faces the challenge of price fluctuations, which affect her cash flows. She hopes to have as many cows as possible in the near future. She hopes that with Juhudi loans, she will be able to expand her dairy farming.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Enhtaivan

texts.en:
Enhtaivan B. is 57 years old and lives with his wife and son in Hovd province, Mongolia. He and his family all live together in a house with a fence. His wife is retired and collects a pension. 

Enhtaivan operates a taxi service in the local community. He began his business in 2006 and has gained a lot of business experience over this short period. His son is a driver, too. The son  works alternatively with his father. Also, during the summertime, Enhtaivan operates a deep water well. For the future he wants to buy a "Bongo" car for his son's taxi business. 

Enhtaivan is a simple and kind-hearted man. He is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan in order to make necessary repairs for his car and to buy new car for his son.

loans.use: To buy new car and to make necessary repairs on the old one

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita B. is from the village of Kinuman Norte, Ozamiz City. She is 64 years old. Nenita is widowed and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Nenita owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting root crops for sale. Nenita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Nenita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Nenita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seedlings, fertilizer and for crop maintenance. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Nenita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
He who opens a school door, closes a prison, Victor Hugo says. Marites M., 44, believes so, and knows further that children are our country's hope. Her value of education enabled her to reach college. She is now married to Danilo, a driver, and together they raise a child who is now a college student.

Marites runs a day care school and through it, she provides education to the young kids in her community. Also, she sells Ready To Wear (RTW) clothes to business connections and friends. Having been in business for 10 years at present, she quite knows the needs of her customers, particularly those of the students in her day care school. Providing these services, she gets to earn an estimated net income around PHP 10,500 every month.

To help her provide the needs of her day care school, Marites is requesting a PHP 32,000 loan. She will use this to buy necessary school supplies and other school needs. Also, she will use this money to help her pay the school bills. Her RTW business will also benefit from this loan.

Marites does not deny that there are times when the mothers of students in her school do not pay on time. But because she knows the high value of education, she will not give up just because of her present struggles. Her dream for her school is for it to have elementary levels from Grade 1 to 6. 

As a CCT community partner, she allots one hour to attend their weekly fellowship* meeting.  This is where Marites can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives and from the testimonies and real life stories shared by her co-partners among the fellowship group.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To do further furnishing of the day care school

loans.name: Charity Wanjiku

texts.en:
Charity Wanjiku M. is a 45-year-old, married woman. Her husband is Adrew Njau and together they are blessed with four children. They live in Lodwar. Charity runs a shop for selling new clothes. She has been in this business for three years and gets a monthly income of 15,500 KES. She has never borrowed from any MFI before.


This will be Charity's first loan from KADET LTD and she plans to use the entire loan to buy new clothes to sell. She will reinvest her profits back into the business. In the future, she wants to be financially stable and be able to provide for her family.

loans.use: To buy new clothes for resale

loans.name: Ma. Lilibeth

texts.en:
Ma. Lilibeth C. is 45 years old and from the town of Surallah.  She is married with five children between the ages of 19 and 11 years old.  Ma. Lilibeth owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  Her main source of business income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale.  She also raises pigs in her backyard.

Ma. Lilibeth joined Kiva partner, Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI), to access financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.  Ma. Lilibeth is requesting a new loan in the amount of 15000 PHP to purchase farm inputs and feed.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs and feed

loans.name: Rosa Yolanda

texts.es:
Rosa Yolanda A. T. tiene 31 años, es casada vive  con el esposo y con los hijos en  el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 5 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  JUNTOS TRABAJADORES AGRICOLAS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Matilde Esther  pertenece al Cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla de 9 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas de cultivos de cacao, café y naranja.

Rosa se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao, café y naranja. Compra sus productos en  Mata de Cacao cada fin de mes y los vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos para los cultivos de cacao, café y naranja.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un carro.

Le gusta dormir y jugar carnaval.
texts.en:
Rosa Yolanda A. T. is 31 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and children in the Chillanes canton, province of Bolívar. She has 5 children. 

The members of the communal bank JUNTOS TRABAJADORES AGRICOLAS [Together Farm Workers] are located in the community of Matilde Esther, which belongs to the Chillanes canton. This 9 member bank is dedicated to the agricultural work of cacao, coffee and oranges.

Rosa works in agriculture, growing cacao, coffee and oranges. She buys her materials in Mata de Cacao at the end of every month and sells at the market on Sundays in Chillanes.

She is asking for the loan to buy materials to grow cacao, coffee and oranges. The support of the loan will help her to meet her needs financially. She faces challenges such as pests and disease and weather variation. Her dream is to buy a car. 

he likes to sleep and play the games of the carnival season.

loans.use: to grow cacao, coffee and oranges

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Alejandra forma parte del banco comunal “Mapuamulen” perteneciente a la ciudad de Concepción. Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio desde hace 5 años y vende frutas y verduras.
Alejandra trabaja en un local que adaptó en el patio de su casa, ella trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario continuado. Su mercadería la compra en la vega (centro comercial de verduras), ya que es más conveniente económicamente.  
Con el préstamo comprará frutas y verduras al por mayor.
Su sueño es tener un almacén, en el cual pueda vender abarrotes, artículos de aseo, verduras, entre otros. Además de comprar un automóvil que le permita trasladar su mercadería.  Respecto a sus sueños a nivel personal es poder postular a una vivienda propia, ya que en la actualidad Alejandra, su marido y sus cuatro hijos se encuentran viviendo en situación de allegados en la casa de sus suegros. Por lo que sus motivaciones de continuar en el negocio son específicamente para concretar sus sueños y aspiraciones, de ésta manera poder brindarle a su familia un mayor bienestar.
Alejandra está muy agradecida del préstamo otorgado por Fondo esperanza, ya que con éste podrá invertir en su negocio, él cuál le será fundamental. En relación a las reuniones Alejandra se siente muy contenta y cómoda. Además las relaciones interpersonales son muy gratas.
Y con las capacitaciones ha aprendido a distribuir y organizar de mejor manera sus ingresos generados por su negocio. 
Concepción, está asentada en la desembocadura del río Bíobío, uno de los más grandes del país, al sur de Chile, en la región del Bíobío. Ha tenido una importante función en nuestra historia, siendo sede de importantes batallas y asentamiento relevante, especialmente durante la Guerra de Arauco, por estar en la frontera con territorio mapuche. Actualmente la ciudad posee un importante desarrollo económico y demográfico, llegando a ser considerada como uno de los núcleos urbanos, demográfico, administrativo, financiero y comercial más relevantes de Chile, después de Santiago y Valparaíso.
texts.en:
Alejandra is a member of the community bank “Mapuamulen” from the city of Concepción. She has worked in trade for 5 years selling fruits and vegetables. 

Alejandra works her business from the courtyard in her home. She works everyday during the week on a fixed schedule. She buys her merchandise from the market (main center for vegetables), which is more economically convenient. 

With the loan she will buy fruits and vegetables in bulk. 

Her dream is to have a store where she can sell groceries, cleaning supplies, vegetables, among others, in addition to buying a car that will allow her to transfer the merchandise. 

On a personal level, her dream is to apply for homeownership because currently Alejandra, her husband and four children are living in a situation of close friends at the home of his in-laws. Therefore, their motivation to continue in the business is specifically to realize their dreams and aspirations, in this way to provide better welfare for their family.

Alejandra is very grateful for the loan granted by Fondo Esperanza, since with it she will be able to invest in her business, which will be fundamental. With respect to the meetings, Alejandra feels very happy and comfortable and the interpersonal relationships are very pleasant. With the training she has learned to distribute and better organize her business earnings.

Concepción sits at the mouth of the Bíobío river, one of the largest in the country, south of Chile, in the Bíobío region. It has had an important function in our history, being home to major battles and important settlement, especially during the War of Arauco, being on the border with Mapuche territory. Currently, the city has an important economic and demographic development, becoming considered as one of the urban, demographic, administrative, financial and most important commercial areas in Chile, after Santiago and Valparaiso.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Leyla Vanessa

texts.es: La señora Leyla Vanessa, tiene 32 años ella es casada  y tiene tres hijos de 14, 12 y 10 años respectivamente. La señora tiene su negocio que es brindar el servicio de belleza el cual está localizado en su casa de habitación,  empezó con este negocio desde hace trece años, ahora posee buena clientela establecida. La necesidad de obtener un ingreso extra para su familia, fue lo que más motivo a Leyla a establecer este negocio pues desde la edad de 15 años ella sabía muy bien cortar cabello, fue con el paso del tiempo que logro profesionalizarse. El objetivo del crédito es invertirlo en la compra de tijeras, peines, cepillos, aceites, tratamientos, shampoo, cremas, pintura de uñas, pintura de labios y talcos. Su sueño es suplir las necesidades de su hogar y aumentar su inventario.
texts.en:
Leyla Vanessa, 32, is married and has three children who are 14, 12 and 10 years of age respectively.  She has a beauty salon installed in her home.  She started the business three years ago and now has a well-established base of regular customers.  The need to have an extra source of income for her family was what motivated her to establish the business because she’s known how to cut hair very well since the age of 15 and as time went by she managed to become professional.

The loan will be used to buy scissors, combs, brushes, oils, hair treatments, shampoo, creams, nail polish, lipsticks and talc.  Her dream is to meet her household needs and to increase inventory.

loans.use: to buy supplies and equipment for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en: Josphat is 33 years old and married with two children.  He runs a furniture workshop to earn a living.  He started the business in 1997.  In addition, he operates a green grocery for extra income.  He has been able to boost his business through Faulu Kenya, hence improving his standard of living.  He hopes to open another outlet of his business in the future.  He has requested 40,000 KES to add to his stock of timber and wood glue.

loans.use: to add to his stock of timber and wood glue.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 51-year-old mother of nine daughters and three sons. Mariam's daughters and sons are between the ages of 11 and 31 years old. Some of them have graduated already and started work, while the rest are school students.

Mariam and her husband can finally move to a house with enough rooms for their big family. Mariam took out a loan from FATEN to purchase kitchen items such as a kitchen table, wardrobes, chairs, etc., as well as to paint the house.

Mariam's husband, Mahmoud, is photographed instead as she is a conservative woman.

loans.use: to paint the house and finish the kitchen.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is from the village of Sinayawan, Valencia City, Bukidnon. She is 39 years old and widowed with 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Juliet owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling canned goods, snack foods, breads, salt in packs, shampoo, soap and noodles to the local community. Juliet has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2008, Juliet joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juliet has successfully repaid a previous loan of 16,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Juliet is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods and beverages. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Juliet from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods and beverages

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is a 50-year-old married woman with two children. Marie has worked as a tailor for 20 years and in 2009 she started her own business. Marie intended to do so because she was working hard to be independent and to provide a more comfortable life for her family.

Her sewing machines aren't modern and updated, but through a loan she's requesting from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, Marie will be capable of buying a special sewing machine in addition to a tailoring stand and necessary tailoring tools. These will definitely help in improving her quality and quantity of work.

Marie has been an Al Majmoua borrower for four consecutive cycles, and all of them reflected positively on her social and financial situation. She is also a good borrower that Al Majmoua is proud to deal with. Marie hopes to open her own atelier as soon as possible.

loans.use: To buy a special tailoring machine, a sewing stand and necessary sewing tools

loans.name: Claribet

texts.es:
Claribet forma parte del banco comunal “Eben Ezer” perteneciente a la comuna de Puente Alto, ciudad de Santiago.
Ella se dedica a vender frutas en la feria desde hace 14 años, su mercadería la compra en la vega (feria libre de frutas, verduras y abarrotes) destinada a comerciantes que compran al por mayor. 
Trabaja los días martes a domingo, en ferias libres cercanas a su domicilio, su clientela es frecuente y conserva algunos clientes antiguos. Comenta que su local está muy bien organizado, inclusive las frutas las ordena por colores y que sus frutas son de primera calidad,  razón por la cual tiene bastante clientela.
Con el crédito comprará frutas.
Sus metas son comprarse una camioneta, ya que la que utiliza para trasladar su mercadería es muy antigua del año 1968 y además quiere comprar un puesto de feria armable, consistente en fierros, lonas y plástico. 
Claribet vive junto a sus dos hijas de 26 y 30 años, además disfruta de la compañía de de sus 3 nietos de 11 y 3 años de edad y un bebé de 5 meses de edad. 
Claribet viene de una familia de comerciantes, por lo tanto disfruta mucho el rubro que realiza.
Sus motivaciones de continuar con el negocio se deben a los ingresos que recibe, lo que le permitirá brindarle a su familia una estabilidad socioeconómica, especialmente a sus nietos. 
Claribet está muy contenta y agradecida del apoyo brindado por Fondo Esperanza desde el crédito, hasta las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones del grupo del banco comunal, estos aprendizajes le han servido en su negocio para registrar sus gastos e ingresos
Desde su experiencia en las reuniones éstas han sido muy gratas, ya que se distrae, comparte con las demás socias, quienes la han acogido muy bien. 
Puente Alto es una comuna ubicada al norte de Santiago, capital de Chile. Fue fundada como un pequeño pueblo rural a fines del siglo XIX, pero dado su crecimiento demográfico es actualmente una de las comunas con mayor población de Chile, superando los 600 mil habitantes. Es la puerta de entrada a uno de los sectores precordilleranos de la región Metropolitana, conocido como el Cajón del Maipo, sector con espacios de caminatas, cabalgatas, rafting, entre otras actividades y servicios de alojamiento y alimentación.
texts.en:
Claribet is a member of the Eben Ezer community bank in Puente Alto, a suburb of Santiago.  
She has operated a produce business for 14 years.  She buys from the wholesale market at La Vega (a fruit, vegetable and grocery market).  She works near her house from Tuesdays to Sundays.  Her customers are passers-by but she has some long-standing customers, too.  She says that her shop is very well organized and that she even stocks her fruits by color.   Customers flock to her store because she stocks the best.  
Claribet will use this loan to buy fruit for her store.  She wants to buy a new delivery truck because hers is a 1968 model.  She also wants to buy a temporary stand that she can break down and move for market days.  
Claribet lives with two daughters, 26- and 30-years old, respectively.  She also has 3 grandchildren who range in age from 11-years old to just 5-months.  She comes from a family of retailers and she enjoys the work.  She likes the money she makes, too, because her income from the business supports her grandchildren and the rest of her family.
